loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam would like to take a further loan to buy more waste materials to recycle and sell. Tam's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy and sell recycled materials.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Tam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support herself. She hopes that another loan will assist her in expanding the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Leangsroy's Group

texts.en:
Leangsroy is 35 years old and married. She lives with her family in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children to look after. Three of them are school age and the youngest one is under school age. 

Rice farming is the main business of the family. To better support her family, she also plants cassava for a secondary source of income. 

Leangsroy completely repaid her first loan, and she has decided to request a second loan from VisionFund. Within this second loan, she was appointed group leader among five female members. Leangsroy used her loan portion to buy fertilizers and also to spend on farming activities such as plowing fees, labor fees and so on. She hopes to increase her profit from this loan so that she can better support her children in school with enough school supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for farming activities.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntsetseg, 51 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been collecting and selling recycled materials for more then fifteen years. Their other two children now live on their own after getting married. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy hardwood floors, vacuum-insulated windows and an iron door for her house. After installing those things, her home will be more insulated which will result in reduced coal usage as well as less air pollution in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to install vacuum-insulated windows and a hardwood floor in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in and pay for the installation of potable water.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.en:
Felista is a mother of one daughter who is employed as a teacher. She is married and is in her early 50s. 

For 20 years now, Felista has been managing a variety of businesses: a poultry business where she keeps 1,000 to 1,500 chicks per cycle, a shop selling chicken food, and also a cafeteria selling cooked food. 

Felista formerly was a normal poultry woman, but after she took her first credit from Tujijenge, she joined with a company selling chicks and chicken food to be a dealer. Now she can receive more chicks at free transport and resell to other small business people. She is really happy with Kiva's loan support. She has employed a few business helpers and her business runs from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. each working day. She is able to make a very good profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan, and she will use it to strengthen her dealership by restocking more chicks and chicken foods. Felista dreams of becoming a businesswoman with successful businesses. Felista uses her profit to plow back into her business and cover some household expenses.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group "Zawadi," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken foods.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Janet aims to improve her small retail store in order to generate a higher income and sustain the necessities of her family. She is 35 years old and has only one child. 

She wants to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demand, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Janet wants to ask for a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods to sell. Having patience and strong determination, she hopes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods to sell

location.town: Brgy. Lamo,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en: Cornelio is a carpenter by profession. He is 69 years old, married and is a full pledge member of PMPC. He earns a living with his carpentry business. In need of financial assistance, he applied for a loan to buy housing materials for his house repair. He needs more plywood, nails and angle bars. Cornelio hopes to repay his loan in a timely manner through his earnings.

loans.use: to buy housing materials for his house repair

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a mother of four lovely children, all of school-going age. She is also a farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya, where she has been doing farming for the past eight years. Her primary source of income is milk and a variety of crops. Her biggest challenge in farming is farming costs.

Joyce chose Juhudi Kilimo for this Kiva loan because they understand the need of smallholder farmers. This loan will enable her to purchase poultry that will increase egg production, and thus, lead to an increase in income. This will improve her family’s living standards, and also it will enable her to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Coop Ngiryi Nyankono&muduha3 G8 Group

texts.en:
Damascene is 44 years old. He is married with two children. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. Damascene is the group leader and is identified by the red file he holds.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet, a mother of one, manages her own retail store  to make a living. For five years in this business, she has earned good income that was capable of covering the needs of her child and was able to sustain them.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a businesswoman from Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta. She has a store that has been running for 10 years now. At the age of 54 and married, Cecilia has continually provided for her family.
 
She wants to increase her sales by increasing her inventories. In need of financial help, she applied for a loan to PMPC. She wants to restock the store with basic commodities.

She deeply wishes to support the education of her children and hopes to build a food stall someday.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, manifiesta que con el financiamiento anterior ha fortalecido su tienda y continua trabajando con la venta de pupusas, cuenta con nuevos clientes, ha cancelado sus deudas y junto a su familia disfrutan de un ambiente más agradable.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de harina, repollo, aceite, jabón, detergentes, gas propano, golosinas, pan, aderezos, bebidas, esto y más tanto para la tienda como para la pupusería.
texts.en:
Inés says that with the previous loan she has built up her store, and she continues working with selling stuffed tortillas. She has new customers, she has paid off her debts, and she and her family have a more comfortable environment.

She has opted for another loan in order to invest it in the purchase of flour, cabbage, oil, soap, detergent, propane gas, snacks, bread, seasonings, drinks, and more—for the store as well as for the tortilla business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cabbage, oil, soap, detergent, propane gas, snacks, bread, seasonings, and drinks.

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en: Kieu is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock her general store

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Samtredia. Patima and her husband both work at a private organization and have fixed salaries. However, their family has increased needs, which are hard for them to satisfy and require additional income. 

Patima requested a loan and was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start up program that gives people a chance to start their own businesses. With the loan, Patima will rent a place and open a general store at the good location of the city.  If the business is profitable, Patima hopes the family will get significant source of income from the store and their living conditions will greatly improve.

loans.use: to open a general store

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Phalla is married with three children and now lives with her family. The family has been farming rice for more than 10 years. To make additional income, Phalla sometimes works as construction worker for a labor wage. 

Phalla is a former and continuing client of VisionFund. After fully repaying her first loan, she leads a group comprised of four members to apply for another loan. Phalla spent her loan portion on rice seedlings, and the remaining money will be reserved for plowing fees. She hopes to save sufficient working capital to expand her business, thereby increasing profit to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en:
Sarum is 52 years old and a married mother blessed with five children. For the sake of family, she grows rice crops and does paid work as the main sources of income. The business that she has had for 11 years has returned her a decent income to cover the needs in her household. 

Now, she joins a group of two to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this loan cycle, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR (Cambodian riels), whereas her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and foliar spray among other products which will help her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru: Надире 39 лет, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. У Надиры средне-специальное образование, работает в школе учителем начальных классов, также с 1996 года занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве 3 дойные коровы, 8 овец и 10 коз, также в наделе есть земельный участок размером 2,0 ГА, где Надира выращивает клевер, фасоль и картофель. Реализация молока местным жителям и сельхозпродукции оптовым покупателям приносит прибыль в 13,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. Скот в летний период Надира отгоняет на джайлоо, а в зимний содержит в хозяйстве, для чего созданы все условия на территории дома. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Надира обратилась за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи, а также дать детям высшее образование.
texts.en: Nadira is 39, married, and has three children. She has a vocational education and is a primary school teacher. She has also been a farmer since 1996. She currently has three dairy cows, eight sheep, ten goats, and 2.0 hectares of land where she grows clover, beans, and potatoes. She sells milk to local residents and wholesalers and earns 13,000 som (KGS) per month. She sends the animals out to pasture in the summer and keeps them in her barn during the winter. Her spouse and children actively help her around the farm. Nadira requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) from the bank Bai-Tushum to buy a cow. Having more livestock will improve her family's living conditions and give her children a higher education.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын 50 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. У Айсалкын среднее образование, с 2000 года занимается разведением скота и земледелием. На сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве 1 дойную корову, 3 теленка, 1 быка, 20 овец и 1 лошадь, также в наделе есть земельный участок размером 3,0 ГА, где Айсалкын выращивает фасоль, малину, и где есть яблоневый сад, урожай с которого составляет в среднем 5,0 тонн яблок каждый год. Реализация молока местным жителям и сельхозпродукции оптовым покупателям приносит прибыль в 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Айсалкын обратилась за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади, для увеличения поголовья скота, а также удобрений и семян фасоли для проведения весенне-полевых работ. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи, а также приобрести легковой автомобиль.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 50 and married with four children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and farming since 2000. She now has one milking cow, three calves, one steer, 20 sheep and one horse, as well as a 3.0 hectare piece of land on which she grows beans and raspberries and has an apple orchard, the harvest from which comes to an average of 5 tons of apples annually. Selling milk to local residents and produce to wholesale buyers brings in an income of 10,000 KGS a month.

Aisalkyn has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 10,000 KGS to increase her number of livestock by buying a horse, as well as to buy fertilizers and bean seeds for the spring work in the fields. The extra animal will allow her to improve her family's living conditions, and to acquire a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a horse, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children that attend school. She owns a house that is without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a kiosk business to sell to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned that fluctuating prices are a major challenge.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She will use the loan to purchase bread, nuts, maize flour,and wheat flour to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bread, nuts, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 56 years old and a villager residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She manages cassava farming and does a paid working job as the main sources of her income. It is the business that she has had for 11 years. 

This is the second loan for Pheap with her joint borrower; they are requesting 1,200,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle progressively. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Samean lives in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is now 54 years old and has four dependents. She has supported her family by doing the farming for 20 years. She can earn 27,700 KHR (Cambodian riels) on average per day.

This is her first loan request to VisionFund. For this loan, she will use it to purchase fertilizer and seed for her rice and bean farm. She expects that the income will help her expand her business and improve her family's living standards, especially with food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed for her rice and bean farm

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Sambat lives in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is now 35 years old, married and has three children. She grows beans in order to support her family. This bean farming helps her earn 18,400 KHR (Cambodian riels) on average per day. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund. She has already completed three loans with VisionFund. She requested this loan in order to expand her business by purchasing fertilizer and seed for her bean farm. She expects that the income will help her improve the family's living standards, especially with nutrition, food, health care and education equipment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her bean farm

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin lives in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is 26 years old, married and has three children. To support her family, she works as a fruit deliverer. She earns 50,000 Cambodian riels on average per day. 

She is requesting a loan from VisionFund, which will be her seventh. She will use this amount of money to purchase equipment for her delivery service. She expects that the income will help her in improving her family's living standards, especially for clothes purchasing, nutrition, food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her fruit-delivery business

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sokly lives in the Leuk Dek district of Kandal province. She is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 dependent children. In order to support her family, she has grown corn for 10 years. She earns an average of 27,700 KHR per day.

She has completed her 4th loan with VisionFund and requests a 5th loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She expects that the income will help her to improve her family's standard of living, especially health care and food.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer for her corn crop.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Living in Lek Dek district of Kandal province. Sokly is 34 years old. She is married and has 4 dependent children. In order to support family, Sokly has been in the construction business for 6 years. She can earn an average of 33,000 KHR per day.
 
She has repaid two loans  with VisionFund already and requests a third one to expand her business and purchase construction equipment. She expects that the income will improve her family's living standard and especially help with the costs of food, health care, and business expansion.

loans.use: to buy contruction equipment.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara de 47 años de edad tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, Clara vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y sus nietos, las hijas trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, etc. por mayor y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Clara, 47 years old, has had a small store located at her residence for 7 years. She has many customers because of her varied inventory and good prices. She lives in a house she owns with her two daughters and grandchildren. Her daughters work and help her with household expenses.

Clara is requesting a loan to purchase more products, such as basic grains, cooking oil, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, etc., wholesale, so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, cooking oil, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores De Quello Quello Group

texts.es:
La socia   pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores de Quello Quello”, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Quello Quello del distrito de Pisaq de la provincia del Cusco. 
La socia Lourdes continua dedicándose a l negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia  a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura , la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manea que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animalitos.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores de Quello Quello” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the community of Quello Quello in Pisaq District, Cusco Province. 

The member, Lourdes, continues with her business raising small animals. She raises these little creatures to sell to customers who request them.  She has spent a long time engaged in this business, which is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  At the same time Lourdes continues to farm.  She is a responsible and diligent person who, in this way, helps her family to get ahead.

Lourdes is requesting the loan to purchase guinea pigs and feed for her animals.  She is grateful for the loan provided and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and feed for her small animals.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn has been engaged in a gardening business, selling vegetables in town for a living. She has been in this business for five years. Her previous loan, used to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides, has been successfully repaid and she earns a better income from it. 

To improve the farm, Merlyn took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to become successful and to be able to save a portion of her returns for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenes

texts.en:
Jenes is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, paper bags, and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. 

Jenes will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of washing soap, paper bags, and other items. Her business goal is to have a leading business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open more businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of washing soap, paper bags, and other items.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a 40-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and 3 children of 15, 13 and 5 years old in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Alejandro’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in having dinner easily or facilitating Alejandro’s children to do their homework. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as committed. 

She operates an office supply stationery shop to sell envelopes, pens and other items. She also offers photocoping services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use  20,000 KES to buy restock stationery supplies. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to restock stationery.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a 78-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and two daughters in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Cirilo’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in listening to the radio to mitigate their isolation. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Adelaido

texts.en:
Adelaido is a 43-year-old farmer who lives with his wife, 4 children, parents in law and 2 nephews in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Adelaido’s large family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in listening to the radio to mitigate their isolation. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Deybi Josué

texts.es:
Deybi de 26 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad por la actividad que realiza, él se dedica a dar mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo a computadoras y equipos de informática. Él se creció con sus padres y en la actualidad aún vive con ellos, ya que él ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a su formación académica; en la actualidad se encuentra cursando su último año de estudio en una universidad de la ciudad, estudia  3 días por semana y los demás días se dedica al trabajo de reparación y mantenimiento de equipos informáticos.

El joven tiene una experiencia de 5 años en reparar equipos de informática, ya que es una actividad que aprendió de su hermano mayor quien ahora se encuentra en estados unidos, y le enseño a trabajar y motivado por las ganancias y por su clientela decidió continuar con el negocio que su hermano dejo.

Hoy en día el joven se encuentra estudiando su último año para graduarse de técnico en sistemas y redes informáticas y de esta forma prestara un mejor servicio en su negocio que se encuentra a 6 kilómetros  del pueblo. 


El dinero será utilizado para comprar herramientas y materiales para realizar su trabajo con más eficacia y la otra parte para los gastos de graduación de su carrera, de esta forma vera sus sueños hechos realidad. 

Las proyecciones que él tiene para su futuro son las de tener un local más grande y amplio donde pueda contratar a dos personas más para prestar un mejor servicio en su negocio. 

De esta forma tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá terminar de cancelar el crédito y hacer una nueva solicitud para ampliar  y mejorar su negocio y comprar un vehículo ya que también le contratan sus servicios en centros escolares donde tiene que viajar y se le dificulta el traslado de los materiales de trabajo.
texts.en:
Deybi is 26 years old.  He is a well-known person in his community for the work he does doing preventative maintenance and fixing computers and computer equipment.  He grew up with his parents and still lives with them, since he has dedicated most of his life to his schooling.  He is currently in his last year of university in the city.  He studies three days a week and spends the other days working to repair and maintain computer equipment.  

He has five years of experience repairing computer equipment.  He learned it from his older brother, who now lives in the United States.  He taught him to work, and motivated by the profits and his customers, Deybi decided to continue the business his brother left.  He is in his last year of school to graduate with a technical degree in Computer Systems and Networks.  This will allow him to provide a better service with his business, which is located six kilometers from the town.

He will use this loan to purchase tools and materials to do his work more efficiently and to pay for the graduation costs for his degree.  This will allow him to see his dreams become a reality.  In the future, he hopes to have a larger location for his business where he can hire two more people to provide better service.  This will allow him to have better profits and he will be able to repay the loan and request a new one to expand and improve his business.  He wants to purchase a vehicle so he can also provide his services to schools he would need to travel to, since it is difficult to transport his work materials.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials to do his work more efficiently and pay for his graduation costs.

loans.name: Belarmino

texts.en:
Belarmino is a 33-year-old farmer who lives with his wife in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Belarmino and his wife with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, such as cooking. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 61-year-old farmer who lives with his wife in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Benjamin and his wife with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in listening to the radio to mitigate their isolation. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 33-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and 17-year-old son in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. She has decided to improve her family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.
This SSHS will provide Angelica’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks such as cooking or having dinner easily. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this housewife pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in her house.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Demetrio is a 34-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and 4 children of 12, 10 (2) and 8 years old in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.
This SSHS will provide Demetrio’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks such as cooking or having dinner easily. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Silviano

texts.en:
Silviano is a 46-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and 4 children of 20, 17, 16 and 14 years old in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.
This SSHS will provide Silviano’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks such as cooking or reading, as well as in facilitating Silviano’s children to do their homework. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.en:
Honorato is a 56-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and 19-year-old daughter in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.
This SSHS will provide Honorato’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks such as preparing coffee beans, cooking, reading, studying... Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay is a motor operator who manages several units of motorcycles for public transport. At the age of 30, she armed herself with courage to withstand the trials of managing a business. This is how she provides for her family. 

Jay thought to expand her business by adding another second-hand unit. She applied for a loan to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for this financial need. 

Jay smiles at the fact that having a business requires determination and sincerity in the timely payment of her coop obligations.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motor unit.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a businessman who sells a variety of items. He provides for his family with a retail business. 

Alfredo is 74 years old, married and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. He applied for a loan with PMPC and desires to have his house repaired. He wants to purchase housing materials like hollow blocks and cement. Alfredo hopes to repay his obligations on time to PMPC with his earnings from his retail business.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials like hollow blocks and cement.

loans.name: Mela

texts.en:
Mela is married with four children. She manages the family's vegetable farm, while her husband earns an income as a private driver. She has worked in her garden for more than six years and earns enough money to meet the basic needs of her children. 

With her generated income, her previous loan was successfully repaid and was used to buy farm supplies. To prepare for the next planting season, she requests a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She hopes to be successful  and use her earnings to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ruben Darìo

texts.es:
Rubén es un veterano de mucha experiencia en el campo de la producción de lácteos, tiene 65 años y vive solo.
Actualmente está dedicado a la producción y venta de queso que el mismo prepara en su casa.
Tiene algunas vacas y aprovecha su leche para preparar el producto y posteriormente venderlo en Tierra Alta, Córdoba.
El solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos insumos esenciales como sal y algunos aditivos y adicional necesita comprar una canoa de madera para preparar allí sus mezclas. Esto le permitirá contar con un capital mas grande y podrá aumentar sus ventas de una manera significativa impactando positivamente su economía.
texts.en: Rubén is a veteran with a lot of experience in the field of dairy production. He is 65 years old and lives alone. Currently he works in the production and sale of cheese, which he prepares in his house. He has some cows and he uses their milk to prepare the product and later sell it in Tierra Alta, Cordoba. He is requesting financial support to buy some essential inputs such as salt and some additives. Also he needs to buy a wooden canoe, where he will prepare his mixtures. This will allow him to have a larger capital and be able to increase his sales in a significant way making a positive difference in his finances.

loans.use: To buy inputs such as natural additives and a canoe in order to make his preparations.

loans.name: Cooproriz Ngiryi Ruhabyo G9 Group

texts.en:
Callixte is 40 years old. He will use a Kiva loan to cover the labor costs and purchase fertilizer for rice production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and fluctuating prices. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 

Callixte is shown in the photo holding a red file, as a sign of identification from his fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 51 años de edad, es un agricultor muy esmerado con sus 7 hijos trabaja duro la tierra y su esposa  es su apoyo para todo. Comenta Francisco que le gusta trabajar desde que amanece hasta que el sol se oculta con la satisfacción, de haber hecho algo mas por sus hijos y su esposa, sabe que al final el esfuerzo es recompensado con creces cuando de la tierra obtiene el fruto de su propio esfuerzo que día a día gana con el sudor de su frente, ser agricultor le llena de orgullo porque sabe que puede proveer a su familia de los alimentos y vender parte de este. 


 Francisco menciona que siempre su vida ha sido trabajar labrando la tierra sembrando granos básicos en su pequeña parcela de donde obtiene maíz y frijol para su consumo y para la venta, parte de su producción se vende cuando el precio de los granos básicos aumenta.


El préstamo se empleara para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra, para la siembra de granos básicos de la temporada que esta por comenzar, ya que  necesita los recursos para  realizar su labor, de la cual dependen sus ingresos y para el consumo del hogar.


Desea para un futuro primero que todo crecer en su producción y mejorar su calidad de vida, pero sobre todo ver que sus hijos aun pequeños los pueda ver crecer junto a él y su esposa, trabajando juntos sus  hijos y él lograran salir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco, 51 years old, is a farmer who is very dedicated to working the land with the help of his 7 children and wife, who is his support in everything he does. Francisco likes to work from the moment he wakes up until the sun goes down. He is satisfied to have been working to support his wife and children.  He knows that his hard work will be rewarded with increased production when the fruit of his labor is ready. To be a farmer fills Francisco with pride because he knows that he can provide for his family by growing and selling his crops.

Francisco mentions that he has worked on the land his whole life growing basic grains on his small parcel of land from which he obtains corn and beans to consume and sell. He reserves a portion of his crops to sell once the price of these grains has risen.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers, seeds, composts, pesticides, weed killer, and to pay for labor to sow his seasonal grains in the upcoming season. Francisco needs these resources in order to complete his labor, on which his income and household depend.

For the future, Francisco hopes that his production will grow and his quality of life will improve. Above all, he hopes to watch his young children grow up and to work alongside his wife to move forward.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, composts, pesticides, weed killer, and to pay for labor to sow his seasonal grains in the upcoming season.

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en:
Khin is a 35-year-old  married woman blessed with two school-aged children. She is a resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where her cassava is grown. It is the business that she has had for 17 years. 

Khin has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six loans and has a successful repayment history. The past loans have enabled her to support her business and to provide sufficient food for her children. She hopes that she can gain a  better yield than in previous years.  

For this cycle, she is the group's leader and will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing and reaping fees and buy fertilizer and insecticide.

She  hopes that she can double the yield and expand her cassava farming on a larger scale.

loans.use: to pay the plowing and reaping fees and purchase fertilizer and  insecticide.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 46-year-old married man with 8 children who are  20,17,15,12, 10, 8, 5, 4 years old. He is a produce dealer who has dealt in coffee processing, beans, and maize  since 2001.  He also grows bananas and coffee to earn an extra income for the family. 

He works 7 days a week and 10 hours per day. He usually sells his products to people at a local trading centers. He is motivated by the fact that the business required little capital and there was also a market for the products.

He acquired this loan in order to boost his produce business by  restocking  maize and beans and using a little of the money to buy mulch for the cofffee plantation. 

His hope and dreams are to be the leading supplier of coffee to the Kamaggwa trading center. He however faces challenges of fluctuating price and unfavorable weather conditions (like too much sunshine) which affect his crops.

He is described as an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates lenders for the services they offer to their clients.

loans.use: to buy produce for trade.

loans.name: At

texts.en:
At is a married mother with four children.  She is 42 years old and needs to take care of two of her children who attend school.

She has grown rice to support her family for seven years. She also grows cassava to make additional income. 

She requests this second loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cassava farm. She will also use the remaining money to cover the plowing fee. 

At hopes to increase her income so that she can save money to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and buy fertilizer and seeds.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maupulu

texts.en: Maupulu is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She makes and sells Samoan earrings, bangles, kava bowls, and Samoan weapons to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. Maupulu has requested a loan to buy kava bowls, Samoan weapons, elei materials, pandana leaves, earrings, bangles and tapa cloth. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy kava bowls, Samoan weapons, elei materials, pandana leaves, earrings, bangles and tapa cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy windows and install closets in her home.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa se dedica a la venta de literatura, a diario sale a las calles a ofrecer su producto, de este negocio mantiene sus gastos básicos. Teresa solicita el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar construyendo pared lateral de su casa, lo que ha venido realizando por etapas, esperando en esta ocasión poder terminar la obra que le permitirá gozar de un mejor entorno en su vivienda junto a su familia.
texts.en: Teresa earns her living selling books, magazines, and newspapers. Everyday, she goes out into the streets to sell her product. This business provides for basic needs. Teresa is seeking a loan to improve the conditions of her home. She wants to build a wall on the side of her house. She has been carrying out the work in stages and is hoping to finish the work so that she can enjoy a better environment in her home with her family.

loans.use: to continue replacing a wooden wall with concrete

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Maria, ha encontrado en su negocio una nueva forma de salir adelante, ella ha recibido el apoyo de su esposo y de su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad, ella desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a la venta de Cosméticos, este crédito lo solicita para invertir en su negocio donde compra perfumes, Maquillaje para Damas, Cremas para cuidado de Piel y Cabello. espera obtener  mayor ganancias en su negocio para poder así mejorar sus condiciones de Vida, Agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Maria has discovered that her business is a new way to make progress in life. She has the support of her husband and her son who has already come of age. For many years, she has earned her living selling cosmetics. This business requires her to invest and to buy perfumes, cosmetics, skin care creams, and hair products. She expects higher profits in her business to improve her living conditions. She is grateful to the support she has received from Kiva and AFODENIC.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, sugar, and wheat flour

loans.name: Reulita

texts.en: Reulita is a 52-year-old mother who was gifted with a child. She owns and manages a variety store while her husband operates their welding and vulcanizing shop. To generate a higher income, Reulita aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. With this regard, Reulita wants to avail a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy  more stocks of soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, seasonings, beverages and used clothes to sell. She believes that this loan request will allow her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, seasonings, beverages and used clothes to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, está soltero, vive con su madre y dos sobrinos, con los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio que es el cultivo de granos básicos para consumo familiar y vender a sus clientes puede cubrir los gastos de la familia, cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 1:30 p.m.
Comprará abono, semilla, fertilizantes e insecticidas, se dispondrá a invertir el capital en los materiales más básicos para preparar el terreno y efectuar la siembra de maíz y frijol, espera aumentar la producción, mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, resarcir la deuda lo más pronto posible y brindar a su familia una mejor alimentación, educación y vestuario.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mantener su negocio activo, mejorar su situación económica y apoyar a sus sobrinos a superarse con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Miguel is single and lives with his mom and nephews. His business is growing and selling basic grains for everyday use to cover family expenses, and he depends on his 20 years of experience and works from 6 A.M. to 1:30 P.M. He will buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and he will have the capital available to invest in the most basic materials to prepare the land and sow corn and beans. He hopes to increase production, improve his sales and income, pay his debt as soon as possible, and afford his family better food, education, and clothing. His dream is to continue working to keep his business active, improve his economic situation, and support his nephews in improving themselves with a college degree.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Rebeca Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Rebeca es una laboriosa e incansable mujer que toda la vida a luchado por sus hijos y ha hecho hasta lo imposible por darles unja garantía de vida, aunque sus hijos ya son adultos, ella siente la necesidad de seguir apoyándolos.
Hoy en día trabaja en un pequeño puesto en el que vende frutas y verduras al por menor y con esta actividad se ha estado sosteniendo durante mucho tiempo.
Pero los tiempos son difíciles y en muchas ocasiones despiadados, tanto así que ha quedado en ruina en varias ocasiones y tenido el coraje para volverse a levantar.
Actualmente solicita un auxilio económico para comprar surtido de alimentos como frutas y verduras para poder realizar sus ventas y adquirir un mejor nivel de ingresos con los cuales pueda cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Sra. Rebeca is a tireless, hardworking woman who has struggled all of her life on behalf of her children. She has done everything possible to give them a secure life and although her children are now adults, she feels the need to continue nurturing them.

Nowadays she works at a small stall where she sells fruits and vegetables retail and through this business she has been supporting herself for a long time. However times are difficult and often cut-throat and ruthless, so much so that she has been left in ruin on various occasions and had the courage to get up again.

Currently, she is requesting financial help in order to purchase food supplies, such as fruit and vegetables, so that she can make her sales, earn more income and be able to cover her basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of food, such as fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell quequisque, a local root plant

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 56 years old, has five children, and married to Jose who is a staff at the Local Government Unit. They peacefully live at Baggao. To gain income, she is selling clothes, shampoos, soaps, toothpaste, bags, and shoes. She has been in her business for over five years and had improved her house with her income. 

She was able to dispose of most of her products, that is why she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more products, such as colognes, shampoos, perfumes, and underwear to resell. 

She sells her products to the people in her village, especially employed individuals. She will keep her profits to use for education purposes and family’s daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more products, such as colognes, shampoos, perfumes, and underwear to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sands, nails, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for her family

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel has been growing and harvesting mangoes to sell in town. She has had this business for more than seven years and this is the primary source of income for the family. She also buys more mangoes in their neighboring town, to resell it in bulk. With her generated income, Raquel was able to sustain their daily expenditures. 

Raquel took a new loan recently to buy more mangoes to resell. Raquel is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and will enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Feria libre, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, de un centro histórico el cual es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, tiene varios lugares en donde se puede gozar de la naturaleza. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad que en el existe y porque los créditos le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia.
La Señora Rosa tiene 66 años de edad, es separada de su esposo pero en su unión ha concebido 10 hijos de los cuales 6 son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente,  su última hija estudia en la universidad,  la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de granos tiernos y legumbres, también se dedica a la cría de pollos. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, gallinas de postura, alimento para animales y semillas para sus cultivos. Su sueño es que todos sus hijos cuenten con un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Rosa is a founding member of her loan group Feria Libre. The members live in Cuenca which enjoys a cool climate. Its historic centre has been recognized as a World Heritage Site. The town has four rivers and several places where people can go to enjoy nature. María Rosa enjoys being part of her group because of its commitment and because the loans have allowed them and their families to get ahead.

She is 66 years old, separated from her husband, and has 10 children, 6 of whom are married and live independently. Her unmarried children have jobs and help her financially. Her youngest daughter is a university student.  María Rosa owns the house where she lives.

She works in agriculture selling various types of vegetables. She also raises chickens. María Rosa plans to use the loan money to buy different breeds of chickens, animal feed, and seeds for her fields. Her dream is for her children to have their own businesses.

loans.use: Buy different breeds of chickens, animal feed, and seeds

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Wenifreda is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Wenifreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dozens of spoons, pans, plates, baskets, and bales of used clothing

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Memunatu. She is married, and has 3 children aged 17, 14, and 7 years. In 2007, Memunatu established her food (groundnut, vegetable oil, assorted rice) business. She began her business because she was brought up by her aunty who did not allow her to go to school. Her aunt was petty trader and her business was the only source of income. She joined in the petty trading business till she was mature enough to stand on her own. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 805,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Memunatu requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and packets of pure water her business. In the future, Memunatu plans to build her own dwelling house, build a bigger shop and give quality education to the children. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. This business has helped her in raising her children. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will save enough for her retirement age. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and packets of pure water her business.

loans.name: Osman M

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Osman. He is married and has three children, aged 9, 6, and 3 years; all are school-going children. 

In 2004, Osman established his used outer tires business. He began his business because he dropped out of school as a result the past Rebel War in the country. He went to a mining area but he did not succeed. He joined tire patching and the money he gathered was used to start his own used tire business.

Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,080,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Osman requires the loan in order to buy different sizes of used tires. 

In the future, Osman plans to build a house and educate his children. The loan will help him improve his business. His main challenge is getting his customers pay their debt on time. He is hardworking and ambitious. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Osman requires a loan in order to buy different sizes of used tires.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, 30 years old, is married and has 2 children, aged 5 and 9 years. In 2012, Hawa established her cold drinks (bar) business because she had been trained as a businesswoman. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours hours a day, Hawa earns about SLL 500,000 monthly from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to buy more drinks of different kinds for resale. In the future, Hawa plans to educate her children to university level. She is very hardworking and friendly. Hawa thanks you for your support to her family and wishes you well.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Aida Milena

texts.es:
Aida es una joven mujer de 25 años con muchas aspiraciones y metas.
Ella vive con sus padres a los cuales agradece todo lo que es en este momento.
Ella planea inicias un negocio de venta de ropa, esta actividad la inicia de manera empírica y surge con la motivación de generar más ingresos para su familia.
El gran problema es que no tiene el capital para iniciar con su proyecto y tiene la ilusión de poder comprar un buen surtido de prendas de vestir para venderlas al por menor.
Planea iniciar sus ventas con las personas más conocidas pero luego desea tener un gran almacén donde pueda exhibir y vender su mercancía.
Al obtener este capital de trabajo podrá darles bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres, además podrá realizar planes futuros.
texts.en:
Aida is a young woman, 25 years of age, with lots of aspirations and goals. She lives with her parents who appreciate all that she is in this moment. Aida plans to open a store for selling clothing. This she will do in an empirical manner. Aida is determined to generate more income for her family.

The great problem is that she lacks capital to initiate her project. Aida dreams of being able to purchase a good selection of clothing items to sell at retail. She intends to start selling among the people she knows best, but later, she hopes to have a large store where she can exhibit and sell her merchandise.

Upon obtaining this working capital, Aida will be able to offer well-being and a better quality of life to her parents, and to realize her future plans.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothing items to begin retail sales.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet with Kadiatu, who is 26 now.  She is married and has two children, age 7 and 4. 

In 2012, Kadiatu established her set dishes, flasks, stainless steel and enamel wares business. At some point in Kadiatu’s life, she noticed her husband was the sole source of income for the family so she decided to start this business to help her husband support their children. 

Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy additional set dishes, flasks, stainless steel and enamel ware. In the future, Kadiatu plans to be a supplier and to give her children a sound education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for set dishes, flasks, stainless steel and enamel ware.

loans.name: Phean

texts.en:
Phean is 35 years old and a married mother of two children. The family lives in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. The family has been farming rice and cassava for more then ten years. 

Introduced by a loan officer, Phean decided to request her first loan with VisionFund Cambodia to spend on her farming business, such as buying cassava seeds and paying for plowing fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and cassava seeds.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 43 years old and she is runs a tailoring business in front of her house. She will use the loan to  fix the sewing machine.She is making good money from her business and wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.
Celestina is living in a town near the school, so her tailoring business is located in strategic place where many people come to sew clothing including students.

loans.use: To fix the sewing machine,

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is an Andean jewelry artisan who works with silver and gemstones. He wants to purchase raw materials for his original jewelry designs.

Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"Ever since I can remember, I've always enjoyed painting and designing, so I studied graphic design. However, my wife and her family have been crafting jewelry for generations, and slowly I started designing jewelry. Soon it became my passion. My wife enjoys practicing the techniques her father taught her and eventually we realized it was better to leave the crafting to her and the designing to me. We only get one life to live, and that's why my constant challenge is to succeed every day a little bit more so I can provide a better future for my wife and family."

"I want to express my gratitude to everyone who is helping to fund this microcredit. Please know that I'll use it to buy materials and craft more designs so as to have them all in stock. Thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Antonio's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8656

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his original jewelry designs

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Ricardo lleva muchos años dedicándose al trabajo de Tierra con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos actualmente el tiene como prioridad la construcción de su vivienda, su esposa labora para una hospital publico quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, este crédito lo solicita para comprar Materiales como, cemento, arena, bloques ya que realizara modificaciones en la fachada de la casa, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le ha brindado.
texts.en: Ricardo has earned his living working the land. He supports his wife and children and currently gives priority to the construction of their home. His wife works for a public hospital which helps with household expenses. He is requesting this loan to buy materials like cement, sand, blocks, and more to undertake changes to the front of his house. He thanks Kiva and AFODENIC for the support they provide.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various goods and a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and motor oil

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is a fish-vendor in Oroquieta City. She is 74 years old, married, and a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She signed up her membership with the Cooperative for her capital needs. 

Recently, she wanted to purchase more kilos of fish to sell. Bobby is confident of repaying her loan in a timely fashion. She hopes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widowed woman with 12 children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Mbodze has operated a shop kiosk business for the last five years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Mbodze wants to purchase sugar, salt, wheat flour, and maize flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, wheat flour, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Lucila Dalila

texts.es:
Lucila de 27 años de edad, es una mujer primogénita de una familia numerosa de 9 hermanos los cuales se crecieron muy juntos, bajo el cuidado de sus padres los cuales, le enseñaron muy buenos principios, donde prevalecía el amor y la verdad; No obstante, también le enseñaron a creer en Dios y su justicia puesto que por ser la primera tubo que ayudar a crecer a sus demás hermanos, esto la convierte en la segunda madre, pero nos comentaba ha sido difícil enfrentarme a la vida y luchar junto a sus padres para lograr crecer a sus otros hermanos pero siempre tuve la confianza puesta en Dios.

Sus  padres están todavía junto a ella y algunos de sus  hermanos, pero la vida les ha dado satisfacciones que le llenan de felicidad al saber que ayudo a crecer a sus hermanos menores apoyando a sus padres en todo. 

Lucia es empleada de gobierno y trabaja en la unidad de salud de la localidad, desde que trabaja en este lugar su familia mejoro notablemente, esto vino a potenciar la calidad de vida de su familia,  comenta que para mejorar su vivienda y comprar algunos enseres de su casa ha tenido que luchar mucho para que poco a poco las cosas vayan cambiando en su humilde vivienda.


El préstamo se empleara para el pago de una deuda contraída, por el caso antes mencionado ya que se necesito de un préstamo para la compra de algunos enseres del hogar y ahora se deben cancelar.


 Sus planes para el futuro son construir una vivienda de bloque, ya que la que actualmente posee es de Bahareque y  comenta que tiene en su corazón el deseo de construir su casa en donde sus padres puedan vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Lucila is the eldest daughter of a large family of 9 siblings who grew up close together under the care of their parents, who taught them very good principles, of which love and truthfulness are first and foremost. However, they also taught them to believe in God, and in his fairness. 

Being the eldest, she had to help raise her other siblings, and this has transformed her into a second mother. However, she says that it has been difficult to confront life and fight alongside her parents to raise her other siblings, but that she has always put her trust in God. Her parents are together with her still, and some of her siblings; but life has given them satisfactions that fill her with happiness, knowing that she has helped to raise her younger siblings, supporting her parents in everything.

Lucila is a government employee, and she works in the local Health Unit. Since she has been working there, things have improved noticeably for her family and this has made their quality of life better. She comments that she has had to struggle in order to improve her home and to purchase some basic household equipment, so that little by little, things would continue changing in her simple home.

The loan will be used for the repayment of a debt incurred, as she needed a loan for the purchase of the basic household equipment mentioned above, which is now due.

Her plans for the future are to construct a masonry-block house, as the one she currently has is wattle and daub; and she comments that in her heart she has the desire to build a home for her parents where they could live with dignity.

loans.use: to pay off a loan that was used for the purchase of some basic household equipment for her home, which is now due.

loans.name: Lorena Concepción

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años de edad, es una persona que le gusta trabajar  para su familia y contribuir a sus ingresos para el hogar, sus padres quienes le enseñaron a cuidar ganado, fueron ellos quienes  la intuyeron por los senderos del bien, asi  fue como ella a prendió a luchar por la vida. Su esposo  que también le encanta los trabajos campesinos trabaja arduamente para cuidar el ganado de su esposa,  de sus tres hijos, dos de ellos son adolescentes y uno es menor de edad todos juntos coordinan sus trabajos para seguir luchando y salir adelante en todo.


Lorena se creció en una familia campesina que le gustaba trabajar mucho en la crianza de animales bovinos y traspatios,ella tiene mucho conocimiento sobre animales bovinos,  fue así donde adquirió mucha experiencia , ella dice que el trabajo no es solo del hombre si no de ambos. 


El préstamo se empleara en la compra de un terreno, ya que el hato de animales ha ido creciendo cada día y necesitan tener un lugar mas amplio para seguir trabajando con sus animales.

Lorena  planea en tener un exitosa ganadería con raza seleccionada en leche  y poder distribuir algunos productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Lorena, 31, is a person who likes to work for her family and contribute to her household's income. Her parents taught her how to look after cattle. They her how to follow the right path and work hard to succeed in life. Her husband also loves working. He's a hardworking farmer who looks after his wife's cattle. 

Their three children, two of whom are teenagers and one who is still young, coordinate working together to keep working and succeed in everything. 

Lorena grew up in a peasant family who liked to work hard raising cattle and in their gardens. She has an extensive knowledge of bovine creatures and a lot of experience. She says that the work is not just a man's but for both of them. 

The loan will be used to purchase land for the herd of animals that has been growing daily will need a larger pasture to continue their work.
Lorena plans on having a successful herd to selectively breed and to distribute their milk and some dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase pasture land for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, re-bar, cinder blocks, sand, zinc laminate and wood.

loans.name: Hushnuda

texts.en:
Hushnuda is 25 years old, married and has two children. Hushanuda livea with her family in a rural area and has a good opportunity to develop an agriculture business. Hushnuda raises crops and vegetables,which she has been doing for more than five years.  Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Last season Hushnuda did not get a good harvest and does have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers for new sowing. She is requesting a loan for 2,500 Somoni, which she will use to buy mineral fertilizers. She hopes that this season she will get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and resell small bags for wrapping purchases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm nuts to transform into palm oil.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 43-year-old man from Kisumu town, which is found in the Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. He is married and has three children to support. His children are six, nine, and 16 years old. For the past four years, Robert has been operating a shop where he sells sporting goods. He generates a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Robert has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya LTD to buy more sports clothes,balls and other bulk shop items for sale. 


He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his business. Robert’s dream is to have a big business and support his family.

loans.use: to buy more sports clothes,balls

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married and together they are blessed with five children. 

She has been in the retail business for over nine years now. She currently makes a monthly income of KES 40,000. She would like a loan of KES 49,000 through which she will buy stock like sufurias, dishes, and soups, and also pay for her children's school fees.

From the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children. She dreams of her children having a good education.

loans.use: to add stock like sufurias, dishes, and cups; and also to pay for school fees

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old lady from Katito region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She sells new clothes, a business she has been doing for the last five years. The business generates a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She has applied for her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more clothes for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop for clothes and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Desterio

texts.en:
Desterio is a 31-year-old man from Shikoti in Kakamega region which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is a married man with two children who are two and four years old.

He has been motorcycle business for the last ten years and gets a monthly income of KES 12,000. He has applied for his first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to buy spare parts and repair his motorbike.He will use the anticipated income to put back into the business.

Desterio has a dream of developing his business so as to become more strong to help him support his family.

loans.use: to do repair for his motorbike

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 28 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей.У Динары только положительные отзывы и репутация. Она работает учителем в школе, очень доброжелательная и целеустремленная. С 1990 года Динара начала заниматься животноводческой деятельностью, стартовав с 8,000 сом (KGS), Динара сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 10,000 сом (KGS). В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец и 2 лошади. В целях расширения своего хозяйства Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), на полученные денежные средства она намерена купить корову, что позволит увеличить объемы продаваемого молока и молочной продукции. Динара планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и хочет приобрести для дома кухонный гарнитур.
texts.en: Dinara is 28, married, and has two children. She has a good reputation and people only have positive things to say about her. She is very friendly and hard-working and works as a teacher. Dinara began raising livestock in 1990 when she started out with 8,000 som (KGS). Dinara has been able to expand her business so that her monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). She currently has two dairy cows, ten sheep, and two horses. In order to continue expanding her farm, Dinara applied with the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow so that she can sell more milk and dairy products. She plans to reinvest the profits in her farm and to buy a kitchen set.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Banadurga Group

texts.en:
Mathua is the leader of a group that hails from J.K.Pur, Rayagada, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 30 years. She has a small family of five members: her husband; one son, age 27; and two daughters, ages 8 and 10. The member standing second from left with a raised hand is Mathua. 

Mathua set up her cottage industry making and selling leaf plates in the market. Her husband drives a rented auto rickshaw in the town and earns their livelihood. Although he earns about 500 Indian rupees (INR) per day, he has to pay 300 INR per day to the owner of the auto rickshaw.
