Having been through tremendous trials and tribulations herself, Mathua along with another three members of her locality formed a group to avail a loan and improve their businesses. It is their first loan for development of their existing businesses. At present, Mathua's family income is 6,500 INR per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. So, she wants to take out a loan to purchase an auto rickshaw to increase her earnings. She has a cherished desire to run a standing business and purchase an auto rickshaw.

The other three members, named Saraswati, Membati and Basanti, have businesses selling vegetables, running an auto rickshaw and selling fruits respectively.

loans.use: to purchase an auto rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is divorced and does not have children. She lives with her mother. Zulfiya is a woman of higher education. 

She works as a teacher in a college. Also, she has a business. She buys fabrics, sews national women's dresses, and sells them in a local market. She has experienced a lot of life's difficulties. At first, it was so difficult for her to manage with a business. Little by little, Zulfiya adapted herself to working hard. Now, she runs her business well. 

Zulfiya is going to increase working capital and, in this way, to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 (somoni) to buy fabrics to sell, to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell, to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda's primary source of income comes from selling grocery items to the people in her village. She is 26 years old, married to Alexis, and they have a child. Her spouse's income comes from rice farming. To increase her sales, she is now asking for additional working capital of P15,000 to add to her merchandise. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, bread, eggs, and school supplies to sell. She hopes to keep improving her sales and earn good profits daily in order to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, bread, eggs, and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Samex's Group

texts.en:
Samex is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school and under her support. Samex has been farming rice for more than 30 years. She also works as a construction worker for labor wage. 

Samex is a return client of VisionFund. Having completely repaid her previous loans, Samex is now leading a group of three members to apply for another loan. She hopes to get her loan portion in order to pay plowing fees for her rice farm. She hopes this year the rice yield is higher, enabling her to generate more income so that she can continue to send her three kids to school.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Datkaym

texts.ru: Даткайм 50 лет, она замужем и имеет 5 детей. У Даткайм средне-специальное образование, с 1991 года занимается животноводческой деятельностью. На сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь. Реализация молока местным жителям приносит прибыль в 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц. Для содержания скота есть все условия, заготовлены корм и сено. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Даткайм обратилась за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Увеличение поголовья скота позволит улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи, а также приобрести ворота для дома.
texts.en:
Datkaym is 50 years old, and married with five children. She has a high school vocational degree and has been raising livestock since 1991. She now has two dairy cows and one horse. She sells milk to the locals, bringing in a profit of 10,000 KGS monthly. 

Datkaym has everything needed for her cattle, including feed and hay. Her husband and children help her in her business. Datkaym is taking a loan of 50,000 KGS from micro-finance bank, Bai-Tushum, to buy a cow. She believes that increasing her herd will improve her family's living conditions, and enable her to purchase a gate for her house.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 52 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mila has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Mila has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Mila would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Naser Milkat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Naser Milkat. It is comprised of five women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Izia is a 30-year-old, married woman. She is the leader of the group. Izia lives with her family, in their own house. She is very dynamic and vigorous, and she works as a housewife. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he was able to accumulate a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. Izia supported him, with a lot of her own money. Some years ago, Izia and her husband built their own house on the land that they had bought. Now, the family lives in their own house, but it is not renovated from the inside and it needs paint. As a result, Izia is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase paint, in order to renovate the house from the inside.

Izia looks forward to building the second floor and renovating the house, in order to rent out the first floor.

loans.use: to purchase paint for her family's home.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en: Ebrahim has an electronic shop in Monvrovia whee he sells video's, radio's, phones, and other electronics.  He is seeking a $400 Kiva loan to purchase 20 clean cookstoves at cost to sell to his customers.  He is also interested in expanding into the solar products as well.  Ebrahim  also likes the idea of building his Kiva credit so that he can apply for other business loans in the future.

loans.use: To purchase Sustainable Energy for ALL (SE4AALL) products at wholesale to sell directly to customers for profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foliar spray. manure and fertilizer to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ahila

texts.en:
Ahila is 55 years old and is married with a daughter and three sons. The members of family are refugees and live in an internally displaced people's settlement. Her husband is a taxi driver but the main source of the family’s income is husbandry. She has been breeding cows for 30 years and her monthly income is 120 AZN.

Ahila has two cows; she raises and fattens them. Then she makes diary products (butter, milk, cheese, yoghurt) and sells them at the local bazaar. People have high demand for diary products because they are very useful for health. They buy these products every day. 

Ahila has to repair the cows' stable and buy good corn for cattle. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to purchase quality fertilizers for grass and increase cattle’s productivity.

loans.use: to purchase quality fertilizers for grass and increase cattle’s productivity.

loans.name: Diloromkhon

texts.en:
Diloromkhon is 41 years old. She is divorced and is bringing up five children. Diloromkhon is the only person providing food for her five children. She is a business woman. Diloromkhon sells a variety of fabrics. She stores her goods in a local market. She has been busy with this business for more than 10 years. She works hard but her family living conditions are poor because her business is the only source of income for the family. Her two elder daughters are students and others are schoolboys. 

Diloromkhon is going to increase her working capital and in this way, maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy a variety of fabrics to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and purchase a new computer

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: María tiene 48 años de edad y  es madre soltera de tres hijos de 26 años de edad, quien ya se encuentra trabajando, 15 años y 12 años de edad. María es una mujer trabajadora quien se dedica al cultivo y venta de espinaca y además es empleada en una pupuseria. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de terminar su vivienda solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para construir el techo e instalar las puertas y ventanas. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, polines, madera, puertas y ventanas.
texts.en: María is 48 and is a single mother to three children: one aged 26, who is in work, one aged 15 and one aged 12. She is a hard-working woman who grows and sells spinach and she also works in a tortilla shop. This is how she makes a living and earns enough to keep the home going.  She wants to get a loan through FUSAI to finish her house, as she hasn't got the necessary money to build the roof and put in windows and doors. She intends to use the loan to buy galvanised sheeting, poles, wood, doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheeting, poles, wood, doors and windows in order to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: Arnel is a single entrepreneur who runs a general store to make a living. With his generated income, he was able to support his parents and successfully repay his previous loan used for the business. To improve sales, he took another loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Arnel wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has four children and lives in Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a general store selling goods in the local community, which she has been doing for three years. 

Teresita requested a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, and spices. She plans to expand her store in order to earn more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Genna Marie

texts.en:
Genna Marie, a mother of three children, operates her own farm to make a living. For two years, she has earned enough to provide for the family. She plans to improve the farm in order to send her children to school. She has to be more active as her husband has passed away. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future she wants to provide good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Girlie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Girlie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Girlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, one of whom goes to school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Christine operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Om Acram** Group

texts.en:
Om Acram** is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Sabera is the leader of the group. She is a 54-year-old married woman with 9 children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest one is 18 years old. Sabera works as a dressmaker inside her house. She started in this business more than ten years ago in order to help her husband with the expenses of the family. The money that she earns from this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Sabera says that her house lacks many of home appliances and furniture that she can't afford. Unfortunately, she didn't have enough money to furnish the house. For this reason, Sabera is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a bed for the home.

Sabera looks forward to improving the condition of her family. Her dreams in the future are to furnish her house with new furniture and home appliances. She hopes to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a bed for the home.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a widow with eight children, three in school, one under school age, and four adults.

Mbodze has operated a charcoal selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Анары- среднее образование, животноводством занимается с 1990 года, стартовав с покупки скота на 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 13 овец и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет свыше 15,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока и молочной продукции. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Анара планирует вложить доходы от кредита в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Anara is 32 years old, and married with two children. She has a high school education. Anara has raised livestock since 1990, starting with an initial purchase of cattle for 7,000 KGS.

Thanks to her hard work, she now has two dairy cows, 13 sheep and two horses. Her monthly income from selling milk and dairy products is more than 15,000 KGS.

Anara took a loan of 40,000 KGS from micro-finance bank, Bai-Tushum, to buy another cow in the further development of her business. She plans to invest the extra income to expand her herd and hopes to save enough money to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Clara Valentina

texts.es: Clara de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de sala de belleza y adicional a eso también vende ropa, tiene mucha clientela que la buscan por el buen servicio y los buenos precios,  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, Clara esta solicitando un crédito par al compra de ropa de segunda por mayor para poder seguir comercializándola y que le genera buenos ingresos y asi poderle dar a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Clara is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her son.  She has a beauty salon business and in addition to that also sells clothing.  She has many customers that seek her for the good service and good prices.  She is able to get ahead with the household expenses she has with what she makes from her work.

Clara is requesting a loan to buy second hand clothes wholesale to be able to continue making her sales and to generate a good income so that she can give her child what he needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy, 44 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She and her husband own and manage a shop where they make keys and rubber stamps. She's been in this business for almost 24 years and earns a net income of 500 PHP daily. Her net income from the business was spent immediately for food expenses. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase blank keys that she will use to duplicate keys for customers. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase blank keys for duplication

location.town: Blk. 3 PH 3, Beverly Hills, Subdivision, Cauayan C

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 35-year-old woman. She is married and bringing up two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. 

Gulshan began her own business three months ago. She bakes and sells biscuits. Now, she wants to develop her new business because she also has her regular customers. 

Gulshan needs to have a new oven. She is going to buy a new oven. With this aim she is asking for a loan of 700 Somoni to buy an oven. She awaits your mercy. She hopes that this loan will help her to develop her new business.

loans.use: To buy an oven for a new business

loans.name: Dúo Criaturas De Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Criaturas de Dios, este grupo está integrado por la señora Silvia Carolina de 33 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace varios años ya que de esa forma ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, en esta oportunidad ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de verduras para la venta ya que su sueño a corto plazo es tener una puesto de venta más grande para generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia Carolina, 33 years old, is part of the group, Dúo Criaturas de Dios.  She has made her living for several years selling vegetables and this has allowed her to get her family ahead.  

This time she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables to sell as her short term dream is to have a larger sales stand to generate better profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pheta

texts.en:
To earn additional income, Pheta engages in selling snack foods/refreshment foods near the public market. She is 50 years old and has two children. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they have the determination to uplift their status of living. 

Pheta aims to prepare more kinds of snack foods to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she wants to borrow PHP 10,000 to buy milk, coconut, sugar and other ingredients needed in preparing snack foods. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, coconut, sugar and other ingredients

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 45 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Mary Jane has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Jane has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Xavier Francis

texts.en: Xavier Francis is a 36-year-old hardworking and honest married man. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda with two children. His children are 7 and 3 years old, and both of them attend school. He has been a fisheries officer for eight years and hopes of having more rentals. Xavier Francis is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets, nails, and timber, and to pay for labour to finish his rentals.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails, and timber, and to pay for labour

loans.name: Coop Ngiryi Ruhosha&bishungo G11 Group

texts.en:
Onesphore is 38 years old. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma's  previous loan enabled her to expand her business, earn a higher income, and improve her living standards. In addition to selling charcoal, she sells goats at the market to passersby and neighbors. She is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Zymryte

texts.en:
Zymryte, age 45, is married and a mother of three children. She operates a handicraft business from her home, specializing in traditional clothing. She has many customers that purchase her work, especially for weddings. She has always worked from home so that she could work and also take care of the children and the home. Her husband works hard doing construction, but he earns a low salary. Their combined income is not enough to meet their daily needs and provide materials for Zymryte’s work. 

Zymryte is requesting a loan so that she can purchase materials for her work. This will enable her to continue her business, especially in the upcoming busy wedding season. Her goal is to give her children a better education. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her work, move into a shop, and hire an employee to help her. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making traditional clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and materials to adjust his chicken coop.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables. She sells from a stall at her home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Sadete

texts.en:
Sadete, at age 28, is married and has one daughter. She lives in a very small two-room house in a Roma community with her daughter and her husband, who works part time in construction and also in transporting goods. As with all Ashali people, they live a very difficult life under very poor conditions. 

Sadete is requesting a loan in order to build an annex on her home to provide an additional room. This loan will help her to improve their living conditions and space, as she is planning on having another baby in the future. She is very happy for this opportunity and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: To build an annex on her home to provide an additional room

loans.name: Zade

texts.en:
Zade is married and involved in the agricultural business based on family tradition. Currently, she has two cows, from which she sells milk and milk products. Her husband works nights as a guard for a private company and helps Zade in their stable during the day. 

Zade has a large demand for milk products and is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase another milking cow to meet the demands of her customers. The loan will help her to have more income and ensure better living conditions. She is very happy to have their income from the cows as she enjoys working in her stable.

loans.use: to purchase another milking cow

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Ella es Sandra, cuando era niña la alegría más grande era jugar, como toda niña, pero aunque le gustaban las muñecas y los osos de peluche, veía más interesante un balón de fútbol, poco a poco se inclinó por este deporte, siguió jugando al fútbol hasta decorar el cuarto con trofeos y medallas, luego se dio cuenta que le gustaba bailar y organizar la música para las fiestas de la casa, una dj pequeña, realizaba también otras actividades que le gustaba cuando era pequeña. 
Con el tiempo la mama enfermo y ella tuvo que quedarse más tiempo con la familia, dejando a un lado el fútbol, aunque ella adoraba el deporte había algo que con el tiempo le fue gustando más y más y eso era cocinar. 
El sueño va con la mano de Dios, terminar la carrera, encontrar  una estabilidad y tener la propia empresa, también piensa que un restaurante bar es una excelente combinación y que de seguro le iría muy bien. 
Ella se encuentra estudiando tercer semestre de contabilidad y en esta carrera ve una buena opción laboral, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacer los pagos, por eso se ve interesada para solicitar el convenio de kiva.
texts.en:
This is Sandra, whose greatest joy was playing, just like every other little girl. But although she liked dolls and teddy bears, she thought soccer balls were more interesting. Little by little, she began to prefer this sport, and she continued playing soccer until her room was decorated with trophies and medals. Later, she realized that she also liked dancing and organizing the music for parties at the house—she was a little girl DJ. She was also engaged in other activities that she liked when she was little.

After a while, her mother became ill, and she had to stay at home with her family more of the time, setting soccer aside. Although she adored the sport, there was something that she was gradually enjoying more and more; and that was cooking.

The dream, with the help of God, is to complete her degree, achieve some stability, and have her own business. She also thinks that a restaurant and bar make an excellent combination, and that it would surely go well for her. She is studying in her third semester of accounting, and she sees a good occupational option in this career. However, at this time she does not have enough money to pay the fees, and this is why she is interested in seeking a loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Sandra successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Sandra's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Vito

texts.en:
Vito is 26 years old, married, and has two children. He is from a rural cell in Nyabuhikye. He deals in agriculture and sells bananas. He sells 20 bunches of matooke every two weeks. He earns additional income from retail shop with capital of 800,000 UGX. 

Vito is requesting a loan 2,000,000 UGX, which he will use to purchase mulch for his banana plantation for better yields. He hopes to work on his plantation to a high standard to start getting more bunches of matooke from his own plantation. His challenge is transportation to the center due to poor roads. He hopes to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his bananas to the market, which will also increase his efficiency and profits in the long run.

loans.use: to purchase mulch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two coolers to store dairy products and drinks.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Blanca de 24 años de edad,  está por graduarse de profesora en matemáticas., con ella viven sus padres y una hermana.

      La fuente de ingreso que tiene ella son remesas que le envía su hermana de Estados Unidos, su padres son quienes le ayudan económicamente también.

    
   El cliente con el financiamiento pretende ayudar a su padre a comprar a los insumos que ocupara para la siembra de los granos básicos dentro de los cuales están el fertilizantes, los herbicidas y la mano de obra que necesitara. Con la otra parte del crédito hará efectivo el pago de los gastos de su graduación.


   Su sueño es pagar todo lo que respecta a su graduación y en seguida se ve trabajando  ejerciendo su profesión, ayudar con ello al desarrollo del país, por otra parte quiere tener su familia, su casa donde poder vivir adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 24 years old and is about to graduate as a maths teacher. Her parents and a sister live with her.

Her source of income is the money she is sent by her sister in the US. Her parents also help her financially. 

With this funding, Blanca intends to help her father to buy the supplies needed for planting basic grains, including fertilizers, herbicides and labour. With the other part of the money, she will pay her graduation expenses. 

Her dream is to pay all the costs surrounding her graduation and then to work in her profession, thereby helping the country's development. As well, she wants to have her family and her home where she can live properly.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizers, herbicides and labour needed. With the other part of the loan, she will pay for her graduation expenses.

loans.name: Vesko

texts.en:
Vesko is 29 years old and lives in a Roma community in Kosovo. He is married and has two children, ages four and six. In order to earn a living, he is employed in an NGO in his community, which allows him to provide help to his own community through the work that he does. 

Until recently Vesko lived with his family in a small house which they shared with his parents, but he has now managed to build a small house for only his family to live in. He has not been able to finish the house, which still needs a finished façade. He is requesting a loan for the first time to complete the work and pay for the labor. This loan will help him to have better living conditions and privacy for his family. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he is grateful and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To pay for labor to complete work on his home's facade

loans.name: Hajrush

texts.en:
The borrower, Hajrush, is a married father of 4 children. He lives together with his family in the southern part of Kosovo. To earn a living he  works as an electrician for a private company with a low salary. Because his salary is so low he has decided to start his own business using a tractor to wok on the lands of others for a fee. 
He believes that this is profitable business and will help to secure a stable financial situation for him and his family. He would like a loan in order to purchase a tractor to start his new business. He is hoping next year also to be able to plant and work his own land, planting potatoes to sell for income as well.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor to start his new business

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan which has helped him to buy a trailer for his cultivator. With the help of this loan he has expanded his work. He is now working in a clinic and then after his work-day at the clinic is over, he drivers a bus for a private company. He is clearly a very hardworking man who does much to earn a living to satisfy his family’s needs. His wife works in a restaurant for a low salary, but she enjoys working. 
Although they both work hard and often, the agricultural business of planting wheat and corn is more important to them than the employment they do. They are able to use the corn and wheat for themselves and sell part of the crop for a profit to provide even better living conditions for their children. The loan that they are requesting is again for the same business to buy a big tractor. This second loan will help them to grow their crops and increase their business to generate more income. He hopes to continue to improve their family’s lives and thanks all of the Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy a big tractor

loans.name: Skender

texts.en:
Skender is 49 years old and married. For more than twelve years now he has been earning a living by selling fire wood for heating. He cuts the wood, transports it in his van to the customers and sells it all by himself. He also owns a cow and sells and delivers the milk and milk products locally. The money that he is generating it’s not enough for daily expanses.

Skender needs to register his van to continue to make it legal and use it to deliver for both of his businesses. He is very happy for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for helping him to continue his work. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To register his van to continue his businesses

loans.name: Driton

texts.en:
Driton is 31, married and a father of 3 children. In order to earn a living he has been working in a car wash with a very low salary, while his wife stays home to care for the home and the children. Recently they moved from their very small old house into a new house, but they did not have the funds to finish all of the construction work needed. 
For this reason, he is requesting a loan to finish the flooring of the house. This loan will help them to live in their new home and have better living conditions. Driton is hoping that in the near future he will be able to open his own car wash and give his children a better education from the money he would make. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To complete the flooring of the house

loans.name: Qëndrim

texts.en: Qendrim is single, 22, and a hardworking man who does a lot in order to earn a living. He works in a bakery for a low salary and also is involved in his family business of planting corn that they sell. He works with his brother and is very satisfied with the income that they are able to generate through their agricultural work. Currently he is in need of a loan in order to purchase materials for planting the corn and harvesting it. This loan will help him to continue his business and improve the living conditions for his family. He hopes in the future to have enough money to open his own bakery. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for planting the corn and harvesting it

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 24 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar. Josefina se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y apoyar a su familia con los gastos diarios. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de agua potable en su vivienda dado que no cuenta con el vital líquido.
texts.en:
Josefina is 24 years old and lives with her family in very modest conditions.  Josefina has been working as a housekeeper for a long time. This job allows her to provide for the daily household needs and support her family with the daily expenses.

She has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to improve her living conditions. She wants to use the money to invest in the installation of a potable water system in her home because the house doesn't have this vital liquid.

loans.use: to invest in the installation of a potable water system at her home

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat is a 53-year-old refugee and lives with her husband and single daughter in an IDP settlement for a long time. Her husband is a laborer, but the main source of income for the family is gardening. Nazakat has been raising summer fruit and selling them for 23 years.  She has good skills in this area and her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Nazakat raises such seasonal fruit as cherry-plum, cherry, peach, pear etc. Local people like to attend her grocery because fruits from Nazakats garden are always fresh and tasty. Additionally, she sells roses and some other flowers.

Nazakat’s income doesn't cover the family’s live costs. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and quality fertilizer for fruit trees and flowers. Besides that, she wants to supply new sorts of fruit for other seasons in order to make her income constant through the year. She needs to increase her income and pay for medicine.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and quality feertilizer for fruit trees and fowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to purchase more educational equipment.

loans.name: Gilma Yesenia

texts.es: Gilma tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su  hijo de 16 años de edad y su hija de 13 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza por catalogo. Es una mujer emprendedora y hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Gracias al gran esfuerzo que realiza junto a su compañero de vida han logrado construir su vivienda pero no cuentan con los recursos económicos suficientes para terminarla por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del techo y para poner las puertas en la vivienda. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y de esta forma poder mejor sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Gilma is 35 years old; she lives in her own house with her life partner, their 16 year old son and 13 year old daughter. For 5 years she has been selling clothes and beauty products by catalogue. She is an enterprising woman and she does everything in her power to bring sustenance to her home. 

Thanks to the great effort that she and her life partner have put forth they have managed to build a house but they don’t have the financial resources to complete it which is why she made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to invest it in the construction of the roof and to put doors on the house. 

She hopes to have this funding and in this way improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: To buy: galvanized sheets, poles and doors to construct the roof of her home and put doors on it.

loans.name: Dúo Tierra Prometida Group

texts.es:
DUO TIERRA PROMETIDA
La señorita Cesia Antoniela de 30 años de edad, soltera,  desde hace 3 años posee una venta de cosméticos por catalogos zona 4 de El Tejar, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de señorita Cesia es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de belleza para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO TIERRA PROMETIDA

Cesia Antoniela is 30 years old. She is single and for the last 3 years she has had a  business selling catalog cosmetics for zone 4 of El Tejar. She was able to establish it and was able to improve her home through a lot of effort. Through her business she has supported her family and has helped them to get ahead.

Cesia’s dream is to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family with the micro loan she is requesting from FAPE. She wants to use this loan to buy more beauty products to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is still single at age 24. In order to earn a living, he works supervising construction of roads, but with a very low salary. Burim lives with his entire family, but is the main source of income.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to do road construction, so that he can add extra income by working privately on roads, in additional to his current job. 

This loan will help him to be able to generate more income for his future and contribute towards his goal of, one day, opening his own road construction business. He is hoping that, once he gets more income and stability, he will be able to start a family of his own. 

Burim wants to thank all of the lenders for helping to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to do road construction.

loans.name: Sevdije

texts.en:
Sevdije is widowed and has five adult children. Although one son is married, Sevdije, all of her sons, and her one son’s family all live together in the same house in poor living conditions. The house has not been renovated in a long time and the toilet is unsanitary.
 
Although Sevdije's sons are working as hairdressers, they have not been able to pay for the required renovations. Therefore, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to complete the renovations, including the toilet and the walls, which are leaking and have water damage from rain.

loans.use: to complete renovations, including the toilet and the walls of the house

loans.name: Kireka Hill School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sarah. She is the Director of Kireka Hill Infant School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kireka in Wakiso with 570 students. Kireka Hill Infant School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kireka Hill Infant will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Sarah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: East High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Isa. He is the Director of Studies at East High School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kulambiro, Wakiso District with 800 students. East High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

East High will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Isa ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Emmanuel. He is the Head Teacher Merryland High School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Entebbe in Wakiso with 367 students. Merryland High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Merryland high will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Emmanuel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Entebbe Changsha School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alice. She is the Head teacher at Entebbe Changsha Primary School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Entebbe, Wakiso District with 260 students. Entebbe Changsha Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra filtration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Entebbe Changsha Primary will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Alice ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Degna Maria

texts.es:
El éxito consiste en hacer cosas ordinarias de maneras extraordinarias, ejemplo de ello es Degna, quién hace dos años inició vendiendo coca cola y golosinas en su casa para obtener ingresos, en la actualidad, gracias a su dedicación ha logrado formar una pulpería. Ella tiene la edad de 44 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora y carismática, con el apoyo de su madre y su esposo ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio. 
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar granos básicos, como arroz y frijoles; también aceite, dulces, productos lácteos, entre otros. Degna no conoce el ocio, siempre está trabajando, otra fuente de ingresos, es su fritanguería, venta de comida rápida tradicional. Sin embargo, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, con el que espera que su pulpería siga en alza, su objetivo principal es obtener estabilidad económica que le brinde una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Success consists of doing ordinary things in an extraordinary way. One example of this is Degna who, two years ago, started selling Coca Cola and sweets from her house in order to earn in an income. Now, thanks to her dedication, she has been able to open a grocery store. Degna is 44 years old; she is married and has two children. Degna is an enterprising and charismatic woman and, with the support of her mother and husband, she has managed to move forward with her business.

Degna is applying for a loan in order to increase stock in her store: she needs to buy basic grains - such as a rice and beans -, oil, sweets, dairy products and more. Degna has no free time as she is always working. She also has a fried food stall where she sells fast food to make more money. Degna has confidence in this loan and hopes that her grocery store will continue to grow. Her main aim to have financial stability that will give her and her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains - such as a rice and beans -, oil, sweets, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Zana Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Philip. He is the Director at Zana parents Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Zana, Wakiso District with 350 students. Zana Parents has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Zana Parents Primary School will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Philip ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and fertilisers, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Ivica

texts.en:
Ivica is 36, single, and lives with his entire family and his married brother in a very small house in a minority community. He is working as a waiter in a restaurant with a low salary; his parents both receive a pension. 

Ivica always wanted to help his family to have better living conditions. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to renovate the house and façade. He has tried several times to save money but he never managed and now he decided to request a loan, which will help improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for her work

loans.name: Zhamalbubu

texts.ru: Жамалбубу 55 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей, дети взрослые и самостоятельные, проживают отдельно. У Жамалбубу - высшее педагогическое образование, долгие годы работает в местной школе, одновременно на протяжении 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Жамалбубу имеется 1,60 ГА земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает зерновые культуры. Также у Жамалбубу есть 1 корова, 1 теленок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамалбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для закупа минеральных удобрений, семян высококачественных сортов, часть средств Жамалбубу хочет потратить на покупку коровы. Жамалбубу  намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Жамалбубу хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Zhamalbubu is 55 years old and married. She hast two children; both are already independent adults and live separately. Zhamablubu has received a college degree in education. For many years she has been teaching at the local school. In addition, for some 25 years she has been growing farm produce and raising livestock. Thanks to Zhamalbubu’s hard work, she now has a land plot of 1.6 ha [4 acres], where she annually grows grains. She also has one cow, one calf, and 10 sheep. Her monthly revenue is 18,000 KGs. In order to develop her farm further, Zhamalbubu has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers and high-quality seeds. She also would like to use part of her loan to buy a cow. Zhamalbubu anticipates having a good harvest, which will certainly bolster her family’s finances. Zhamalbubu would like to use the revenues resulting from her loan for an additional increase of livestock. She also plans to save up for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay labourers to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda de 25 años de edad está casada con el señor Homar, tiene 2 hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, se dedica a vender material de escritorio en una librería desde hace 4 años, de esta manera genera sus ingresos, su esposo se dedica a prestar servicios de seguridad ciudadana, ambos muestran ser personas responsables con muchas ganas de superarse, siempre buscando el bienestar de su familia, actualmente la señora solicita un crédito por que tuvo gastos inesperados, debido a que su padre se puso delicado de salud, el destino de la presente solicitud es para la compra de material de escritorio de esta forma podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos y lograra satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, por consiguiente generara más ingresos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hilda, 25 years old, is married to Homar, and has 2 children who depend on her income. She has made her living selling office supplies at a book store for 4 years. This is how she earns a living.

Her husband makes his living offering citizen security services. They both are responsible people with a great desire to get ahead. They are always looking out for the wellbeing of their family.

The woman is currently applying for a loan because she had unexpected expenses, due to the fact that her father fell into frail health. The purpose of this application is to buy office supplies to be able to offer a greater variety of products and satisfy her customers' needs. As a result, she will get more earnings to be able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy office supplies.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María es una señora esforzada, maestra de educación primaria de un núcleo educativo rural con 28 años de laborar, casada sin hijos a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la  Compra de cemento, bloques, arena, piedrín, hierro, zinc y mano de obra, para la construcción de un cuarto el que le vendría a dar mejores comodidades a ella y su familia
texts.en: Mary is a hardworking woman. She has worked as a primary school teacher in a rural educational center for 28 years. She is married and has no dependent children. She currently needs to improve her home, which is why she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan which she would use to buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, iron, zinc and labor to build a bedroom which would provide better conditions to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, iron, zinc and labor.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling charcoal.  Mercy is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF  to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mercy  has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ana Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport and has to remit all the proceeds to the motorcycle owner. He faces the challenge of competition. 

Sam has a vision of owning a motorcycle. He requested a loan, which he will use to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 20, 15 y 14 años respectivamente, se dedica a tender  la venta de pupusas y antojitos, dicho negocio surge por la necesidad de tener más ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Con el crédito comprara aceite, gas propano, leña, aderezos, harina, repollo, papas, quesillo, bebidas, azúcar, sal, teniendo de manera inmediata los ingredientes que necesita para mantenerse trabajando espera tener un mejor margen de ganancias y atraer más clientes.
Rosa aspira a fortalecer el negocio lo necesario para tener los recursos económicos que permitan apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and their three children, aged 20, 15 and 14 years old respectively. Rosa makes a living working at her stall selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) and snacks. This business was born out of Rosa's need to earn another income to pay for her family's basic needs.

This loan will be used to buy oil, propane gas, firewood, flour, cabbage, potatoes, cheese tortillas, drinks, sugar and salt. This will give her all of the necessary ingredients to continue working. Rosa hopes to have a higher profit margin and to attract more customers.

Rosa wants to strengthen her business in order to have the financial resources that will allow her to support her children with their university studies.

loans.use: to buy oil, propane gas, firewood, flour, cabbage, potatoes, cheese tortillas, drinks, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Alfredo Manuel

texts.es:
Alfredo es un humilde hombre del campo dedicado a sus tierras y a su familia.
El ha decidido independizarse y conseguirse un capital para subsisti8r y garantizar el sostenimiento de su familia, por esta razón desea iniciar con su propio negocio que consiste en una tienda de abarrotes y comestibles donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos y bebidas.
El único problema es la falta de capital para iniciar y acude a un aliento económico para comprar surtido como bebidas, y productos básicos de la canasta familiar. Con estos podrá empezar a consolidar su establecimiento y obtendrá los ingresos que tanto ha esperado para sus hijos.
Es el ejemplo de un hombre que busca incansablemente la manera de progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a modest man from the country, dedicated to his land and to his family. He has decided to become independent and find capital for subsisting and guaranteeing support for his family.

That is why he wants to start his own business, which consists of a grocery and food store, where he can offer a variety of products and drinks. The only problem is the lack of capital to start, and he is resorting to outside financing to buy an assortment of items, such as drinks and basic needs for families.

With this he will be able to consolidate his establishment, and obtain the income that he has so hoped for for his children.

He is the example of a man who tirelessly looks for ways to progress and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of items, such as basic products for family needs and drinks, to start his store.

loans.name: Kosara

texts.en:
Kosara is a 52-year-old widowed woman. She has a son and a daughter who is unable to walk and has health problems. Kosara receives a social pension and her daughter receives help in the amount of 400 euros. Her daughter needs a lot of medicine and has many medical related expenses. Her son has not been able to find employment due to the high unemployment rate in the area and has not been able to contribute to their family’s income.

 Kosara request a loan to renovate their house to have better living conditions and better insulation.  This  will help to keep the home warm in the winter and save utility expenses. 

She really appreciates this help and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate their house in order have better living conditions.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton is single and lives in a small village. He is a very hardworking man and keeps long hours and a busy schedule in order to make a living. 

He is a very professional and talented auto mechanic, able to repair many kinds of vehicles. Until recently,  he has worked for another but has finally started his own business. Therefore, he needs a loan to purchase a lift, tools, and other equipment  for his workshop. He is convinced that his business will be profitable because he already has many customers who trust him.  He has built solid relationships with his customers. This loan will allow him to finally open his business.

He is very thankful for such an opportunity. He promises to make punctual payments.

loans.use: to purchase a lift, tools, and other equipment needed for his workshop.

loans.name: Hisnije

texts.en:
Hisnije is 44 and is a mother of  2 boys and 2 girls. Her husband is handicapped and not able to work.   She is employed in a market as a sales woman. 

She has always worked hard selling products to support their family.  One of her daughters is in sales in another market and helps to support the family.

Although the family  has both  salaries to contribute to the family's expenses,  it is not enough money  to renovate their toilette and improve their living conditions. Hisnije  requests a loan to renovate the toilette so that she can have sanitary conditions and make their environment a healthy one. 

She is very happy to have this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate the toilette.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno has been a widow for many years and is the sole  income provider for her 3 daughters. She has a  higher education and has worked in IMON for more than 5 years. She is a sociable and hardworking woman and does her job well.

Barno also sews national dresses as another source of income. She wants to buy an embroidery machine  to embroider the national dresses. Her daughters help her with the  sewing. 

She asks for 12,000 TJS to buy an  embroidery machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad. Irma se dedica a la venta de productos de tienda desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Irma solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y polines. Espera poder  constar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la mejora antes que el invierno empiece.
texts.en:
Irma is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children ages 6 and 3. Irma has sold products to shops for many years, which is how she supports her family and maintains the family’s finances along with her husband. 

Irma is requesting this FUSAI loan because she wants to repair the roof of her house. She will need materials such as galvanized steel, wood and poles. She hopes that with this loan she can begin the renovation before the winter begins.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel, wood and poles to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala. She is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t support additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables, operating her business on retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. 

Harriet works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 300,000 to buy onions, cabbages, passion fruit, tomatoes, pineapples. Her business challenges include selling perishable produce and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a  wholesaler  and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes, passion fruit, and pineapples

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, a mother of three, has operated a general store for two years., She earns enough to support the needs of her children and was able to sustain her business.  Her husband has a transportation service.  

 She borrowed  from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery items to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, runs a general store to sell grocery items  in her village.  This is  an aid to her husband's farming  income, which is their main source of income.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy goods for her store. Recently, she took a new loan  to purchase additional grocery items to sell . She always finds ways to earn income to provide for the needs of her children in school. 

She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent used the previous loan to buy seeds and dig soil and water conservation trenches. He is still in the same business, and is facing challenges of price fluctuation, however, he has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning. Vincent needs a loan to buy fresh foods and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José   tiene la edad de 53 años, está casado  y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos . El quiere comprar almacigo para la resiembra de su propiedad e insumos. El cuenta con la experiencia y el terreno, pero el café ya está en unas condiciones regulares por lo cual él quiere es resembrar las partes más dañadas y seguir con el proyecto. El pretende con esto generar ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y también mejorar sus cosechas este próximo año. Es el primer  préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children. He wants to buy seedlings for re-sowing his land, and for inputs. He has experience and the land, but the coffee is in mediocre condition, which is why he wants to re-sow the most damaged parts and continue with his project.

With the loan, he hopes to generate income for the wellbeing of his family, and also to improve this next year's harvests. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and inputs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cooproriz Ngiryi Muduha 2 G5 Group

texts.en:
Damascene is 34 years old and has been a farmer for the past twenty years. He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer for rice production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farm, he wishes to invest in his business and acquire machines and tractors to build capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer and cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 56-year old-married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He deals in selling fresh foods and farming for additional income. He is facing challenges of customers who delay to pay. 

Joseph has a vision of making a big farm. He needs a loan to buy fresh fruits and bananas for selling.

loans.use: to buy fruits and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her retail shop business.  Mwanaidi operates a tailoring business.

She asks for a loan to purchase fabric and sewing thread for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agriculture materials to help coffee crops during blooming season

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is married, with six children, four of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past six years, Mjeni has practiced farming, growing various crops, such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, Mjeni wants to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es: La muestra más sencilla y afectuosa de demostrar amor a una persona es entregarle una flor, un acto tradicional en todo el mundo pero detrás de tan especial demostración de cariño están los campesinos personas como Juan que dedican toda su vida al cultivos de flores, flores que sirven para generar una sonrisa, sonrojar a tu pareja, en la entrega de dicha flor no solo está depositado el amor de quien al entrega, está el amor de quien la cultiva ya que para realizar esta profesión hay que amar, sentir y querer lo que haces para que nazca una hermosa flor, Juan solicita un crédito para expandir sus cultivos y la compra de insumos agrícolas, con los que puede seguir brindando al mundo sus bellos cultivos, flores que tienen un ingrediente de más y es que en cada flor está depositado el amor de este humilde trabajador que tiene como sueño tener un cultivo gigante
texts.en:
The most simple and affectionate show of love for another person is by giving them a flower, a traditional custom all over the world, but behind such a special gesture of endearment are the farmers, people like Juan who dedicate their lives to growing flowers. Flowers which serve to bring out smiles and make your partner blush; in the giving of a flower there is not only the love of the person giving it, but the love of the person who grew it. Since to be in this profession you have to love, feel and like what you do so that a beautiful flower grows. 

Juan is requesting a loan to expand his nursery and to buy agricultural consumables with which he will be able to continue sharing his beautiful products, flowers with an extra ingredient which is that every flower has the love of this humble worker who has a dream of having a gigantic flower field.

loans.use: to expand his flower fields so he can continue bringing love to people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with purchasing a sound system, duplicating her music CDs, costs for a car, business cards and flyers.

loans.name: Om – Laith Group

texts.en:
The Om – Laith group consists of four women, living in Sana'a city, Yemen. Najwa is the leader of the group. They requested a loan from AMB for 210,000 YER.
 
Najwa is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in her own house, which is old, and works as a housewife. Her husband and son are employees in the Yemeni army. Their salaries are not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Najwa's house needs renovation, but the family does not have enough money to renovate. As a result, Najwa is requesting a loan from AMB for 60,000 YER, which she will use to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and woods in order to renovate the house. In the future, she would like to add space to her house and open a savings account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and woods in order to renovate the house.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is single, 23 and lives with his entire family in a small village. Because of their low income and poor economic conditions, he was unable to continue with his education and turned to the family’s agricultural business of tending cows. 

His father works as a painter but the salary is not enough  to support raising the cows. Sami  has 3 cows and a loan is needed  to purchase food for the cows.  He wants to keep them and produce milk and milk products to nourish his family and sell in the market for income. 

His goal is to expand his farm  and enjoy a successful future despite his lack of education. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cows.

loans.name: Mayra Narcisa

texts.es: Mayra ha sido madre soltera, hoy en día recibe el apoyo económico de su hijo, es una señora trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo ropa y cosméticos, Mayra solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar la construcción del porche de su vivienda que le permitirá gozar un poco mas de espacio en su hogar.
texts.en: Mayra is a single mother and currently receives financial support from her son. She is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling clothes and cosmetics. Mayra is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to begin building a porch which will allow her to enjoy a little more space in her home.

loans.use: To buy cinder blocks, cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Oykhon

texts.en:
Oykhon is a lovely wife and responsible mother. She brings up three children. Her husband is a pensioner. 

Since the year 2005, Oykhon has been busy with selling milk products. She is going to be busy with feeding cattle now because there is a big business struggle in milk product sales business. She is going to buy cattle, feed them for some months, and sell them in a local market. 

Oykhon’s husband helps her with managing the business. She is going to improve their living conditions from the profit. Oykhon is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase zinc tiles and perlin bracing for roof repair.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es: La señora Jhanet, es una persona muy trabajora y emprendedora, desde muy joven le gustó la repostería, logró estudiar para adquirir mas conocimientos en esa rama, aprendió a hacer tortas, queques, galletas y panaderia especial, su esposo siempre la apoyó pero fue muy difícil para ella seguir estudiando y además tener que cuidar de una familia.
