Su mayor anhelo es abrir al publico un pequeño local, desea ofrecer sus tortas al publico en general y también ofrecer salteñas, jugos y refrescos, todo esto hará que el nivel de vida que llevan con su esposo y ahora sus tres pequeñas hijas mejore; por ello solicita un credito para abrir una resposteria,  junto a su esposo tienen especialidades ella en tortas y él en salteñas y ambos estan dispuestos a trabajar mucho para hacer prosperar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jhanet is a hard-working and enterprising person. Even as a youngster she liked baking and was able to go to school to learn more about this field. She learned how to make cakes, biscuits, pastries, and special breads. Her husband has always supported her, but it was difficult for her to continue her studies and take care of her family as well. 

Her greatest desire is to open a small shop to the public where she can offer her cakes as well as meat pies, juices, and soft drinks. This will allow the quality of life that she has with her husband and three small daughters to improve. This is why she is requesting a loan to open a bakery with her husband. Her specialty is cake-making, and his is making meat pies. Both of them are prepared to work hard so their business will flourish.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en: Phung would like to take a further loan to buy feed for her cattle which she will raise and sell. Phung's previous loan enabled her to increase her capacity to rear cattle and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Dinavence

texts.en:
Dinavence is 28 years old and married with two children and one dependent that she is looking after due to financial constraints in the family. She owns a retail trade shop as her major source of income; she also earns money from agriculture as another source of income. She has earned a lot from this business. For example, she has been able to buy a plot of land where she is planning to construct a permanent house for her family.

She is applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy more stock for her retail shop and be able to make more profits from her business. 

Dinavence’s major challenge is the poor structure that shelters her family members and limited resources to buy the required items for her customers. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop in the region.  

She is honest and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Santos Armando

texts.es:
Santos de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado comenta que en su época de infancia era bien difícil estudiar por la situación económica de su familia y por otro lado por el conflicto armado vivido en el país, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda,  junto  a ella han procreado a dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 13 años, ellos actualmente están estudiando, en su vivienda también vive su suegra en total viven 5 personas su esposa, sus dos hijos ,su suegra y él.

Santos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura a la siembra de granos básicos maíz y frijol junto a su esposa hacen los cultivos y sus hijos que siempre le apoyan en los tiempos libres cuando salen de estudiar, Santos desde que estaba pequeño cultiva la tierra gracias a su padre que le enseño los trabajos agrícolas. Los cultivos los tiene cerca de su casa solo tiene que caminar un kilómetro para llegar a ellos,  él siempre recibe el apoyo de toda su familia. Don Santos también tiene otra actividad que es la ganadería en la compra y venta de ganado, pues otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos a su familia.  

El préstamo lo utilizara específicamente para la agricultura la preparación de la tierra para las siembras de los granos,  pago de mano de obra, compra de 3 sacos de abono orgánico para los cultivos. Gracias al préstamo le permitirá tener otra producción y tener más alimentos para la sostenibilidad  de toda su familia. 


Comenta que para el futuro desea ampliar más su producción de los cultivos y tener una mayor rentabilidad de sus cosechas, estar siempre en Paz con Dios y que sus hijos sean buenas  personas que sigan estudiando mucho para que en el futuro ellos le  puedan ayudar económicamente a él y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Santos, 40, who studied until fourth grade, says that during his childhood, it was very difficult to study due to his family's economic situation, and, additionally, due to the armed conflict that the country experienced. Now, he is married and his wife works in the house, doing all of the household chores. He and his wife have two children, aged 15 and 13, who currently study. His mother-in-law also lives with him, so there are a total of 5 people in the household: Santos, his wife, his two children, and his mother-in-law.  

Santos has always worked in agriculture, sowing grains, corn and beans. He and his wife do the farming and his children always help him when they have free time and when they are not in school. Since he was young, Santos has always farmed, thanks to his father who taught him to work the land.  His crops are close to his house; he only has to walk one kilometer to get to them. He always receives the support of this family. Santos also works with livestock, buying and selling cattle, and in doing so, he is able to generate more income for his family. 

He will use this loan specifically for his agricultural work: to prepare the land for sowing grain, to pay labor costs, and to buy 3 bags of organic fertilizer for his crops. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to produce more and to have more food for the survival of his family. 

He says that in the future, he would like to expand the production of his crops and have a greater return from the crops, always have peace with God, and he hopes that his sons will be good people and will continue studying hard so that they will one day be able to help their parents economically.

loans.use: to prepare the land for sowing grain, to pay labor costs, and to buy three bags of organic fertilizer  for his crops

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 39-year-old married woman. She has two children. 

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 15 years of experience in this field.  By now, she has attained good number of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of running a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  For this reason she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to cater to more customers, time after time. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a 21-year-old single mother of one child. She runs a small taxi business to earn a living. Sandra needs a loan to buy new headlights and a  rear windshield for her taxicab. She will use her profits to pay for her child's education. Sandra joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new headlights and a rear windshield for her taxicab.

loans.name: İmadi

texts.en:
İmadi is 26 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He works as a laborer on a water project team that builds water channels. He has been working with this team for three years and his monthly income is 200 AZN.

Azerbaijan is developing very quickly and every year many regions have many changes. Water is one of the most important resources in each region. Young people take part in building water channels to improve life in their regions.

Imadi’s income isn’t enough to cover his family’s demands. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan to buy good coveralls and quality tools for his work.

loans.use: to buy good coveralls and quality tools for work

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is 48-years-old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Epenesa has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, stencil designs, brush, rollers, sponges, a cutter and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, stencil designs, brush, rollers, sponges, a cutter and material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, pickaxe and other construction materials.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the materials needed in her tailoring business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lailani hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron and to pay laborers to construct a concrete basin and a bathroom.

loans.name: Jenevieve

texts.en:
This is Jenevieve, 23, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. Her partner is Guillermo, a driver. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jenevieve has a food vending business. She sells different biscuits and snacks. She also sells different drinks. She is one of those vendors who gets on passenger buses to sell food to commuters. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more food like biscuits, snacks, and different drinks needed in her business.

Jenevieve dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more food like biscuits, snacks, and different drinks needed in her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 25-year-old hardworking lady with 1 child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has dealt in selling fresh foods along with farming since 2012. She is facing challenges of weather changes and competition. However, she has a vision of buying a car. Joyce needs a loan to buy more fruits for selling.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 24-year-old married man with 1 child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business is blacksmithing. For the last 8 years. he has faced challenges of self injury and losses. He has a vision of establishing a hardware shop. Rashid needs a loan to buy iron rods and bars to make hinges and mold different shapes for sale.

loans.use: to buy iron rods and bars to make hinges and mold different shapes for sale.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
This is Mnyazi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Zena has operated a beauty salon business for the past one and half years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Oli

texts.en: Oli is a 66-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a business selling a variety of items in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Oli has requested a loan to buy a large chest freezer, cartons of herring, bags of rice, cartons of milk, a whole box of corn beef, and a display fridge. She plans to use her profits to ensure the well-being of her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, cartons of herring, bags of rice, cartons of milk, a whole box of corn beef, and a display fridge.

loans.name: Jhavid

texts.en:
Jhavid is a 27-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He works with his brother as a laborer in a small team which cleans the water channels, rivers and lakes every year. He has been working in this area for five years and has good experience. His monthly income is 180 AZN.

Every year Jhavid’s work team checks up and controls all the water systems of the region in order to keep them clean. This is very important because the environment is the most important factor that influences a human’s life.

Jhavid likes his job very much because he understands its importance. He is a very responsible man and wants to develop his team’s job. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to supply high quality tools and water cleaning equipment for his job.

loans.use: to supply high quality tools and water cleaning equipment

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 38-year-old, single man. He lives with his parents and earns money to cover his family’s demands. He has been working on a water team project for ten years and has good experience in this area. His monthly income is AZN 150.

Zaur knows everything about water channels. He knows how to prepare projects for different regions, how to build them, and how to keep them in control. Additionally, he takes part in the building of such channels. Now, their team builds a new irrigation canal for all neighbor regions in order to improve living conditions and fruit, vegetable, and crop field productivity.

Zaur’s income doesn’t cover his family’s living costs. He applied for an AZN 1,200 loan in order to buy new, quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team. This will increase the quality of his team’s work and income.

loans.use: to buy new, quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team.

loans.name: Pua

texts.en: Pua is 56-years-old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Pua needs a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, a chest freezer, display fridge, and a new cash register machine. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, a chest freezer, display fridge, and a new cash register machine

loans.name: Sakir

texts.en:
A single man, Sakir lives with his elderly parents and has been earning an income working on a water project team for seven years. He has  good experience, and his monthly income is 150AZN.

Water projects are developing in Azerbaijan very quickly, and every year many companies develop such projects in all regions. Sakir knows that this is very important for his country and does his job very well and carefully.

Sakir has requested a 1200 AZN loan in order to buy good tools for his work.

loans.use: to buy good tools for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet, sink, tile, and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine for bending pipes

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Doña Daysi, mujer trabajadora, y con ganas de superar, con su compañero de vida han procreado 4 hijos dos en edades Universitarias y dos en edad Escolar, Daysi con su pareja ha ido luchando para brindarlo lo mejor a sus hijos se dedican al comercio de Cerdo y Ganado desde hace mucho tiempo para generar ingresos y así asumir los gastos básicos del Hogar. doña Daysi ha pasado por una situación económica critica pues en años anteriores tuvo pérdidas grandes en la baja del precio del ganado, y de manera familiar perdió c$ 50,000.00 (cincuenta mil córdobas) por un robo que e hicieron.  A pesar de esta situación no se desanima y con dificultades a venido mejorando su situación, ella necesita comprar mayor cantidad de Cerdos para incrementar su inventario y así obtener mayor plusvalía. su propósito es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en: Daysi is a hard-working woman who wants to improve herself. She has had 4 children with her life companion, two are university aged and two are school aged. Daysi and her partner have struggled to provide the best for their children. They have been in the business of raising pigs and cattle for a long time to generate income and pay the household expenses. Daysi went through a difficult economic situation as in previous years she had large losses with the lowering of the prices for cattle and lost 50.000 NIO in a common place robbery. Despite this situation she did not lose heart but instead struggled to improve her situation. She needs to buy a large quantity of pigs to increase her inventory and obtain more added value. Her goal is for her children to study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks and liqueurs.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Dina has been in this business for three years. Dina earns more income from trisikad transportation.

Dina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Maria es una veterana mujer de mil batallas vividas y ha acumulado gran experiencia en el área de las ventas.
Ella trabaja comercializando productos de belleza, para el hogar y ropa a través de catálogos. Pero desea fortalecer y solidificar su negocio, por esta razón pide un amparo económico para comprar una vitrina, ubicarla en su casa y desde allí exhibir sus productos de una manera más fácil.
De esta manera podrá atraer más clientes y aumentar sus ventas, recibiendo excelentes beneficios para su negocio y familia.
Es una mujer con grandes aspiraciones y metas, pues su motivación es dejarles un legado a sus hijos y que puedan salir adelante con su ayuda.
Uno de sus principales desafíos es la ubicación de su casa que hace difícil la visibilidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a veteran of many battles and has gained lots of experience in sales.

She sells beauty products, products for the home, and clothing via catalogs.  She wants to strengthen and solidify her business so she is asking for financial support to buy a display case and set it up in her home so she can show her products with greater ease.

In this way she can attract more customers, increase her sales, and receive excellent benefits for her business and for her family.

She is a woman with grand aspirations and goals and her motivation is to leave a legacy to her children and for them to get ahead with her.

One of her main challenges is that the location of her home makes it difficult to see her business.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Sylejman

texts.en:
Sylejman wants to thank all of the lenders for the loan he received to repair his taxi. Now he has been able to resume his business and income as well as continue to provide his customers with safe, reliable transportation and a comfortable ride. He is very grateful to be able to continue his business and also increase his sense of security and success. In this way, he knows he will see his dream come true for his family and his children’s education. 

Sylejman is again requesting a loan for the same business and same purpose. Every year his vehicle needs repair in order to continue his business in a safe and reliable manner. He needs to change the tires and repair the engine now, and since he was very happy with the previous loan and the process, he is once again requesting assistance from the lenders. He wants to thank all of the lenders for both loans.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is married with four children, all attending school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread ,milk, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
Diana and her friend are members of the Yehowa No Group and live in Teshie. Diana is 61 years old and married to Joseph, who is a seaman. They have an 18-year-old child. They sell yams and fresh fish. 

Diana has been selling yams at her residence for nine years. She has built trust in her customers and therefore has a good relationship with them. This will be her sixth loan with the field partner, ID-Ghana. She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many yams for resale. In this way, she hopes to improve her earnings.

In the coming years, Diana would like to supply a very large number of people. She would also like to see her child continue to study.

loans.use: To buy many yams for resale.

loans.name: Om- Marwa Group

texts.en:
Om- Marwa is a group of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Samah is the leader of the group. She is a 36-year-old married woman who lives with her family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. She studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. She is a very active and dynamic woman. Recently, she has worked as a dressmaker in order to help her husband with the expenses of the house. Samah's house lacks many home appliances and most of them are very old. She can't afford that condition. The television also is very old. As a result, she can't watch her programs and news very well. Therefore, Samah is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new television for the house.

Samah looks forward to opening a savings account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a new television.

loans.name: Sagheran

texts.en: Sagheran is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Sagheran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is on her fifth loan, seeking to borrow PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Sagheran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling bangles for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family's needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income. Razia has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Simativa

texts.en: Simativa is 42 years old and has been with her partner for 10 years; they now have six children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for four years. Simativa has requested a loan to buy cordials, a bag of sugar, buckets, a large spoon, foam cups and Chinese candy. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Simativa will help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cordials, a bag of sugar, buckets, a large spoon, foam cups and Chinese candy

loans.name: Fatima Susana

texts.es: Fatima tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Fatima se dedica a la venta de productos de tienda desde hace dos años. Gracias a su carisma muchas personas la prefieren y cada vez demandan más sus productos. Fatima solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor dado que lo quiere asegurar y cerrar para poder adecuar su tienda ahí y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento,arena, ladrillo y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en:
Fatima is 23 years old and lives in her own home together with her partner and her small 4-year-old daughter. For two years, Fatima has sold store products. Thanks to her charisma, many people prefer her and demand for her products increases. 

Fatima requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of the corridor given that she wants to secure it and close it to be able to move her store there and in this way tend to her customers better. With the amount requested, she will buy cement, sand, brick, and galvanized sheets.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, and galvanized sheets to finish building the corridor

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 28 years old and works in a team which builds water channels. He has been working in this area for four years and has good skills. His monthly income is 150 AZN. Additionally, he lives with his parents and takes care of them. 

People build water channels in order to make water circulate and be in every house because water is very important for people's lives. Vusal is very responsible and understands the importance of his job because it’s very hard and needs good knowledge. 

Vusal applied for 1200 AZN loan in order to buy good coveralls and quality tools for his job. Good equipment and tools will increase the productivity of the team and will give good results at the end of the project.

loans.use: to buy good coveralls and quality tools for the job

loans.name: Blanca Noemi

texts.es: Blanca tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Blanca trabaja como empleada en un comedor cercano a su localidad. Blanca es una mujer con muchas aspiraciones y cada día busca las forma de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para su cocina dado que actualmente la tiene al aire libre y cuando llueve es imposible hacer uso de ella. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y lamina galvanizada.
texts.en: Blanca is 42 years old and lives in her own home together with her family.  She works as an employee in a restaurant close to her town.  She is a woman with great aspirations who looks every day for ways to improve her living conditions and those of her family.  With a desire to improve her living conditions she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the construction of a room for her kitchen since currently hers is in the open air and when it rains it is impossible to make use of it.  With the requested loan she will buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and galvanized sheet metal.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and galvanized sheet metal for constructing a kitchen.

loans.name: Suititi

texts.en: Suititi is 55 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for nine years. Suititi has requested a loan to buy a large chest freezer, cordials, bags of sugar, large buckets, foam cups and a large spoon. She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Suititi will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, cordials, bags of sugar, large buckets, foam cups and a large spoon

loans.name: Abigail Adelayda

texts.es: Abigail, habita en Nueva Guinea, Junto a su esposo Comercian Productos de Granos Básicos ya que son una pareja unidas, tiene dos hijos que mantener, el mayor en edad escolar y la niña de 2 años, se destaca por ser excelente persona, muy responsable, agradece a Kiva por los Financiamientos anteriores los cuales los ha invertido en su Vivienda mejorándola poco a poco quedando algunos detalles necesarios para darle mayor presentación y valor. esta vez se remite nuevamente ya que los ingresos generados no son suficiente para sus gastos extras y necesita comprar Cemento, Arenilla, Zing entre otros materiales de Construcción y poder poner techo y Repello a su vivienda.  su mayor objetivo es brindarles comodidad a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Abigail lives in New Guinea. She and her husband sell basic grain products. They have two children to support: the oldest goes to school and the youngest is 2 years old. Abigail is known for being excellent person and very responsible. She is grateful for the previous Kiva loans which she has invested in her home, improving it little by little. There are still some details needed to improve its appearance and value. 

She is asking for another loan because her revenues are not enough to cover extra expenses. She needs to buy cement, grit, and zing among other construction materials so that she can put on a new roof and plaster walls in her home. Her goal is to provide comfort to her little ones.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 31-year-old, humble and kind married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with two children aged 7 and 10 years old, both attending school. He has been a teacher for three years, a profession he chose due to lack of school fees. He hopes to become a head teacher and educate his children despite low salary and detention. Charles is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu appreciates the fact that her previous loan improved her living standards. She used it to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is now requesting a new loan to buy utensils and more beverages for her snack bar. Saumu thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy utensils and more beverages for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined and hopeful. He operates a farm where he keeps sheep and dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the expensive animal feeds.

Paul will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, his life will be different. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sahnaz

texts.en:
Sahnaz is 42 years old and a married woman. She deals in a business selling milk in her locality. She has one cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  

This is her seventh year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business even more in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Asmati

texts.en:
Asmati, a 48-year-old married woman from the village of Rike, located in the Zugdidi district,  has seven family members, only two of whom have their own income. Her husband works as a taxi driver, generating an income of 500 GEL monthly. Asmati is a saleslady at a local store and is also involved in an agricultural business. They have three steers and three cows, the latter of whose milk products are sold locally. The family also cultivates a plot of land, growing nuts and kiwi fruit for local trading. 

Despite these income sources, the family needs more investments to cover their expenses and all daily costs. Asmati has therefore requested a loan to build a traditional Georgian bakery in order to bake bread and sell among the villagers. She anticipates building a base of loyal customers, as she will always have freshly baked bread at an appropriate price. This additional income will greatly help the family to improve their living conditions, and they will appreciate your help. Asmati awaits your support.

loans.use: To build a traditional Georgian bakery

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Celenia es madre soltera que ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus hijos con su empleo como asistente del hogar, hoy en día todos son mayores e independientes, ha venido apoyándose con crédito destinados a mejorar su vivienda que no presentaba buenas condiciones, hoy con el préstamo que solicita comprara materiales para reforzar el piso y poner cerámica, así ver una apariencia física más bonita y acogedora de su casita.
texts.en:
Celenia is a single mother who has struggled to advance her children while working as a household assistant. Now that they are grown and independent, Celenia has been able to help herself with loans destined to improve her home, which is not in good condition. 

With the loan she is currently requesting Celenia will purchase materials to reinforce the floor and install ceramic tiles, resulting in a prettier and more fitting appearance for her little house.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, sand, cement, and flagstones for a new floor.

loans.name: Piedad Santana  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Piedad Santana se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este es un grupo de  11 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ayudado de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios y su calidad de vida ya que son gente muy humilde que vive de lo poco que ganan en sus actividades. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios o venta de comidas.
Uno de los socios de este grupo es don Antonio, tiene 55 años de edad, está divorciado y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun viven con la mamá.
El señor Antonio es  un hombre muy trabajador que siempre le gusto salir adelante con su esfuerzo, el se dedica a la carpintería y al a compra y venta de material reciclable,  el todos los días en las mañanas y tardes recorre la ciudad en un triciclo recogiendo  y comprando cartones, hierro, latas, botellas, baterías de carros y todo el material que pueda ser reutilizado, luego de que tiene una buena cantidad de estos materiales los lleva  a vender a una recicladora de la localidad que le compran a muy buen precio. Así él se gana la vida de una manera honrada y puede enviarles para la alimentación de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar cartones, hierro, latas, botellas y todo tipo de material reciclable. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para realizar su labor.
texts.en:
The “Piedad Santana” communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi Canton, famous for it's rich pre-colonial culture and it's handicrafts which are recognized nationally and internationally. This is the home of the famous Panama hat. The group is composed of 11 women and 2 men who decided to get together to form a communal bank. This has helped them a lot as with the loans they have been able to improve their small businesses and their living standard. They are very modest people who live on the little they make from their businesses. They have different activities in commerce, service and selling food.

One of the members is Antonio who is 55 years old. He is divorced and has 4 children from this relationship. Two of them still live with their mother. Antonio is very hard-working who always likes to get ahead with his effort. He is a carpenter and buys and sells recyclable materials. He goes out every morning on his tricycle through the city collecting and buying cardboard, metal, cans, bottles, car batteries and any material that can be recycled. When he has a good quantity of these materials he takes them to a local recycler who buys them at a good price. So he makes his living in an honorable manner and can send money so that his children have food. 

The loan will be used to buy cardboard, metal, cans, bottles and all types of recyclables. He has been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes the support he gets from the loans. His dream is to have a vehicle to do his business.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, metal, tins, bottles and all types of recyclable materials.

loans.name: Poliito

texts.en: Poliito is a married, honest, and hardworking Ugandan man living in Kagadi. He has three children, ages 7, 5, and 1 year. He has been a teacher for nine years, and he also earns an income from farming. He was inspired to become a teacher because it is a good profession. He hopes to become successful in his career, despite the low pay. Poliito intends to use a loan to pay school fees for his children and to buy land.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy land

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es: Doña Julia, habita en una comarca a 5 Kilómetros de la Ciudad de Juigalpa, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad e independiente, ella se encarga del cuido de su mamá que es de la tercera edad, con sacrificios se traslada los cinco días de la semana en horas tempranas a sus labores que realiza en la Municipalidad como Conserje, y también en tiempo libres se dedica al cuido de su Pequeña Granja que ha ido estableciendo junto a su esposo el quien esta a cargo de ésta para obtener mayores ingresos ya que el salario devengado no es suficiente para su consumo mensual.  Ella necesita comprar Cemento, Piedras Canteras y otros materiales para brindar mejoras a su pequeña Granja de Pollos, así como también concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos, pues solo con sus ingresos no tiene la capacidad para realizar esta inversión.  su mayor sueño es mejorar su Granja y crecer en el Mercado para depender solo de esta Actividad por lo que su mamá a su edad no puede estar mucho tiempo sola.
texts.en:
Julia lives in a region 5 kilometers from the city of Juigalpa. All of her children are grown and independent, and she is responsible for caring for her elderly mother. Making sacrifices, she commutes five days a week at early hours to her job in the city as a caretaker. Also, in her free time, she works caring for her small farm which she established with her husband. He is in charge of it so they can make more income, since his salary is not enough for their monthly expenses. 

Julia needs to buy cement, quarry stone, and other materials to make improvements to her small chicken farm. She also needs chicken feed and vitamins since, with her income alone, she is unable to make this investment. Her biggest dream is to improve her farm and grow in the market so she can depend solely on this activity, because her mother cannot spend much time alone at her age.

loans.use: to buy cement, stones, gravel, and chicken feed and vitamins for her farm.

loans.name: Berman Martin

texts.es: Berman, habita en Juigalpa, siendo una persona de visión futura y positiva, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha venido mejorando su humilde vivienda donde habita con su esposa e hijos quienes estudian, el mayor en la Universidad y el menor en Secundaria, con su salario que devenga por su labor como fiscal para la municipalidad y prestamos obtenidos logró levantar las paredes de su vivienda así como otras mejoras, pero aun le quedan detalles por hacerle esta vez necesita hacerle Divisiones interna para crear habitaciones por lo que requiere comprar cemento, hierro piedras canteras, arenilla y pagar mano de obra.  Su mayor propósito es ver su Vivienda con todas las condiciones para que sus hijos gocen de un local digno donde habitar.
texts.en: Berman lives in Juigalpa and is an optimistic and forward-looking person. Through a lot of hard work and sacrifice, he has gradually improved his humble home where he lives with his wife and sons. His older son is in university, while the younger is in secondary school. Berman's salary as an auditor for the municipality, combined with loans, have allowed him to put up outer walls for his home and carry out some improvements, but there is still some work to do. He needs to put up walls inside the home in order to create rooms, and for this he will require cement, iron bars, quarry stone, and sand, and will need to pay for labour. His main goal is to improve his home so that his sons can have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy cement, quarry stone, fine sand, sand, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, a married father of seven, describes himself to be hopeful. For four years now he has been operating a butchery where he sells meat. His primary customers buy on a small scale. 

Thomas will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of meat. His business goal is to excel within five years, and he hopes that in the future, his life will be different. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stocks of meat

loans.name: Ekel

texts.en:
Ekel is a young woman from the Triangle region studying to be an advanced sports trainer at the prestigious Wingate Institute. Ekel set the goal of opening a sports gym, and just over six months ago she did. She offers aerobics, yoga, Zumba, kung fu and other classes. She already has 300 members utilizing her gym. Following her business plan, Ekel is expanding her equipment and services.

Ekel, with the support of her father, took the time to conduct a field study of potential clients using workout gyms from her village, and those were her first membership recruits. She wants to see 500 members in her first year and in the future become the sports gym for not just her town, but the surrounding kibbutzim and moshavim and area. She has excellent credentials and strong ties through Wingate.

Ekel has requested this loan to assist in purchasing treadmills, stationary bikes/spinning machines, free weights, and sofas for her lounge area.

loans.use: To assist in purchasing treadmills, stationary bikes/spinning machines, free weights, and sofas for her lounge area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of 3,000 helps Ghanim to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es: Doña Alda, de profesión modista, labor que es el sustento de cada día para ella y su familia, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos quienes están estudiando, Alda solicita el crédito con ánimos de completar una parte del techo y el piso de su casa que es como un pequeño anexo donde realiza sus costuras al aire libre, desea acondicionar esta área de la vivienda para ejercer de manera mas cómoda su labor.
texts.en:
Alda is a fashion designer, and this work sustains her and her family every day. She is responsible for her two children who are studying. 

Alda is requesting this loan to complete part of the roof and the floor in her house in a small annex where she does her sewing in the open air. She wants to air condition this part of her home to do her work more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting, cement, sand, and paving slabs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 65-year-old married man. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. Most of his customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge as operating the business on a rented premise. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future his life will be different. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región, Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir desde hace más de 8 años, también brinda servicio agrícola en las fincas de sus vecinos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles, para la compra de variedad de prendas y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Orland, 27, lives in the district of Zaña, a community whose income depends on agriculture, trade, and livestock, and which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Orlando has been earning a living by sewing clothing for more than 8 years. He also works on his neighbours' farms. He is requesting a loan of 1000 new sols to buy a variety of fabrics to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Concepcion Del Socorro

texts.es: Concepción  de 41 años de edad, habita en la Ciudad del Rama junto a su pequeño hijo de 10 años quien estudia en una escuela publica, ella ha venido mejorando la Infraestructura de Su vivienda con esfuerzo propio, trabaja para el poder judicial como notificador, con lo que gana no ajusta para realizar la inversión prevista ya que necesita comprar piedras Canteras, Piedrin, Arenilla, Hierro para un anexo de 6 metros cuadrados que pretende realizar en su vivienda y isa contar con mayor espacio y comodidad en su hogar.  se empeña en ver a su hijo todo un profesional.
texts.en:
Concepción is 41 years old and she lives in the city of Rama with her 10 year old son who studies at a public school. She has been improving the infrastructure of her home on her own. She works in the judicial department as a notifier, but what she earns is not enough to be able to make investments in her home. 

She needs to purchase quarry stones, paving slabs, fine sand, and iron for an extension of her house that measures 6 square meters. She hopes to be more comfortable and to have more space in her home. She works hard so that she can see her son working as a professional.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, paving slabs, iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a 22-year-old young man. He lives with his parents and earns an income by controlling the condition of the water channels. He has been working in this area for 1 year but has already gained good skills. His monthly income is 200 AZN.

Water channels are very important because they supply water for many regions. It’s a very hard and responsible job to control their condition because there are many factories and other industrial buildings in the region.  Rovshan controls the condition of the channels throughout the year and does everything he can to keep them clean. He takes water from the channels for analysis and sends it to a laboratory. 

Rovshan has a hard but very low-paid job and his income doesn’t cover life’s demands. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to buy new quality equipment for water analysis because he wants to do his job properly.

loans.use: to buy new quality equipment for water analysis

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia es una persona trabajadora y responsable, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Monteagudo, en una casa en alquiler, economicamente es independiente, su actividad es la confección de ropa de vestir de la cual genera sus ingresos y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella. Actualmente solicita un crédito que destinara para la compra de materia prima para confección de prendas de vestir, compra de maquina overlock, y vitrinas para la exhibición de su trabajo, de esta forma podrá incrementar la cantidad de su trabajo, podrá obtener mayores ingresos provenientes de su actividad y por consiguiente mejorara sus condiciones de vida, la señora tiene muchas ganas de superarse  y en un futuro quiere hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Lidia is a hard-working, responsible person. She is 22 years old and she lives in the town of Monteagudo, where she rents a house. She is economically independent. She manufactures clothing which is how she generates her income. She doesn't have any children who depend on her. Currently, she is seeking a loan which she will use to purchase raw materials to make clothing, to buy an overlock machine, and display cabinets where she will present her work. In this way, she will be able to produce more, and, as a result, she will be able to have a higher income. Thus, she will be able to improve her living conditions. Lidia is eager to succeed and, in the future, she would like to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make clothing, to buy an overlock machine, and to display cabinets to present her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (casual men's and women's clothing and some children's clothing lines) to start her business with which she hopes to be able to provide a good quality of life to her son, as she is a single mother and the head of her household.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic containers and coolers.

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush is 31 years old and lives in the village Gargar in Lori region. She has no higher education. Since a very young age, she has been engaged in farming. Since getting married she has become even more serious about it. She has two school-aged children. Her husband is currently in the Russian Federation for work.  He transfers money for his family from there every two months.

Most of the care of the children and also the farm and hardships connected with it are Vardanush's responsibility. Her farm is not very rich with cattle. She has a cow, a heifer and a calf, so she manages to sell very little milk with a miserable income. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes. Most of the income she gets is from selling to re-sellers. Vardanush says that no matter how long and how hard she works in her farm, many of the needs of her children and her farm are unmet.

Vardanush wants to sell more farm products with greater income, so she asks for this loan in order to buy bulls and also fertilizer for her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy bulls and also fertilizer for her agricultural activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en:
Maqsooda is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children. 

For about six years, she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Ulvi

texts.en:
Ulvi is a 22-year-old single man. He lives with his brother and builds channels for artificial irrigation. He has been working in this field for one year, and he learns more and more from day to day. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

Azerbaijan regions develop very fast, and many irrigational channels are built every year. These channels are used to supply water to fields, farms and gardens. Irrigation improves the supply of moisture and nutrients for plant roots, reduces the temperature of the surface air layer and increases the humidity.

Ulvi likes his job because he understands its responsibility, and he wants to realize himself in this area. But unfortunately, his income is too low to cover demands. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to supply good equipment for artificial irrigation building. 

Good productivity with quality equipment will increase the monthly income of the small company where Ulvi works.

loans.use: to supply good equipment for artificial irrigation building.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old, married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past many years, she has been running a business, selling bed sheets, covers, and pillows. She buys bed sheets in bulk from the market, at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and she is able to earn enough money through her business. 

Parveen requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of bed sheets, covers, and spreads in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers. Parveen expects a boost in her earnings with her loan. She plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of bed sheets, covers, and spreads in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.en:
This nice and very charming woman is 23 years old. She lives in the village of Gagarin in Gegharkunik region. Anzhelika has no higher education and married very young. She lives with her husband’s parents. She has two sons, who are small and need great attention and care.

Since she got married, Anzhelika has been engaged in farming. On her farm she has two cows, three calves, two bulls, four sheep and four lambs. She is a very active and hard-working person. From her farm she sells milk, dairy products and meat of two types. For all these she has her loyal customers. 

Anzhelika wants to have a richer farm and is ready for any hard work connected with it. Anzhelika asks for this loan in order to buy a cow and fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia lives in Kampala. She is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her sister and elderly mother). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Flavia operates a beauty salon on a retail basis in a shop. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week and has no additional source of income. Her business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. 

Flavia has requested for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy hair treatments, oils, relaxers, braids and weaves. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge so she can sell cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, oils, relaxers, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 44-year-old married woman and the  mother of five children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a farmer living in the Siongiroi area of South Rift Kenya with his wife and two children, both of school-going age. He enjoys farming because of the profits he gets out of it and has been doing it for the past six years. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and a variety of crops. His biggest challenge in farming is during drought seasons, when he doesn't get much produce.

Cosmas has taken a Kiva loan because he wants to purchase a chaff cutter, which will help him cut nappier grass with ease for his dairy cows. This will cause the cows to produce more milk, which will lead to more profit. This will improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchasing a chaff cutter

loans.name: Emilio Antonio

texts.es:
Emilio Antonio tiene 68 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de comida de en su Restaurant, ubicada en su domicilio que el mismo prepara, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una congeladora para almacenar víveres, con ello le permitirá guardar sus alimentos y bebidas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emilio Antonio is 68 years old. He lives with his wife and children in  Pucará, which is a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and ranching located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the mountains of northern Peru. 

He makes and sells food in his restaurant, located in his home. He has applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles in order to buy a freezer to store foodstuffs, which he will be able to offer to his clients.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more biscuits, cooking oil, soap, soda, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Bukuru Sung-Bagurugu Group

texts.en:
Fati is a 40-year-old married woman living with the husband and three children in Bagurugu, a community in Northern Ghana. Fati is the sixth person squatting from the right as you face their group picture. Their group is called Bukuru Sung-Bagurugu Women's Association.

All the members are involved in the business of picking and processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been in the business for the past three years. They process high premium shea butter, some of which are sold to aggregators and are exported to the European and USA markets. Fati sells the butter to many other customers in Ghana. The group is therefore requesting for a loan of GHȼ 10,700 to help them increase productivity by buying 80 bags of shea nuts, two shea nut roasters, and to pay for the cost of labor and fuel during processing activities.

Fati hopes to increase her income so as to support her family to have regular food to eat, buy educational materials for her three children. and repay this loan.

loans.use: to increase productivity by buying 80 bags of shea nuts, 2 shea nut roasters, and to pay for the cost of labor and fuel during processing activities.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
This group is called Promise, and it consists of two ladies who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of GHS 2,500 from ID-Ghana Microfinance. They sell fruit, underwear, slippers, soft drinks and groceries.

Felicia is a hardworking woman. She is single and lives with her two children in a rented house in Teshie. She is the featured borrower of the group. 

She started her business selling fruit, slippers and underwear at her residence seven years ago. She started her business with a small amount of capital of hers. Later, she joined ID-Ghana so that she can take a loan to supplement her business capital. She is on her sixth loan cycle, and this has helped her to improve the conditions of her life. 

She is very thankful for Kiva lenders. Year-by-year, her business improved more and more. She has good experience with this business. Thanks to her experience, she deals with her own business with ease. 

To further improve her business, Felicia applied for another loan of GHS 1,500 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase more fruit, underwear and slippers so that she can resell them to her customers.

Felicia looks forward to expanding her business, and she hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, underwear, and slippers so that she can resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Norah, a farmer living in the rich highlands of Litein, about an hour’s drive from Kericho in the South rift area of Kenya. She is a farmer and has been doing it for the past eight years. This is her main source of income where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of fruits and vegetables. Her biggest challenge in farming is diseases affecting crops and livestock.

She wants to venture more into horticultural farming which involves produce like pineapples, maize, and vegetables. Norah says that this will help her get more income which will enable her to pay for her growing children’s school fees and her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to do horticultural farming.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region, and she is of 36 years old. She has no higher education and no other occupation except farming. In her farm, Bela has two cows, two bulls, two calves, a heifer, four goats, five goatlings and also 20 chickens. She also cultivates potatoes on her plot of land, which she sells at the city wholesale market. The sale of her farm goods (a range of dairy products, eggs, and meat) allows her to solve the majority of her family’s financial problems. Bela is married and she has two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a constructor and works by order. Bela says that she wants to develop her farm and increase the number of farm cattle she owns.

She asks for this loan in order to buy one more cow and two more calves. She really hopes that this loan will bring good profit and financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and two more calves

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kampala. She is married, with three children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Sylivia sells second-hand clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis. She sells her goods by moving from door-to-door. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She works six days a week.  

Sylivia has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 (Ugandan shillings) to buy a bale of second-hand bed sheets. Her business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to get a permanent business premise and to a build a residential house. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand bed sheets.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio is an artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I've worked with silver jewelry since 2009. At first, I saw it as an opportunity, and learned the crafting techniques. But as time passed, I realized it was more than this, that designing is a way to express art through jewelry. Silver jewelry, and especially filigree, has a special attraction for each person. I feel proud of my work."

"I would like to thank everyone who has contributed to this micro-credit for their support. It is comforting to know that our art is both valued and appreciated."

Use the link below to view Jose Antonio's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8493

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 40 years old and married with 3 children and 2 additional dependents (his parents who are very old). He deals in cattle fattening and milking as his major source of income. He owns 15 cows of which the majority are for milk. Through income gotten from selling milk, Wilson has managed to look after his family, including his parents, by providing them with medication, paying school fees for his 2 school-going children and constructing a permanent house for the family.

Wilson is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more milk cows to increase on his milk production and also to buy drugs for his sick cows. His major challenge is the dry season which leads to inadequate grass to feed his animals. A prolonged dry season causes a lack of water leading to a decrease in milk supply

His dream is to own a milk cooling plant in his region. Wilson is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza lives in the village of Tsovaber in the Gegharkunik region. She graduated from Sevan city trading college. For 10 years she worked as a cook at a rest house, but now her only occupation is farming and agriculture. 

She is married and she has a son who works at a private company as a security guard. Her husband is a constructor. Her family greatly helps her around their farm, but the main work is Roza’s duty. She has 2 cows, a bull and a pig. From her farm she sells milk and homemade cheese and butter. 

Roza says she is happy with her work and with its income that helps, together with her husband’s salary, to sustain their family. She asks for this loan in order to buy fodder for her farm cattle to eat until the fields are full of green and fresh grass.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm cattle to eat until the fields are full of green and fresh grass.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Meet Hellen, a mother of 2 children who lives in the Litein area of South rift, Kenya. She is a well established farmer who really enjoys herself when she is at it. She has been farming for the past 20 years producing and selling milk, eggs, crops and vegetables, and she also has a retail business. Her biggest challenge is insufficient funds.

Hellen developed an interest in this KIVA loan because she wanted to construct a greenhouse that will help her crops to do very well because of better conditions for growth and development. This will generate more income for her and thus improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: For construction of a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ramal

texts.en:
Ramal is a 24-year-old young man who lives with his parents and a brother. He has been working for a water project company for 2 years and builds, repairs and controls the condition of irrigation channels. His monthly income is 200AZN and this amount doesn’t cover his family’s needs. 

Channels are artificial bodies of water erected for directing and controlling the flow of water. Many companies build irrigation channels. To obtain stable and high crop yields, these channels are used for artificial injection of water into the soil that is experiencing persistent or recurrent lack of moisture. 

Ramal is very interested in this area and wants to expand his business. He wants to make this work more profitable and of high quality. He applied for 1200AZN in order to buy new irrigation tools for artificial irrigation.

loans.use: to buy new irrigation tools for artificial irrigation.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya will be very happy because of her second deal with Kiva. Her first deal with Kiva was last year in the same month (May) and she used the loan for the purchase of a large lot of summer season dresses and blouses for her clothes trading business. 

She continues to live in Ijevan city in the Tavush region with her daughter and grandchildren. The main income of this family still remains Sonya’s business income. She sells merchandise in a rented stall at a market in Ijevan city and she buys all the merchandise from wholesale markets in Yerevan and from neighboring countries also. 

She likes her occupation very much and she has dozens of loyal customers. Generally, thanks to her polite and patient attitude, she never has a lack of customers. Now again she needs to buy a summer clothes collection for summer season trading.

Sonya asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a summer season collection of colorful, fashionable and attractive clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy colorful, fashionable and attractive clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 41-year-old married lady from Tulkarem city. She lives with her husband and nine children, eight sons and one daughter, in an old house. For the past ten years, Asmaa has been working at raising sheep. She has a huge number of them and she always wants to improve her business. 

She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy feeds and straw for her stock. By taking this loan, Asmaa will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Asmaa appears in the photo at her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and straw for her stock.

loans.name: Om Hasen Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Hasen. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Hameda is 32 years old and a mother of four children. Her oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old. Hameda works as a tailor. Her business was set up in her place of residence 8 years ago. She sews all kinds of clothes for the people in her area.  She is very detail-oriented and does very good work. This allows her to have the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors. 

She earns good profits from this business, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. Hameda wants to improve her business but she doesn't have enough money for that, so she is asking for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase more sewing materials in order to expand her business. She looks forward to providing her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 19-year-old single man who has been working in an aluminum business since 2010. He used to help his brother who runs the same business, and he got the best experience necessary to start his own shop. He is a hard worker who is putting much effort into developing his business.

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for his business development. The requested car will help him move his tools and requested materials from one place to another easily and will require less time to finish a certain job.

Najah had a previous loan experience with Al Majmoua, and the loan was invested in developing his business through increasing his business capital with aluminum pillars, and it was very helpful. At the same time he proved to be a borrower in good standing. 

He hopes that in the future he can expand his workplace and increase his merchandise so he can work on larger projects and recruit others to help him in finishing the requested projects.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for the development of his business.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a carpentry business where he makes chairs, beds, tables and other types of furniture. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a suitable location, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy timber and other carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have a sustainable business. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is a 30-year-old married refugee. She has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a laborer, and they live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. The main source of income for the family is gardening. Sona has been raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for five years, and her monthly income is 220 AZN. 

Fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People buy fruits to make juice or fruit salad and use vegetables to cook delicious national dishes such as dovgha, doghramajh, kuku, etc.

Sona’s income doesn’t cover the family’s needs. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to build a greenhouse for her garden and buy good fertilizers. This will increase her harvest and income, and Sona will be able to provide her children with a good life and education.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for her garden and buy good fertilizers.

loans.name: Sariya

texts.en:
Sariya is a 24-year-old single lady who is working hard to support her father in covering their four family members’ living expenses through working at a telemarketing and customer service company.  She has worked there since January 2014, with four years of experience in this domain. 

Although she is working hard to support her father in their living, she is also studying business management and is putting so much effort to develop her living. Sariya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her university tuition fees. 

She is looking forward to opening an accessories selling shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Adom Group

texts.en:
This group is called Adom, and it consists of seven ladies who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of GHS 5,000 from ID-Ghana Micro finance. They sell maize, gari (cassava flour), vegetables, cassava, plantain, kente, wax prints, groceries and fish. 

Regina is a hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her family in a rented house in Teshie. She is the featured borrower of the group. She started her business seven years ago, selling vegetables, especially 'kontomire' (a green, leafy vegetable from the cocoyam) and salted fish from door-to-door. 

She started her business with a small amount of capital. She joined ID-Ghana so that she could take a loan to supplement her business capital. She is on her second loan cycle and this has helped her to improve the conditions of her life. She is very thankful for Kiva lenders. Year-by-year, her business has improved more and more. She has good experience with this business. Thanks to her experience, she deals with her own business with ease. 

To further improve her business, Regina applied for another loan of GHS 800 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase more vegetables, especially 'kontomire' and salted fish, so that she can resell them to her customers. Regina looks forward to expanding her business, and she hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables, especially 'kontomire' and salted fish, so that she can resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Agata

texts.en: Agata is a hardworking married woman, aged 32, living in Kigali, Uganda.  She has three children, aged between two to five,  and two of them are in school. She has been a teacher for nine years (inspired by patriotism and love for the profession) and earns money from crop production also. She hopes to upgrade her qualifications and get promotions despite her current low salary. Agata is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition and says she is determined to repay the loan as per the schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.
