loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo tiene 61 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evaristo is 61 years old. He lives in the Pucará district, a community that is dedicated to farming, business, and livestock. It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.

He provides public transportation service with his own motortaxi, transporting passengers to neighboring zones of his district. He seeks a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy parts for his vehicle and in this way provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni-Bagurugu Group

texts.en:
Arishetu is an active woman, 45 years old, from Bagurugu in the Northern part of Ghana. Arishetu is married and has eight children. (She is the fourth person from the left,  squatting in their group picture.) Arishetu is a member of shea nut pickers and shea butter processing group who have been in business for the last three years. Their group is called ‘Suglo Nbori Buni-Bagurugu’ Women Association. She makes good profits from the business. All of the members of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality premium shea butter which Planet Finance (Shea butter marketing company) buys and exports.

Arishetu and the group have asked for a loan of 10,000 GHS to enable them pay the cost of 19 labourers to pick 73 bags of shea nuts, the cost of two roster machines and the cost of fuel  for the roasting and extraction of shea butter.  By so doing, she would increase productivity and be able to repay the loan and support her children’s educational and food needs.

loans.use: Pay the cost of 19 labourers to pick 73 bags of shea nuts, cost of 2 roster machines and cost of fuel  for the roasting and extraction of shea butter.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores como lechones, cuyes, patos, pavos desde hace 02 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Soledad is 43 years old. She lives in the Cayalti district, a community that is dedicated to farming, business, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

She has worked selling small animals such as piglets, guinea pigs, ducks, turkeys for 2 years. Her business is located behind her home. She has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy balanced animal feed to fatten her animals and to then sell them at a better price to her customers.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, gallos, pollos, gallinas, cuyes, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 26 years old. She lives in the Oyotún district, a community that is dedicated to farming, business, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as ducks, roosters, chickens, hens, guinea pigs. She raises them in the area behind his home. She has asked for a loan for 500 nuevos soles to buy balanced animal feed to fatten her animals and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Elyamin

texts.en:
Elyamin is a 46-year-old refugee. He is married and has three sons. His wife is a housekeeper. Elyamin has a monthly income from poultry. He has been raising and selling chickens for 22 years and knows everything about this area. His monthly income is 200 AZN and his older son helps him in this business.

People buy chickens, eggs and hens and use them in order to cook different delicious dishes and salads. That’s why poultry is in high demand in Azerbaijan.

Elyamin’s income doesn’t cover the family’s needs and he has to increase it. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to repair his chicken coop and improve its condition for good productivity.

loans.use: to repair his chicken coop and improve its condition for good productivity

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío del Pilar tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a crianza y venta de animales menores (patos, cuyes, pavos) en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar is 31 years old. She lives in the Cayalti district, a community that is dedicated to farming, business, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

He works raising and selling small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, ducks) behind his home. He seeks a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy balanced animal feed to fatten his animals and then later sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge, the high cost of transportation in her place of operation, but she appreciates the support of the previous loan, which helped her to boost her business.

Here again, she is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en: Mavis and her friend are members of the Christo Nti Group and live in Teshie. Mavis is 24 years old and married to Gregory, who works at an electricity company. Mavis has been selling materials and wax prints in a kiosk for three years. She has built up trust with her customers and therefore has a good relationship with them. This will be her third loan with the field partner, ID-Ghana. She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and to buy more materials and wax-prints for resale. In this way, she hopes to improve her earnings. In the coming years, Mavis would like to be a supplier to a large number of people.

loans.use: To buy more materials and wax-prints for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mejumaa has operated a business selling palm leaves for thatching houses for the past one year. She sells to her neighbors and house constructors who come to buy from her.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a wholesale shop for selling palm leaves in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for resale

loans.name: Syokau

texts.en:
Syokau operates a food selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Chimnaz

texts.en:
Chimnaz is a 47-year-old refugee. She is married and has a daughter and two sons. The family lives in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer and this is the way he earns money for the family but the main source of income is husbandry. She has been breeding and selling cows for 18 years. Her monthly income is 180 AZN and she has a good practice in this field.

Chimnaz breeds cows, fattens them and then sells them for a profitable price at a local bazaar. Additionally she prepares dairy products such as milk, cheese, yoghurt and sour milk. These products are in high demand because people use them every day.

Chimnaz has one cow at the moment and her monthly income doesn’t cover the family’s needs. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy three cows and increase productivity and income from husbandry.

loans.use: to buy three cows and increase productivity

loans.name: Tobiko

texts.en:
Hello World! Meet Tobiko, an ambitious, presentable, taut, 26-year-old Maasai Extension Officer at Juhudi Kilimo. Tobiko hails from Narosura, which is a settlement on an often neglected road in the semi-arid Rift Valley region of Kenya. He has been with Juhudi Kilimo for 15 months now. His work mainly entails training smallholder farmers. With a professional career that straddles science and agriculture, he gets the best of both worlds.

Tobiko is seeking a loan of KES 500,000 to pursue a Master’s degree in Agricultural Information Management. He is very comfortable with the repayment period and monthly installments.

“My main role at Juhudi is to offer technical expertise and oversee the adoption of new training models for training small holder farmers in rural areas in conjunction with other experts in the industry. My zest in seeing productive farms and sustainable livelihood was born out of the community I belong to.”

Tobiko was raised in a traditional Maasai community. He takes pride in coming from the independent pastoral tribe. Members of this tribe live off blood, milk and meat from their cattle.

Growing up, Tobiko keenly observed the changes in the world outside his community and understood the adaptations they have to embrace as a community in order to keep up with modernization. He sees a lot of opportunities in education and commerce to improve his community’s livelihood.

Tobiko passed high school exams with flying colors. He was admitted to the University of Nairobi, which is the largest university in Kenya. He selected an undergraduate degree course in agriculture to learn diverse farm practices that would help communities based in arid areas ensure food security. He specialized in animal science.

His first job was as a technical assistant in an agrochemical company where he sold animal pharmaceuticals and trained farmers in Narok, his home county. Later, he joined Juhudi Kilimo.

“The knowledge and skills I will gain from furthering my studies will enable me to conduct complex agricultural research. Through research, I will contribute to knowledge on agronomic practices. I will also be able to provide information on weather, ‘drought-bursting’ technologies, water resources, and livelihood diversification. All this is to ensure economic development and food security in remote areas in Kenya.”

Your loan will equip Tobiko with relevant skills to better train Juhudi farmers. He will also use his expertise to help impact, motivate and inspire members of his community to become better pastoralists and diversify into more lucrative farming practices.

Today, Tobiko is also a self-driven entrepreneur. He made a worthwhile investment keeping dairy goats and growing tomatoes on his father’s farm. As a first born, he wants to set the bar high for his siblings and others who look up to him.

His life’s mission is to drive economic development and poverty alleviation in communities living in arid and semi-arid areas. “These communities face unique challenges such as drought, poverty, illiteracy, forced early marriages and poor health,” he said.

In the next ten years, Tobiko sees himself being an agribusiness advisor, a policy maker and a big time farmer.

loans.use: to pursue further studies

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es: Johana de 36 años, habita en su humilde casita con su hijo de 9 años quien cursa sus estudios escolares, madre soltera, y con muchos deseos de superar, labora como alguacil en el Poder Judicial, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo en sus estudios y mejorar su vivienda, la que aun le quedan algunos detalles por mejorar, ella necesita realizar un anexo de 9 metros cuadrados para ello es necesario comprar piedras canteras, bloques, piedrin, cemento y pagar mano de obra pues con lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir este gasto.  su mayor sueño es dejarle a su pequeño un hogar digno que sera el patrimonio una vez que falte ella.
texts.en:
Johana is 36 years old. She lives in a humble house with her 9 year old son who is in school. She is a single mother, with great desire to succeed. She works as an court clerk in the judicial court. With great sacrifice she has been able to support her son's education and improve their home.

There are still some details to improve on her home. She needs to add a 9 square meter addition so she needs to buy stone, cement blocks, gravel, cement, and pay for labor. With her wages she does not earn enough to cover this expense. Her greatest dream is to leave her son a small, dignified home as an inheritance once she is no longer on this earth.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, sand, iron and other construction materials.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris operates a poultry selling business, and apparently she seems to be doing well with the business. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Damaris dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is the mother of two little daughters. She is 26 and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two sisters-in-law. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as Monika's husband's work is the only source of income for this seven-member family. He generates approximately 400 GEL monthly, which is really hardly enough to satisfy the basic needs of the family. Monika wasn't able to get a higher education or study a professional career. That's why she can't find any stable job. For doing her bit for the family's welfare, Monika requested a loan. She plans to purchase all needed equipment, particularly ovens and refrigerators and tableware and open a cafe in the center of the village. Her regular customers will be locals and passersby as well.

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children with a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Monika is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate her own income.

loans.use: to open a cafe

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Mwanamisi is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to boost her kiosk, purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for resale

loans.name: Alfredo Luis

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región, Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos y servicios naturales, tiene clientes considerables, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 46 years old, and he lives in the district of Zaña, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade, and livestock-raising. It is located within the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.

He sells natural products and services, and he has a considerable amount of customers. He has requested a loan of 1,600 nuevos soles in order to purchase of a variety of products to offer to his customers, and in this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Everlyn, a member of Nyabite South Women Group in the Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya, where she has been farming for the past 14 years. Everlyn's primary source of income is milk and eggs. She also has a retail business as an extra source of income. Everlyn is married and has 3 children, all of school-going age. Her greatest challenge in farming is lack of capital for maintaining her dairy farm.

Everlyn took this loan to expand her dairy farm by buying a dairy cow that will increase the amount of milk that she sells. This will increase her income and hence give her children a better education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 47 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y productos de picantería, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 47 years old. She lives in the district of Zaña, a community that specializes in agriculture, commerce, and livestock located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling beverages and spicy dishes. Her business is located inside her home. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of garments to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Nyangereka Kweterana Development Association Group

texts.en: Matayo is a Ugandan married man, aged 76 years, with 6 children aged between 37 and 20 years, all having attended school. He lives in Kagadi where he has been farming and selling produce for 4 years. Matayo hopes to educate his grandchildren and grow his businesses despite price fluctuations. Matayo is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for selling. He is a member of Nyangereka Kweterana Development Association, where the members guarantee each other's loans since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for selling.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in the Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya, where he has been farming for the past 10 years. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea and a retail business. Richard is married and has 3 children, all of school-going age. He states that, as much as he loves his farming, his biggest challenge is lack of capital to maintain his dairy farming.

Richard chose Juhudi Kilimo for this KIVA loan because he wants to boost his dairy farming. He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will bring in more income through more milk production and thus more sales. Richard says that this will boost him up financially so that he will be able to provide for his family’s needs and, more so, his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en:
Shamimu lives in Kampala. She is married and has 3 children, all going to school. Shamimu has additional family members. 

For the past 5 years, Shamimu has been selling snacks in a kiosk on a retail basis from the market. She works seven days a week. Shamimu has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef and spices. Her business challenges include selling perishable products and seasonality. 

Shamimu's goal and aspiration is to build a house. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Shamimu's major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bag of irish potatoes,cooking oil and beef

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Meet Martha, a very well-established farmer in the Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya. She really enjoys farming and especially dairy farming. Martha has been at it for the past 30 years, with her primary income sources being milk, eggs, tea, bananas and sugarcane. Her biggest challenge is lack of capital for keeping dairy cows.

Martha took this loan to purchase another dairy cow that will help generate more income for her by producing more milk.  This will enable her to engage in more farming projects, expand her farm and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven, 48 years old, lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells beer and sodas along a busy street and earns a side income from farming. Steven started his business to improve his income. He hopes to educate his children and expand his business, despite being worried by competition. Steven wants  a loan to buy beer and sodas.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo is a 59-year-old pensioner from the city of Kutaisi. She lives with her husband, who also gets monthly assistance from the local government. The family has a small income from renting an apartment. 

Dodo has a great desire to start a small agricultural activity and increase the family's income. She requested a loan and was approved for the start up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start their own businesses. Dodo will use the requested loan to build a greenhouse and she will sell the harvested products seasonally. Dodo and her husband rely on the good will of lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain her agri-business.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala. She is married and has 3 children and all of them go to school.  She has an additional family member (father).

She sells fruits and vegetables. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from making African crafts. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cow peas, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes. Her business challenge includes selling perishable products and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy  onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cowpeas, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni lives in Kampala. She is single with two children and both of her children go to school.  She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has no additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings to buy hair treatments, oils, relaxers, braids and weaves. Her business challenges include electricity and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge to sell cold drinks. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy hair treatments, oils, relaxers, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is a widow and has a business buying and selling soft drinks and liqueur in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Julieta requested a PHP 4,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for two years now. With your help Julieta will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Julieta  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Justa

texts.en: Justa works hard to support her family. Justa is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance. Justa has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Justa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Hace 3 años, Paula de 47, llegó a vivir a un barrio nuevo, donde tenía que iniciar desde cero. Fue entonces cuando decidió hacer y vender tortillas en la puerta de su casa. Poco a poco fue ahorrando con el dinero que recibía y entonces emprendió con su propia pulpería, sin dejar a lado lo que le dio la oportunidad de crecer: la venta de tortillas. Después todo ha ido caminando un poco lento, pero con pasos seguros.
Paula cuenta con una familia unida, quienes le brindan apoyo; su esposo, quien trabaja como policía, y sus hijos, quienes cuidan el negocio cuando ella no puede atenderlo. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar leche, azúcar, arroz, entre otros granos básicos como frijol para poder ofrecerles los mejores productos a sus clientes. Esto le permitirá incrementar su venta e ingresos y así poder cumplir con su meta de tener una pulpería más grande y variada. Las expectativas de Paula siempre han sido positivas y llenas de sonrisas, es cuando asegura, que esto es lo que le ha permitido crecer muy bien.
texts.en:
Three years ago, Paula who is 47, came to live in a new neighborhood, where she had to start from zero. That is when she decided to make and sell tortillas at the door of her house. Little by little she started saving with the money that she received and then started her own general store, without putting aside the thing that gave her the opportunity to grow: the sale of tortillas. Since then everything has progressed a bit slowly, but surely. 

Paula counts on her united family, who provide her with support: her husband, who works as a policeman, and her children, who look after the business when she cannot attend to it. The loan that she requests is to buy milk, sugar, rice, and basic grains like beans to be able to offer the best products to her customers. This will allow her to increase her sales and revenue and that way be able to meet her goal of having a larger and more diverse store. Paula's prospects have always been positive, and she is full of smiles when she asserts that this is what has allowed her to succeed.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, and basic grains like beans.

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
A sus 24 años, Jesica ha tenido que trabajar con todo su esfuerzo lavando y planchando ropa de otros para pagar sus estudios de Licenciatura en Psicología en la UCN de Carazo. Desde hace 5 años arregla entusiasmada sus libros el viernes para ir a clases los sábados y contribuir más con el objetivo de su carrera, el cual es ayudar con el desarrollo personal tanto de ella como de otras personas.
Jesica está a punto de culminar sus estudios, ha pasado tiempos económicos malos donde no podía comprar los libros de sus clases o no tenía cómo pagar sus exámenes y terminaba pagando más con la reprogramación. Es por ello que necesita de un préstamo para poder pagar su curso de titulación y el título como licenciada en psicología. Préstamo que le ayudara a tener su licenciatura y a conseguir un mejor empleo en el área que se está especializando. Entre sus metas principales está, sacar una especialización y estudiar la carrera de diseño gráfico, ya que para ella entre más conocimiento, en mejor persona uno se puede convierte.
texts.en:
At 24 years old, Jesica has had to work with all her effort washing and ironing the clothing of others in order to pay for her university studies in Psychology at the UCN in Carazo. For 5 years she has enthusiastically arranged her books on Fridays in order to go to class on Saturdays and make progress toward her career, which is to help the personal development of herself as well as others. Jessica is at the point of finishing her studies. She has experienced difficult economic times where she wasn't able to buy the books for her classes or didn't have the funds to pay for her exams and ended up paying more with retaking courses.

Therefore she needs a loan to be able to pay for her final degree course and license in psychology. The loan will help her have her license and to acquire a better job in the area of her specialty. Among her main goals to pursue a specialty and study a career in graphic design, because for her the more knowledge, the better person she can be.

loans.use: to pay for her university degree.

loans.name: Rodolfo Trinidad

texts.es:
Desde hace cinco años, Rodolfo inició un camino que no todos tiene la oportunidad de recorrer, pero que es necesario transitar para tener un buen crecimiento profesional, ese camino es el de sus estudios universitarios. Rodolfo  tiene 24 años y está a punto de terminar su licenciatura de Contabilidad en la universidad UCN de Jinotepe. Antes sufrió una crisis económica y tuvo que trabajar como profesor para pagar sus estudios, pero siguió adelante, ya que siempre le ha gustado contabilidad y considera que es una herramienta económica dentro del hogar y la base del sustento para la vida.
Todos los sábados recuerda sus planes de crear su propia empresa o sus metas próximas de estudiar otra licenciatura como Derecho, es entonces cuando se despierta con más ganas para salir adelante y cumplir con su primer título. Por esta razón es que solicita de un préstamo para poder tener su curso de titulación y pagar todos los gastos de tramites de su título. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, en especial de su padre quien es guarda de seguridad de una universidad, quien le ayuda con lo que puede económicamente.
texts.en:
Five years ago Rodolfo began a path that not everyone has the opportunity to take, but it is a necessary one to take in order to have good professional growth. This is the road of studying at the university. Rodolfo is 24 years old and he is at the point of completing his degree in accounting at the UCN university in Jinotepe. Previously he suffered an economic crisis and had to work as a teacher to pay his studies. But he continued moving forward, as he has always like accounting and he considers it an economic tool within the home and the basis for sustaining life.

Every Saturday he remembers his plans to create his own business or his next goals such as studying for a law degree. It is then when he has greater desire to succeed and finish his first degree. For this reason he seeks a loan to be able to pay for his licensing fees for his professional certificate. Fortunately he has the support of his family, especially his father who is a security guard at the university and helps he as he can economically.

loans.use: to pay all the expenses of his certification paperwork.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 44 года, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Анары средне-специальное медицинское образование, долгое время она проработала медицинской сестрой, на сегодняшний день в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2001 году с 30,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Анары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 1 дойная корова и 10 овец. Также есть 5,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупки минеральных удобрений, семян фасоли и ГСМ. Анара намерена получить хороший урожай со своего участка, и увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в обучение детей.
texts.en:
Anara is 44 years old and she is raising three children with her husband.  She has a specialized secondary education in the field of healthcare and for many years she used to work as a nurse.  However she is currently involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute the main source of income for her family.  She started in this business in 2001 with an initial capital of 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her perseverance and hard work, she now owns one dairy cow and 10 sheep.  She also has five hectares of land and annually grows beans which are consumed within the family or sold. 

Anara makes a gross income of about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy mineral fertilizers, bean seeds and fuel.  She intends to get a good harvest from her land.  She would also like to increase her cattle headcount, which will directly lead to an increase in the family's capital.  She plans to invest the earnings from her loan to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, bean seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар 31 год, замужем, есть 1 ребенок. У нее- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2010 году. Нилуфар имеет большой опыт работы в сельском хозяйстве и знает всю технологию производства. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Нилуфар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы. Дополнительно Нилуфар предоставляет швейные услуги местному населению, шьет одеяла, подушки, матрацы под реализацию. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и швейной продукции составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нилуфар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на строительство большого сарая для содержания животных.
texts.en: Nilufar is 31 years old, married, and the mother of one child.  She has a secondary education and works in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this field in 2010.  Nilufar is an experienced farmer with a good knowledge of farming technology.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, she now owns two dairy cows.  Additionally, she also provides sewing services: she sews comforters, pillows and mattresses, which she then sells to the local residents.  Each month, she makes 20,000 som (KGS) from her sewing business and the sale of milk.  In order to further develop her activity, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some calves and increase her cattle headcount.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her cattle headcount.  She would also like to save some money to build a large barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purcahse denim material for making jeans

loans.name: Salvador Jordan

texts.es:
Salvador proviene de una familia de padres separados, tanto su padre como su madre tienen nuevos compromisos y ninguno se hace cargo de su crianza. El vive en Lima junto a sus abuelos paternos que han sabido cubrir con mucho amor las carencias afectivas que pudo tener desde la partida de sus progenitores, ellos debido a su avanzada edad no laboran y su único ingreso es el que perciben por el alquiler de parte de su vivienda como local comercial, el cual no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de educación del joven Salvador, por lo que no seria posible que continúe estudiando sin el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Sus abuelos están orgullosos de el por su deseo de superación pese a todas las dificultades que ha vivido desde tan pequeño.
El desea concluir sus estudios y trabajar en una gran empresa para poder retribuir a sus abuelos todo lo que le han dado y agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva todo el apoyo que le proporcionan para poder lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Salvador comes from a family where the parents were separated.  Both his father and mother got into new relationships, and neither of them took charge of raising him.  He lives in Lima with his paternal grandparents who have known how to make up for the lack of affection that he suffered after the parting of his parents.  Due to their advanced age, his grandparents do not work.  The only income that they receive is from renting out part of their home as a commercial space.  This does not generate enough income to cover the educational expenses of young Salvador, which is why it would not be possible for him to continue to study without the support of the Kiva lenders.

Salvador's grandparents are proud of him, because he has a desire to excel even in spite of all of the difficulties that he has faced from the time he was very young.  He wants to complete his education and work for a great company so that he can repay his grandparents for everything that they have given him.  He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for all of the support they are providing so that he can achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in industrial mechatronics (the combination of mechanical engineering, computing, and electronics used in manufacturing)

loans.name: Tuleane Group

texts.en:
Esther is in her mid-sixties, married, and has children who are grown and married. She has been selling fish (fresh water fish) for ten years now. She starts doing business from 08am to evening hours, four days a week, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her ninth loan request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to replenish her business inventory. Esther keeps on increasing her business inventory every loan cycle to expand her income. She believes that if she keeps on maintaining her good repayment record, her business will continue to grow. She dreams of expanding her fish business and of improving her income. Esther used the increased income from the business to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more fish for her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" TULEANE" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products such as staple grains, sodas, juice, and more for her store.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 43-years-old and single, she works very hard to help her parents.

Concepcion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Concepcion has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Locadia  Mashura

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Locadia from Harare. She is married and has two children, both attending school. She also cares for one other dependent, her mother. 

Locadia runs a retail business selling clothing and knitted wear. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are Import duty fees which sometimes eats into her profits to an extent where she will not have any profits at all.

Locadia has requested for a loan of $1,250 USD to import clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy more goods for resale which will increase profits. 

In the future, Locadia plans to expand her shop so that she can have an adult's as well as a kid's department.
 
She is very grateful to Kiva and Microking for this partneship.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Heriberto, de 53 años, siempre camina por las calles pensando qué puede crear para que su negocio crezca y sus clientes estén contentos. Cocinas industriales, elaboración de equipos de baños, vitrinas refrigerantes, entre otros productos, él los hace y comercializa tanto en su casa, como en el mercado local del país. Desde hace 20 años empezó ensamblando mantenedoras y cocinas artesanales, pues se vio en la necesidad de crear un trabajo para sustentar a su familia. Sin embargo, él vio más allá que ensamblar y su creatividad comenzó a flotar, entonces decidió que era él quien iba a elaborar sus propios productos. 
Debido a que Heriberto no pudo llegar a la universidad, para él es importante que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar, puesto que considera que la educación es importante para superarse y poder cumplir sus metas tanto profesionales, como personales. Además de su negocio, no tiene otros ingresos, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para invertir en materiales para la fabricación de cocinas y refrigeradoras al gusto del cliente. Esto le permitirá hacer un mejor trabajo y ayudará a incrementar sus clientes. Entre sus metas está dar a conocer su producto en ferias y otros mercados con grandes innovaciones para aprovechar la mayor afluencia de personas.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 53 years old. He always walks down the street thnking about what he can create so that his business grows and his customers are satisfied. Industrial kitchens, making bathroom fixtures, refrigerated display cases, and other products are what he makes and sells in his home and in a local market. He began assembling food displays and artisan kitchens 20 years ago, but he saw the necessity to create a job that supported his family. Nevertheless, he saw beyond the assembly alone and his creative process began to emerge. He then decided that it would be him that would design and make his own products.

Since Heriberto didn't study at the university, for him it is important that his children don't stop their education. He considers education as important to improving oneself and succeeding to be able to accomplish professional and personal goals. In addition to his business, he doesn't have any other income, so he is seeking a loan to invest in materials to make custom kitchens and refrigerators. This will enable him to make a better product and help increase his customers. Among his goals are to take his products to fairs and other markets with great innovations in order to take advantage of the greater affluence of people there.

loans.use: to make kitchens and refrigerators.

loans.name: Jabulani

texts.en: Jabulani is 35 years old and married with two children who are 5 and 4 years old respectively. Only one child attends school. He has a car washing and accessories business under the Chipinge branch in the southeastern region of Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for 13 years and provides his services to the local market. He does not have any other source of income except from the car washing business. His main challenge is the inability to provide enough car accessories to customers. Jabulani requested a loan of $1,000 through MicroKing to purchase additional car washing chemicals. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him meet the demand for car accessories. In the future, he will have more customers and increased profits.

loans.use: To pay for car washing chemicals

loans.name: Nia Njema-Mbagala Group

texts.en:
Michi is a mother of two children, one daughter and one son, who are at school. She is in her mid-twenties and a single woman. For one year now, Michi has made her family living by managing a clothes shop. Her business opens from 8 AM to 9 PM per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to replenish her shop with new inventories. She is really working hard and dreams of expanding her business. Michi will share this loan with her loan group,  Nia Njema-Mbagala, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new inventories.

loans.name: Amasazaki Group

texts.en:
Salome, who is in her early thirties, is a divorcee with three daughters who are at school. She has been a tailor and also manages a shop selling clothes-making materials. Salome has been in this business for two years now and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She does business from 9 AM to 8 PM per working day.

This will be her first loan request from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy clothes-making materials and a tailoring machine for her business. She dreams of opening a school. Salome will share this loan with her loan group, Amasazaki, which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes-making materials and a tailoring machine for her business.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Scolastica is the mother of two daughters who are at school. She is a widow and is in her late thirties. For a period of four years now, Scolastica has made her family living by managing a general store selling varieties of products (dry food like rice, beans, maize and baking flour, soaps, cooking oil, etc.). She starts her business from 7 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her tenth loan which she will use to replenish her shop with new inventory. With her previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) she bought new shop products which previously weren't found in her shop. She is working hard to make sure her kids get a better life together with a good education. Scolastica used her extra income from the business to cover school fees and household expenses. She has a bank account where she keeps part of her business profits for unforeseen events. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her shop more.

Scolastica will share this loan with her loan group "Uwezesho" which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new inventory.

loans.name: Tumaini Mbagala Group

texts.en:
Husseni, who is in his late forties, is single and has three boys and two girls who are in school. He has been managing a cereals business for five years now. He starts doing business from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Husseni's first loan which he will use to replenish his business with cereal inventory. He dreams of growing his business more. Husseni will share this loan with his loan group "TUMAINI MBAGALA", which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his business with cereal inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water, sugar and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
Alice is the featured borrower of this group that hails from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. She is 40 years old and is a married woman with two children. She has a small family comprised of four members, including two children who are in school.  

With the help of her husband, she has been in the cloth-selling business for the last six years. Presently, her monthly family income is good, but it is not sufficient to lead a better life. This is her fifth loan from ID-Ghana. With this loan, she will purchase cloth in bulk to sell to customers. Her future plan is to construct a house and to provide a higher education for her children. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva's lenders for this support.

The other member of this group is involved in a different business activity; the other member is involved in health drugs (chemical shop).

loans.use: to purchase cloth in bulk to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Marwa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Marwa and it consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Hawa is a hardworking woman. She is a widowed woman with four children and lives with them in Aden. She is the leader of the group. Hawa is an educated woman, and she is very dynamic. Hawa has had her business of selling women's clothes and accessories as a door to door job for more than three years. She started her business with a small capital. Year by year her business improves more, but what she earns of profits goes to the expenses of the family. 

She has good experience in this business. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to enlarge her business, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and accessories and resell them for her customers.

Hawa looks forward to expanding her business more in order to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and accessories and resell them to her customers

loans.name: Alianza Emprendedora 3 Group

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado, vive en el municipio de Yoro junto a sus hijos y su esposa. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva maíz y frijol, esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo en forma grupal, pero su préstamo  es por 20,000 lempiras para poder comprar abonos y semilla de maíz y frijol para la siembra. el espera lograr sacar buena cosecha. Su plan es sacar el mayor provecho a la inversión para darles buena educación a sus hijos.
El grupo se llama Alianza Emprendedora 3, formado por 7 personas, que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 83,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en la asistencia al cultivo de maíz y frijol.  En la foto se identifican así a la izquierda atrás esta José Estanislao, Saúl, Efraín y José Ernesto, al frente esta José Lucindo, Enrique y Santiago a la derecha.
texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old, married, and lives in the Yoro municipality along with his children and his wife. He always has farmed corn and beans, selling his harvest in the local market. He has asked for his third loan through the group, for 20,000 lempiras in order to buy corn and bean seeds and manure. He hopes to have a good crop. His plan is to achieve a better harvest in order to invest in giving his children a good education.

The group is called Alianza Emprendedora 3 and it consists of 7 members who are farmers and live in the same community. The group loan is for 83,000 lempiras and will be invested in the assistance in growing corn and beans. In the photo, from the left, are José Estanislao, Saúl, Efraín y José Ernesto. In front are José Lucindo, Enrique y Santiago to the right.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seed to plant and manure.

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru: Акылай 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Акылай- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1988 году практически с нуля, благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, Акылай на сегодняшний день имеет: 2 дойные коровы и земельный надел 1,20 ГА, где она ежегодно выращивает перец, фасоль, клубнику для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акылай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для найма рабочих на сбор клубники, а также на покупку скота. После сбора большого урожая, денежные средства Акылай планирует вложить в скот, от реализации которого она сможет получить большую прибыль, что приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Акылай планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Akylai is 45 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children.  She has a secondary education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this business in 1988.  Thanks to her perseverance and hard work, she now owns two dairy cows and 1.2 hectare of land on which she annually grows peppers, beans and strawberries for the family's consumption and for resale.  Akylai makes a gross monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to hire farm workers to pick strawberries, and also to buy livestock.  After the harvest, Akylai plans to buy more livestock for further resale, as this will allow her to make nice profits and will, in turn, lead to an increase in the family's capital.  With the earnings from this loan, Akylai plans to perform some repairs at home.

loans.use: to hire farm workers to pick strawberries and to buy livestock.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es: Mártir, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en aldea de la Iguala Lempira. Lleva 10 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café y granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. El café lo vende despulpado y seco en la misma zona. Ha solicitado el  sexto ciclo que es por 28,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de café, con el fin de mejorar la producción. Su meta es seguir cultivando y darle un buen patrimonio a su familia en el futuro.
texts.en:
Martir is 30 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the village of La Iguala, Lempira. For the past 10 years he has had his own crops of coffee and basic grains like corn and beans. He sells the coffee pulped and dry in the same region.

He is requesting his sixth loan, which is for 28,000 lempiras, to buy compost and fertilizers for his cultivation of coffee, with the aim of improving production. His goal is to continue cultivating and give his family a good inheritance in the future.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system

loans.name: Uvas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Uvas” or “Grapes” is located in a neighborhood in the second largest city in Guatemala called Quetzaltenango. There are 11 women in the Trust Bank who are quite pleased and excited to begin another loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They have various small businesses that they are sustaining and expanding.

Berta is a 25-year-old married member of the Trust Bank. She has one son who is 16 months old. Along with her husband, Berta is very hard-working as the goal of the couple is to provide a better life for their son and future children. Recently, she began her business which involves the manufacture and sale of a variety of iced fruit popsicles that she sells three days each week from her home and also in a nearby school. Berta is very excited to be requesting her first loan from Friendship Bridge which she will use to purchase a many kinds of fruit and transform it into icy treats. Her goal is to expand her business so that her popsicles will be more in demand.

Friendship Bridge strongly believes that loans must be accompanied by non-formal educational trainings for the over 20,000 women who are clients of the organization. This is called “Microcredit Plus.” A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer meets monthly with the women of each Trust Bank and shares information on useful and relevant topics like nutrition, hygiene and health, women’s rights and self esteem as well as effective business practices and budgeting. Because most of the ladies have had little or no education, they are very excited to learn all that they can. They also realize how essential a good education is for their children.

Speaking on behalf of the 10 other women in the “Uvas” Trust Bank, Berta expresses appreciation to KIVA investors for their kindness and generosity in providing capital for their much-needed loans. Armed with their new tools, the ladies are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: To purchase a many kinds of fruit and transform it into icy treats

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 57 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamrca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodega donde ofrece variedad de productos, su local esta ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes como sacos de arroz, leche , huevos entre otros para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Javier es un cliente recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Javier is 57 years old. He lives in the district of Pucará, a community with hot weather. Its people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has a store where he offers a variety of products. His store is located in his home. He has applied for a loan of 1500 PEN for the purchase of groceries such as sacks of rice, milk, and eggs, among other items, to offer to his customers.

Javier is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sacks of rice, milk, and eggs to offer his customers.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Asha is in her mid forties and has got three children, two schooling-age and one who is grown. She is a married woman. She has been managing a mamalishe (food stall) business for four years. She does business from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly return.

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loan, which was repaid in full, Asha bought business chairs, tables and food cooking supplies. She thanks Kiva for the support because she managed to cook a new type of food which increased new customers. Her business profits rose a little and she used them to cover part of her home expenses. She dreams of building a nice business place because she got tired of renting. Asha will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients such as cooking oil, rice, beans, coconuts, vegetables and so on.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients (cooking oil, rice, beans, coconuts, vegetables and so on).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new fashionable stock for her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 37 years old, a married man with only one child. Khaled has a secondary education. His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man.  

As the main source of income for his family, Khaled has sold groceries and food products since 2013. He started this business with a small capital. Thanks to Khaled's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed Khaled to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing his business, Khaled turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER to buy more food items for future retail.

Khaled plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business more in order to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To buy more food items for future retail.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 49-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She is from Teshie and stays in a rented apartment.

She has been selling rice, gari (cassava flour) and cooking oil since 2013. Her third loan will allow her to procure rice, gari (cassava flour) and cooking oil to answer customer demand. She also wants to create a new business (she wants to open a grocery store) and guarantee a better future.

loans.use: to procure rice, gari (cassava flour) and cooking oil to answer customer demand

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maribel is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and a widow with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 32 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con esposo e hija de 15 años, en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como vestidos, faldas, uniformes escolares y otros desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con clientes considerables, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de telas, hilos para confeccionar para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 59 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in the district of Cayaltí, a community with a varied climate. Its people work in agriculture, business, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes articles of clothing such as dresses, skirts, school uniforms, and other items. She has been doing this for a number of years, and so she has a considerable clientele. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN to purchase fabrics and threads for sewing to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads for sewing to stock her business

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material rustico junto a su esposa y 01 hijo bebe en el distrito de Querocotillo una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, sus clientes son sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 36 years old. He lives in a rented house made of rustic materials along with his wife and baby son in the district of Querocotillo, a community with a varied climate. It population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He sells products of basic necessity. His customers are his neighbors and inhabitants of his district. He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN for the purchase of a variety of products and in this way to generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his store.

loans.name: Lucrecia Etelvina

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de huevos sancochados en el mercado de su distrito, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de huevos y otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 54 years old. She lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising, located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells boiled eggs in the market in her district. She has a considerable clientele. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase eggs and other products to offer her customers and in this way to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy eggs and other products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Chutzoropence Group

texts.en:
The Guatemalan Highlands are a majestic part of Guatemala, characterized by a mountain range of volcanoes on the south side and tall mountains in the north. Chichicastenango is a large and colorful town located in the Highlands and it is well-known for its large weekly market, Mayan customs and traditions. Several years ago, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chutzoropence” meaning “People from Chutzorop” was formed here. Chutzorop is a small community, near Chichicastenango, where the principle language is the Mayan dialect of “Kiche”. Spanish is not spoken by many in the village.

Tomasa is the 28-year-old President of the Trust Bank. She is married and has three children. Two of them are in school. Tomasa is honored to be President of the Trust Bank in this new loan cycle. She is pleased to practice her leadership skills. Tomasa has a textile business and creates shawls as well as the colorful and ornate traditional blouses called “huipiles” that the women wear from Chichicastenango. They are among the most beautiful in Guatemala. Tomasa is requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase a variety of good quality thread as she wants to maintain the high quality of her business and increase her clientele. She delivers her inventory weekly and sells on a retail basis two days in the local market.

The women understand the value of education and know that their children need to be in school in order to enjoy a better and more prosperous future. Participating in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge (small loans + non-formal education), the ladies learn about many useful and relevant subjects from a Loan Officer at their monthly meetings. Some of the topics discussed include violence against women and self-esteem, women’s and children’s rights as well as nutrition and health. In addition, subjects like effective business practices, customer service, budgeting and accounting are essential to insure the success of their small businesses.

Tomasa feels honored that people from other parts of the world want to invest not only in her but also in the 10 other ladies in the Trust Bank. The women have formed a strong alliance and together, they are committed to making a real difference in the lives of their families and their community.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of good quality thread for making shawls.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rosalia has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Edna requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Edna has been in this business for one year now. With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lejanie

texts.en:
Lejanie is 35 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Lejanie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, canned goods,and eggs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43-years-old and married with three children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.
 
She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella is 28-years-old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Ma. Bella works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Bella runs a retail business of beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Bella has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Ma. Bella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is 36-years-old and married with four children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Hermelina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice farming and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mariliza

texts.en:
Mariliza is 42-years-old and married with two children who are in school.  Mariliza works very hard to provide for them.

Mariliza's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mariliza is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Mariliza is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fiel

texts.en:
Fiel is 40 years old and married with six children, who are in school, Fiel works very hard to provide for them.

Fiel's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Fiel is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Fiel is committed to rebuild and, in the future, she would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her family. Irene has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Irene has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a business, direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines, and she requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Edna would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Geovany

texts.es: Geovany es de la comunidad punta ñata , estudio hasta 5to grado de primaria, ya que después se presentaron unas dificultades familiares que no le permitieron continuar así que se quedo ayudar a su madre en las actividades del hogar ademas que sus padres la educaron para que fuera una mujer luchadora y honrada esos valores que le enseñaron le han servido mucho en la vida hoy en dia es madre de cuatro hijos  que son para ella dice su motor  de vida que le permite luchar dia con dia  para sacarlos adelante , su esposo y ella se dedican a cultivar unas manzanas de tierra que tienen de ahi persiven ingresos para los gastos de la casa.como en en su vivienda no tienen luz electrica ella quiere sacar un prestamo para comprar un sistema solar así sus hijos ya no estarán a oscuras por las noches y como familia podrán realizar otras actividades
texts.en:
Geovany is from the Punta Ñata community. She studied through fifth grade in primary school, since following this she was presented with family difficulties that did not allow her to continue, so instead she stayed home to help her mother with chores around the house. Her parents taught her to be a fighter and an honest woman. The values that they taught her have been very helpful to her throughout life. 

Today, she is the mother of four children who she says are, for her, a "life engine" that allows her to fight day-to-day to get them ahead. She and her husband make a living cultivating acres of land that they have. From this land, they earn an income to cover the home expenses. 

Because they do not have electricity in their home, she wants to take out a loan in order to buy a solar system so that her children will no longer be in the dark at night, and they can do other activities as a family.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for her home

loans.name: Roley

texts.es:
Roley vive en un cuarto alquilado en el distrito de Los Olivos, cerca a su centro de estudios hasta donde llega caminando. El tiene que ahorrar lo mas que pueda ya que vive solo y depende de el mismo al no contar con apoyo de ningún familiar para su manutención y pago de estudios, los mismos que esta a punto de concluir este año.
Actualmente labora a tiempo parcial haciendo practicas en un taller automotriz, pero la remuneración es baja y no es suficiente para pagar su educación, motivo por el que tendría que abandonar sus estudios temporalmente para trabajar a tiempo completo y reunir lo suficiente para poder culminarlos de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
