El cree que la educación es fundamental para el desarrollo del país y agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por confiar en el y en general en todos lo jóvenes que se ven beneficiados con esta gran ayuda.
Roley desea culminar sus estudios con éxito este año y poder validarlos y especializarse en una universidad para en un futuro próximo abrir su propio taller, donde dará trabajo a jóvenes que como el requieran de apoyo para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Roley lives in a rented room in the Los Olivos district, which is close to the educational center where he walks to his classes.  He has to save as much as he can because he lives alone and supports himself.  He gets no support from his family for his living or educational expenses.  He is about to finish his education this year.

At this time, he is working part time as an apprentice in an automotive repair shop.  However, the pay is low and is not enough to cover his educational expenses.  This is why he would have to leave his studies for a while to work full time to generate the money to pay to finish his education if it weren't for the support of the Kiva lenders.

Roley believes that education is fundamental to the development of the country, and he thanks the Kiva lenders for trusting in him and in all of the young people who are benefiting from this great help.  Roley wants to finish his education successfully this year and get his specialized degree validated so that in the future he can have his own workshop where he can provide employment to youths like him who need support to achieve their goals

loans.use: to fund his education in auto mechanics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale

loans.name: Nawaf Al- Salah Group

texts.en:
Nawaf Al- Salah is a group that consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Aman is the leader of the group. She is a 41-year-old married woman, living with her family in their own house. Their house is very old and it needs renovation. Aman is the leader of the group. She works as a dressmaker inside her house. The income from this business is very small and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. Unfortunately, the house where she lives is very old and it needs renovation. For this reason, Aman applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials, such as as cements and bricks, to renovate the house.

Aman hopes to build the second floor and rent the first one. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as s cements and bricks, in order to renovate the house

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Nora de 48 años de edad, es una persona dedicada a su trabajo, lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, habita en la Ciudad del Rama, tiene tres hijos la mayor le ayuda en el Negocio y en los quehaceres del hogar y los dos menores estudian, ella junto a su esposo ha levantado su Negocio de venta de Productos de Pulperia, pero con la ganancia no logran comprar lo que tiene previsto para incrementar su Negocio como es invertir en Gaseosas, Granos Básicos, Azúcar, Aceite, Jabón, y otros productos de aseo personal que ofrece.  su mayor deseo es surtir su negocio y convertirlo en Miselanea ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Doña Nora is 48 years old. She is a person who is dedicated to her work, and she fights to provide for her family. She lives in the city of Rama, and she has three children. The eldest helps her in the business and with the household duties; and the two youngest are studying. 

She and her husband have built up their grocery store business. However, with the earnings, they are not able to make the expenditures that they have planned in order to enlarge their business, such as investing in soft drinks, basic grains, sugar, oil, soap, and other personal care products to offer. 

Her greatest desire is to stock her business and convert it into a general store, offering a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma has been growing and harvesting vegetables and bananas to sell in town and had this business for more than three years. This is the primary source of income for the family. With her generated income, she was able to sustain their living as well as improving her farm. 

Vilma took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. Vilma is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her two children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is from the village of Larayan, Dapitan City, Zamboanga Del Norte. 50-year-old Anabelle is married and has five children. She has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. She also raises pigs to sell and earn additional income. This year, Anabelle joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services. It helps to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She wants to have a better life in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frutales y arroz, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 40 years old. He lives in the Pomahuaca district, a community with a warm climate. Its population works in agriculture, especially the cultivation of fruit and rice. Sales and cattle take place in the Jaén province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru. 

He offers public transportation services in his own moto taxi, transporting his passengers to areas surrounding his district. He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles in order to buy parts for his vehicle, and in this way continue offering better services.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Pierre Manuel

texts.es:
Pierre Manuel tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Nanchon, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la ganadería, comercio y agricultura, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para el arreglo de una pared de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para residir.
texts.en:
Pierre Manuel is 23 years old. He lives in the district of Nanchon, a community with a varied climate. Its people work in livestock raising, commerce, and agriculture, and it is located in the province of San Miguel, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has been raising and selling barnyard animals for three years. He has applied for a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase construction materials for the repair of a wall in his house and in this way to have a pleasant place to live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the repair of a wall of his home.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricel is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, etc.

Maricel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Maricel has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Maricel is committed to rebuild, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods and soap

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 41 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Lea works very hard to provide for them.

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lea has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 60-years-old and widowed with seven children. Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Celsa has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 60, is resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children. To help with her family’s hardship she does rice farming as the main source of income. 

With VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, she is a representative of a group consisting of three borrowers. She had successful repayment of her past loan. Now, her living condition is getting better. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her paddy rice. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her paddy rice.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

She has been in this business for one year. Remedios earns more income from food vending.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 46 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 37 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

Ma. Cecilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenevive

texts.en: Jenevive, a mother of an only child, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For four years, the couple has earned enough to provide for the family. Her husband also earns a salary as a cook in a restaurant. She planned to improve their farm in order to send her child to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Tarcisia

texts.en: Tarcisia is 57 years old and lives in Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with five children. Tarcisia used her loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Her business has grown and become successful. She manages her farm while her husband works as a marine engineer. Positively, she hopes to be able to continue to grow and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hor's Group

texts.en: Hor is 58 and a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of eight children. To tackle her family’s hardships, rice cropping is their single source of income. The 20-year-involvement in this business generates her about 41,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Hor with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. She strongly hopes that she can gain a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en:
The Sawe Mutiara Indah group successfully repays all of their loan on time and all the members attend meetings and make their payment one by one to the Field Officer of MUK. The payments are coordinated by the head of the group accompanied by the group Secretary and Treasurer. At the meeting they share their experiences with maintaining the pigs. Most of them successfully breed the pigs, and they can sell them with a satisfactory price when the pigs reach ideal weight.

Ayu Ketut had sold her pigs and she earned enough profit to support her daily life and also improve capital for her kiosk business. Now Ayu Ketut and her husband can buy a used car (purchase in installments) to sell crops and other instant food around her village and other places. She’s very happy and her entire family feels the benefits. Now she can save to prepare for her children's education needs. She hopes all of her plans for her children's future come true.

When Ayu Ketut and the Sawe Mutiara Indah group receive their loan, Ayu Ketut will use her loan to purchase 3 superior piglets for fattening. With good treatment, she hopes the piglets grow healthy, reach an ideal weight, and then she can sell them with a high price.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en: Fredelyn has run a general store for three years to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, and she had better return from it. She joined GDMPC and she gained access to micro finance services. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more rice to resell in additional to her grocery goods. In the near future, she wants to have a better living and be able to send her children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos con la venta de sus animales.
texts.en:
Orlando is 27 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti, a community that specializes in agriculture, commerce, and livestock located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living selling pigs in the back of his home. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy balanced foods for the fattening of his pigs and in this way generate more revenue from the sale of his animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced foods for the fattening of pigs.

loans.name: Chhom's Group

texts.en: Chhom, 43, is a married mother blessed with five children, three of whom are in school. Her entire family solely relies on rice cropping with which she has been occupied for 20 years, earning about 33,000 KHR. This is the sixth loan for Chhom and second loan for her joint borrower. She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has helped her to upgrade her lifestyle. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain better income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Poy's Group

texts.en: Poy, 64, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has three children. The three hectares of rice cropping is a single of source of income for her. She has been involved in her current business for ages and she can generate about 33,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Poy with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle gradually. Now, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Sreyon Group

texts.en: Sreyon is 24 years old. She is a married woman with one child in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Sreyon is a leader of this borrower group. Sreyon will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground part of a latrine. This loan helps her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her farm, build a house and provide her child with a higher education.

loans.use: To buy the ground part of a latrine

loans.name: Estelvinai Irene

texts.es: Doña Estelvina, es una señora muy trabajadora, que a diario sale a las calles a vender ropa, útiles escolares, calzados y cosméticos, los cuales también comercializa en su casa de habitación, ella tiene bajo su cargo a un hijo al que le brinda un cuidado especial, Estelvina solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio para poder ofrecer variedades a sus clientes de esta manera garantizar sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
Doña Estelvina, is a hardworking lady, who daily goes to the streets to sell clothes, school supplies, shoes and cosmetics.  She also sells these items in her house.

She has a son for whom she is responsible and for whom she gives special care.

Estelvina is requesting a loan to invest in her business in order to offer to her customers a variety of goods thus ensuring her daily income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, cosmetics, shoes and school supplies.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is studying in a university taking a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering degree.

He is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in his career. He joined GDMPC and he gained access to its micro finance services, specifically the education loan product.

He is requesting this loan to pay his school tuition fees. His goal is to finish his course and to have a better life and career in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky works in the local river digging sand and gravel to use for house construction. He also buys more of these materials to add to what he gathers. He has been doing this for five years to support his family. Aside from this, he also manages his own farm, which is their main source of income. With his income, he was able to successfully repay his previous loan, which he used to buy additional sand and gravel to resell. Recently, Ricky took a new loan to buy fertilizer and pay farm maintenance costs. He wants to improve his business and earn more income to meet future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay farm maintenance costs.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 33 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Adelia has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Adelia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Sólo triunfa en el mundo quien se levanta y busca oportunidades y la crea si no las encuentra, tal es el caso de Marvin, quien hace dos años acepto el reto de manejar una pulpería, la cual pertenecía a su mamá, pero por problemas de salud no pudo continuar en la producción y atención. El tiene 40 años de edad, está soltero y no tiene hijos. Poco a poco, invirtió un pequeño capital para aumentar los productos y ganar más clientela. Agradece a su madre por la oportunidad, espera poder brindarle seguridad y estabilidad económica.
Marvin solicita el crédito para incrementar los productos en su pulpería, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz, frijoles; productos lácteos, leche, queso; al mismo tiempo productos escolares, entre otros. Su objetivo principal es brindar una atención de calidad, de manera que aumenten sus ingresos, razón por la deposita su confianza en el financiamiento. Emprendedor y carismático, dos cualidades que lo caracterizan, uno de sus planes futuros es hacer crecer el negocio, introducirse en el mercado y ser reconocido.
texts.en:
Only triumph in the world which raised you, look for opportunities and create them when you can’t find them. This is the case for Marvin, who accepted the role of managing a grocery store two years ago. It belonged to his mother, who was not able to continue looking after the store due to her health problems. He is 40 years old, single, and childless. He gradually invested small amounts of capital to increase the number of products in the store and gain more customers. He is grateful to his mother for the opportunity, and he hopes to be able to give her economic stability and security.

Marvin is requesting the loan in order to increase the number of products in his grocery store. He needs to buy staple grains, such as rice and beans; dairy products, such as milk and cheese; school supplies; and other products. His main goal is to offer a quality service in order to improve his earnings, which is why he is putting his trust in the loan. As an enterprising and charismatic man, one of his future plans is to make the business grow, enter the market, and be recognised.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, such as rice and beans; dairy products, such as milk and cheese; school supplies; and other products

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es:
El bienestar de los animales siempre ha sido lo primordial para Rolando, quien desde pequeño sentía mucho amor por estas criaturas indefensas, para poder atenderlos correctamente decidió estudiar veterinaria. Tiene  la edad de 27 años, está soltero y cursa cuarto año de su carrera en la UCN. Es un joven emprendedor y disciplinado, quiere estar al día con las nuevas tecnologías, asegura que son una herramienta importante en el progreso de cada persona. Agradece a su familia el apoyo recibido en el cumplimiento de sus sueños.
Él solicita el crédito para la compra de un equipo tecnológico, una computadora portátil, medio que le permitirá trabajar y acceder a internet desde cualquier lugar, quiere ser partícipe del avance tecnológico, enviar correos de clases a tiempo, para ser uno de los mejores en su carrera. El deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que ofrece Kiva y MiCrédito, puesto que le ayudara a estar al tanto de los avances en la veterinaria, carrera que es su pasión. Sus planes futuros, es lograr establecer una veterinaria, por lo que seguirá esforzándose.
texts.en:
Animal welfare has always been a top priority for Rolando, who has felt a lot of love for these defenceless creatures since he was little. In order to look after them correctly, he decided to study veterinary science. He is 27 years old, single, and in the fourth year of his degree at UCN. He is an enterprising and disciplined young man who wants to be up to date with the latest technologies, as he is sure that they are an important tool for the progress of every person. He is grateful to his family for their support in helping him fulfil his dreams.

He is requesting the loan in order to buy a piece of technological equipment (a laptop), which will enable him to work and access the Internet from any location. He wants to be part of the advances in technology and send class emails on time in order to be one of the best in his degree. He puts his trust in the loan Kiva and MiCrédito are offering, since it will help him to keep up to date with advances in veterinary science, which is his passion. His future plans are to establish a veterinary clinic, which is why he will continue to do his utmost.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Saroeum's Group

texts.en: Saroeum is 46 years old and a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a rice farmer who has only this business as the main source of income. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in her seventh loan cycle and her co-borrower is in her first loan cycle. She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle progressively. She is applying for 1,400,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for her crop. She strongly hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es: Aura Rosa de 26 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora, tiene un hijo menor de edad cursa la primaria en una escuela publica, ella junto a su Esposo han luchado por darle lo mejor a su hijo y mejorar su vivienda, labora como cajera para una empresa privada, y en tiempos libres atiende el negocio de Pulperia que esta a cargo del Esposo, con sus ingresos no logran resolver los gastos de la inversión a realizar, ella necesita comprar Ceramica, Bondex, Separadores y pagar mano de obra para arreglar su Vivienda y gozar de mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Aura Rosa is 26 years old and is a hard worker. She has a dependent child who attends a public elementary school. She and her husband have struggled to provide the best for their child and improve their housing.

She works as a cashier for a private company, and works in her free time in a snack business that is the responsibility of her husband.

The revenues have not yet fulfilled the investment to be made.  She needs to buy ceramics, bondex, and separators and pay labor to fix her housing and enjoy better conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy ceramics, bondex and separators.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her ready-to-wear business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting her everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of jackets, blouses, shirts, and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josephine hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of jackets, blouses, shirts, and other products

loans.name: Flavio Alfaro  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Flavio Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este Grupo De Crédito está integrado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres, este es un grupo personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este grupo el cual les ha servido de mucho para salir adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la artesanía, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Janeth, tiene 41 años, es soltera y vive con la mama. 
Doña Janeth con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y con estos salir adelante hace 7 años atrás instalo en su casa un pequeño negocio, ella se dedica a preparar chifles ya sean de plátano o de maduro, en todo este tiempo ya tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos, vende en su casa por fundas o tachos aunque sus mejores ventas son a domicilio ya que ella entrega en diferentes negocios, en cevicherías y tiendas de la localidad.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátanos, manteca, sal y  fundas para preparar los chifles. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más industrializado y salir adelante
texts.en:
The credit group Flavio Alfaro gets together every 15 days in Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for artisanal crafts that are recognized at the national and international levels and for the famous straw hats.

This credit group is composed of 11 women and 2 men - it is a group of very humble and hard-working people that, upon learning of the benefits brought upon by the institution, decided to unite some time ago and form this group, which has served them very much to get ahead. They each have diverse jobs such as artisanal crafts, general commerce, and others.

One of the partners in this group is 41-year-old Janeth, who is single and lives with her mother.

Doña Janeth, with the ultimate goal of earning her own income and get ahead, installed a business in her home 7 years ago. She makes plantain chips either from green or ripe plantain. In this time she has already gained many customers that ask for her products. She sells in her home by the bag or in containers although her best sales are deliveries where she delivers to different businesses, to seafood restaurants and local shops. She works every day from 6 am to 2 pm and sometimes even later when she has orders to fulfill.

She will use this new loan to buy plantains, lard, salt, and bags to prepare the plantain chips. She has been part of the credit group since its inception and she likes it because of the help they receive with loans. Her dreams are to have a more industrialized business and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy bananas, lard, salt, and bags

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dressmaking business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 39 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, and zippers for her business

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, siempre sea dedicado a la agricultura, él es un hombre trabajador  que se ha dedicado siempre a su mismo trabajo,  solamente estudio segundo grado ya que sus padres no contaban con los recursos necesarios. 
Actualmente está acompañado  es padre de cinco hijos de los cuales cuida y atiende su esposa todos viven y solamente dos estudian;  porque los demás no tiene la edad para estudiar aun, toda su familia depende económicamente de él, sus ingresos dependen del trabajo de la agricultura y de la albañilería , él trabaja todos los días fuertemente para que a su familia no le falte nada,  él sale de sus casa a las seis y media de la mañana  y regresa hasta las tres de la tarde todo esto que ahora le ayuda a mantener a su familia lo aprendió de su padre ya que él se dedica a estas actividades. 
El crédito lo necesita para reparar unas paredes de su casa y que son de tierra y debido al tiempo y las lluvias se encuentran deterioradas, también para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que siempre hace la milpa de la época. Él desea que su familia tenga un hogar digno y poder ayudarles a sus hijos para que estudien y sigan adelante y que tengan un mejor futuro para ellos y su familia
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and has always been in agriculture. He is a hard-working man and has always had the same job. He has a second-grade education because his parents did not have the necessary resources.

Currently, he is in a relationship, is the father of five children that he takes care of and attends to his wife. They all live and only two are in school because the rest are not old enough yet. All of his family depends on him economically. His income depends on his agriculture work and the carpentry. He works hard every day so that his family is in need of nothing. He leaves his home at 6:30 am and returns at 3 pm. All of this that now helps his family, he learned from his father because he also works in the same business.

He needs the loan to repair some walls in his home because they are made of earth and due to time and rain they are now deteriorated and also for the purchase of agriculture materials since he always makes the crop depending on the season. He wishes for his family to have a dignified home and to be able to help his children get an education and get ahead so that they may have a better future for themselves and their family.

loans.use: to repair some walls in his home made of earth that have deteriorated due to time and rain and to buy agriculture materials because he always makes seasonal crops

loans.name: Samy's Group

texts.en: Samy is 44 years old and a resident of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children, only one of whom is in school. For her family, rice cropping is the only source of income. This business has generated about 29,000 KHR per day for her. This is the seventh loan for Samy and the fifth loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and now her living condition is improving at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR. Her joint borrower in her group of two is taking the same loan amount. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain a high income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the construction of a room.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

Edita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles and shampoo

loans.name: Ram's Group

texts.en: Ram is 47 years old and a mother of three kids. Currently, she needs to support only one kid who is in school. Her main sources of income are from three hectares of rice farming and her paid working job. She has been involved in her current businesses for ages. This is the third loan for Ram with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay plowing fees. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield that is better than last years yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Everlida

texts.en:
Everlida is a 44-year-old woman with one child, working very hard to provide her and her child.

For 5 years, Everlida has operated a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like can goods, biscuits, and chips.

In the future Everlida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy can goods, biscuits, and chips to sell.

loans.name: Ngon's Group

texts.en:
Ngon, 57, is a villager from the Battambang province, in Cambodia. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is too young for schooling.  She is also a farmer who manages two hectares of rice that she has occupied for ages and has returned her about 38,000 KHR.  

This is the third microloan for Ngon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has paid back her past loan completely that enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace.  Ngon is leading a group of two to obtain a new loan.  She and her joint borrower are requesting loan for 1,000,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and plowing fees.  

She hopes to obtain a better yield than before and to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and plowing fees.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 48 years old and works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Adela works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials. Adela is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell in her business selling used clothing.

Adela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kimhoeurn's Group

texts.en: A mother of nine children and a resident of Bovel district of Battambang province, Kimhoeurn is a local farmer who supports her family via rice farming and paid work. She has been involved in her current business for several years. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Kimhoeurn has formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs as well as plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain an income that is good and better than before.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs as well as plowing fees.

loans.name: Agrefina

texts.en:
Agrefina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Agrefina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Agrefina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more food and other items to sell.

Agrefina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more food and other items to sell

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Angela Maritza, originaria de Nueva Guinea, lucha cada vez mas para brindar lo mejor a su humilde familia trabaja como afanadora en una Institución Estatal, con sacrificio ha venido mejorando su vivienda, pero aun le queda por mejorar, si bien es cierto que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en una Institución del Estado pues no logran ajustar para su plan de Inversion,  esta vez tiene el propósito de realizar un Porche y necesita comprar materiales de Construcción como, Piedrin, Cemento. Arenilla Madera entre otros.
texts.en:
Angela Maritza, comes from New Guinea.  She struggles every day to provide the best she can for her humble family.  She works as a cleaner in a state institution.  With a lot of sacrifice she has been improving her home, but she still has a lot to do.  

While it is true that she has the support of her husband, who works as a security guard in a state institution, they don't earn enough for their investment plan.  

At the moment, they intend to build a porch and they need to buy construction materials such as gravel, cement, sand and wood, among other things.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, grit, wood and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sugar, frijoles, soap and other products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen vive con su hermana, trabaja como auxiliar contable hace más 5 años, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y  comenta que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por poder terminar su carrera y poder trabajar en su profesión.
Comenta que sueña con poder tener su propio estudio contable donde poder trabajar y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ideales de poder crecer y ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Karen lives with her sister.  She has been working as an accounting assistant for over 5 years.  She is studying an accounting degree.  She tells us that she is making a tremendous effort to finish this degree and work in this profession.

She says that she dreams of having her own accounting business where she can work and make a living for herself.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her course and in this way continue with her plan to grow and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cell phones for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her tortilla making business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es soltera, vive con su hermana en la ciudad de San Ignacio. Comenta que su hermana la ayuda en poder terminar su carrera, y la está apoyando en todo.
Al terminar su carrera quiere ser una profesional exitosa que pueda servir a las demás personas y a la sociedad. Le gustaría también el día de mañana tener su casa propia donde poder tener su propia familia.
Ella está siguiendo la carrera de radiología y pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mary is single and lives with her sister in the town of San Ignacio. She tells us that her sister helps her to finish her degree and is offering her total support.

At the end of her studies she wants to be a successful professional who can serve other people and society. In the future she would also like to have her own home where she can have her own family.

She is studying on a radiology course and is asking for this loan to be able to meet the payments on her course and as a result, be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Sareun's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sareun is 40 years old and married. She has four children, but only one kid remains under her dependency. To provide decent food for her entire family, rice farming and fishing are the main sources of income. During her spare time, she can earn extra income via her paid-working job. She has been involved in the current business for 20 years, earning about 32,000 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for Sareun and her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) requesting the same loan amount of 800,000 KHR. She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to provide sufficient meals for her children. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop, and to buy fishing materials. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to run her paddy rice crop business as well as her fishing business smoothly.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Consolascion

texts.en:
Consolascion is 58 years old and married with eight children.

Consolascion is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Consolascion has been doing pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Consolascion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es:
Osmar es un joven que estudia y trabaja para poder cubrir sus gastos de estudio y también busca la forma de poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que debe viajar 40 kilómetros para poder ir a la universidad, lo que hace que sea mucho más sacrificado.
Comenta que su meta es poder terminar su carrera  y ser un buen profesional, trabajar y seguir especializándose en otras materias.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, ya que eso es lo que más necesita, y lo que le es mas costoso.
texts.en:
Osmar is a young man who studies and works to cover his education costs.  He also looks for ways to help his family.  He says he must travel 40 kilometers to go to the university, which makes it much harder.

He wants to get his degree and become a professional, to work and continue his specialization.  The loan he is requesting is to cover transportation costs because it is what he needs and costs the most.

loans.use: To pay for transportation.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene un negocio de alquiler de películas, y a la vez que trabaja también estudia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y es muy responsable.
Evelyn es muy dedicada en sus estudios y comenta que su familia es su mayor sostén que siempre la apoyan en sus sueños.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas y comenta que su sueño es ser una profesional exitosa y útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar el gasto de su tesis, ya que es muy costosa.
texts.en:
Evelyn has a movie rental business and also studies.  She is very responsible and determined to get ahead.

Eveyln is very dedicated to her education and says her family is her greatest support and always there for her.  The loan she is requesting is to pay for her thesis which is very expensive.

loans.use: To pay for her thesis.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, comenta que le gustaría ser una  profesional exitosa y trabajar en su propio estudio contable, ser independiente y poder ayudar a sus padres.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, que le abrirá muchas puertas en el mundo laboral y le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y así seguir estudiando. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of San Ignacio and wants to become a successful professional, working in her own accounting business, while being independent and helping her parents.

She is studying accounting which will open many doors for her in the labor market.

The loan she is requesting is to pay the university fees and to continue studying.  She is grateful for this opportunity so she can finish her education and strive toward her goals.

loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Luot's Group

texts.en: Luot, 49, is a villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is the widowed mother of four children. As the breadwinner of the family, she grows rice and catches fish to sell to earn a decent income to cover the basic needs in her household. She also uses her spare time to work for others for a fee. These multi businesses generate about 29,000 KHR per day after her 20 years involvement. Now, she is leading a second-cycle loan group consisting of three borrowers including her to get a new loan. Her successful repayment of her first loan has helped her to provide decent food for her family and improve her livelihood at a gradual pace.  For this cycle, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and fishing material to support her businesses. She hopes to earn more income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and fishing material

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 50 years, and she also earns more income from a general store.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy está trabajando en un Hospital de Pilar hace más de 10 años, comenta que tiene un hijo y que vive con su mama que es viuda. Ella está estudiando para progresar profesionalmente y poder desempeñarse en cualquier cargo o desafío que el día de mañana se le presente. 
Después de culminar sus estudios sueña con la casa propia, montar un negocio para poder tener otros ingresos y seguir capacitándose profesionalmente. Está estudiando la carrera de Maestría en salud pública, que sabe que le abrirá muchas puertas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación de la carrera, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto significativo que tiene, y también agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Nancy has worked at the hospital in Pilar for over ten years.  She has a son and lives with her mother who is a widow.  She is studying to grow professionally and be able to work in any job and meet any challenge she may face in the future.

After finishing her education she wants to have her own home and set up a business to earn extra income and continue her professional training.

She is studying toward a masters in public health which she knows will open many doors for her.  The loan she is requesting is to pay for graduation fees which are quite high.  She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Pretzel

texts.en:
Pretzel is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. 

She is studying at a university in order to fulfill her dreams, but needs financial assistance to pay her tuition fees. With her GDMPC education loan, she will be able to continue her studies and hopefully in the future she will find a good job which suits her.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Bebsylen

texts.en:
Bebsylen is 40 years old and married with four children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, beer, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Bebsylen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, beer, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a farmer, and she grows rice as her primary source of income. She lives in Phav village in Batheay district, Kampong Cham province. Mao is now 63 years old, a widow and a loving mother of five children. Another part of her income is earned by some of her children, who are employed in various careers.

As a client of Hatta Kaksekar, Mao is taking out a loan of USD 700 to buy a motorcycle for the family's transportation needs. In this way, she will be able to help her family members to avoid paying for a daily taxi service, and thus be able to save a little for future emergencies.

She is very thankful to all kind lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for their transportation needs.

loans.name: Cliare

texts.en:
Cliare is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Cliare would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tires and other spare parts to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other spare parts to sell

loans.name: Bonheur Ii Group

texts.fr: BONHEUR II est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même village et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Alice. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Alice est âgée 54 ans et est mariée à un certain André. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et dont cinq à  leur  charge. Alice vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Alice n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Alice vend de la farine de manioc, du riz et des poissons dans un marché du Bénin depuis près de vingt ans. Alice s’approvisionne au Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à  Alice et à son groupement BONHEUR II, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Bonheur II Group is made up of fifteen members who all live in the same village.  The president of the group is Alice (seen with her hand raised in the photo).  She is 54 years old, has never attended school and is married to André.  They have six children who all attend school, and they are responsible for five of the children.  Alice and André live with their children and, between them, they provide for the needs of their household.  To help to do this, Alice has been selling cassava flour, rice and fish at a market in Benin for nearly twenty years.  She buys her supplies in Benin.

All the members of the group would like to increase their working capital and improve their businesses so they work with the field partner, Alidé.  This will be their second loan.  Alice and the other group members will use their loans to grow their businesses, attract more customers and increase their profits.  The group's first loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cassava, rice and fish for resale.

loans.name: Bonheur I Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BONHEUR I est composé de vingt-et-un personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Cathérine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Cathérine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Cathérine est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Grégoire. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés dont quatre sont à leur charge. Cathérine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assurées par le couple. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Cathérine vend depuis dix huit ans, des poissons frits et des vivres dans un marché du Bénin. Cathérine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Cathérine et les autres membres du groupement BONHEUR I sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Bonheur I Group is made up of 21 members who all live in the same village.  Cathérine (seen with her hand raised in the photo) is the group representative.  She is 38 years old, has never attended school and is married to Grégoire who is a farmer.  Together they have six children who all attend school and they are responsible for four of the children.  Cathérine and Grégoire live with their children and, between them, they provide for all the expenses of their household.  In order to do this, Cathérine has been selling fried fish and other food at a market in Benin for eighteen years.  She buys her supplies in Benin.

All the members of the group would like to respond better to their customers by improving their businesses, so they work with the field partner, Alidé.  This will be their second group loan.  Their ambition is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetable oil for use in her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal and vegetable oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of yams for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, gari (cassava flour) and beans for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with three children. 

She is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha is a 34-year-old mother of three little kids residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province. Her family survives through her pig-raising business and a paid working job during her spare time. This is the business that she has had for eight years. Sokha has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two loans with successful repayment. She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and her joint borrowers are applying for 700,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets to raise, to renovate pigpen, and to buy pig feed. She strongly hopes that she can gain a better yield so that she can send all of her kids to school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed and to renovate her pigpen

loans.name: Hoern

texts.en:
Hoern, 60, is married and living with her family in a village in the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For the last 10 years, Hoern and her husband have been farming as the main source of the family’s income. 
 
Hoern is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 39 years old and a villager from Battambang province. She is a mother of three children who are in school. Her main sources of income are from rice cropping, her grocery-selling business, and her husband's occupation as a carpenter. She has been involved in her current businesses for several years and they have earned her a decent income to support her. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Mom and her two fellow group member are not first time borrowers. She has repaid her nine loans completely and they have enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace and keep her kids in school. Now, she and her joint borrowers are seeking the same loan amount of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees. She strongly hopes that she can gain a good yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elna works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Elna is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her dried coconut meat business.

Elna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 48 years old and has only one child. Despite being widowed, she has the determination to become successful in the future. As one way of generating income, she has a business buying and reselling curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets and blankets within her community. She wants to improve her business and make it more profitable in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets and blankets to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Elsie has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella está estudiando la carrera de Radiología, y comenta que sus  metas, son la de tener un título universitario, ser una buena profesional y ayudar a su familia.
Ella está en el último año de su carrera, y dice que sus estudios son para poder progresar y salir  adelante  aspirando a ser una buena profesional. Quiere ser una persona  útil  para la  sociedad y para su mi familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y también poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder acceder al préstamo para poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Ruth is from the city of Villarrica. She is studying Radiology, and says that her goals are to have a university degree, to be good at her job and help her family. 

She is in the last year of her degree, and says her studies enable her to progress and succeed with her aspiration of being a good professional. She wishes to be a useful person to society and to her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her fees, and also to cover her transport costs. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving in accessing the loan to enable her to study.

loans.use: to pay university fees and transport costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, corn and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products, spices and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing, corn and yam chips.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio está estudiando licenciatura  en criminalista, y comenta que su objetivo es tener un titulo  que  le  ayudara en su profesión y para mejorar cada día más  en el desempeño de la investigación de la policia.
Es el una persona que está luchando por salir adelante, progresar e ir ayudando a su familia en lo que puede de acuerdo a sus posibilidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y también cubrir sus gastos de transporte, ya que es muy costoso todo eso y quiere poder cubrirlo.
texts.en:
Dionicio is studying criminal science. He says that his goal is to have a degree that will help him in his profession and to improve more every day while working at police investigations. 

He is a person who is fighting to get ahead, progress and help his family as much as he can within his possibilities. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay for college tuition and also cover his transportation costs.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition and transportation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and millet.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria está cursando la carrera de derecho, está en su último año de la carrera y comenta que su familia es quien la ayuda a poder estudiar y seguir sus metas.
Comenta que quiere terminar sus estudios para poder ejercer su carrera y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma estar más cerca de cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
Gloria is studying law. She is in her last year of her major and she says that her family helps her study and achieve her goals. 

She says that she wants to finish her studies and be able to practice her profession and help her family and her loved ones. She is asking for this loan to be able to make college tuition payments and in this way come closer to her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to make tuition payments.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun owns and operates a general store, and sells a variety of products in a local market to earn a living. She usually gets up early to prepare her store and closes it at 4 p.m. From her current business, she is able to make a net profit of USD 5 per day, which she uses for daily food.
 
Moeun wants to improve her house, but she has insufficient capital to cover the overall costs of the construction. That’s why she is seeking a loan in the amount of USD 1,000 to have her house built. This will bring them comfortable living conditions and improve their quality of life. Big thanks to Kiva lenders who donate their funds to enable poor families to overcome the hardships in their lives.

loans.use: to cover the overall costs of the construction.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is fifty years old and married with seven children, of which six are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gloria has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and equipment for her tailoring business.

Gloria has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for her tailoring business

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is fifty-five years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Fedila works very hard to provide for them.

Fedila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo and noodles to sell.

Fedila has been in this business for thirteen years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo and noodles. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo and noodles to sell

loans.name: Mirla

texts.en:
Mirla is forty-eight years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Mirla has fully repaid one loan from NWTF previously. She has been running this business for one year and earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. 

Geraldine is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Geraldine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Geraldine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sron's Group

texts.en: A resident from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sron is sixty-eight years old and a married mother of three children. To support her family, she runs a small grocery stall as a main source of income and supplements this by working for others for a fee. She has been occupied in her current business for forty-five years and earns about 47,000 KHR per day. Srorn is a new borrower to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is the leader of a first-time borrower group consisting of two borrowers (including herself) requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, or 1,000,000 KHR each. Sron will spend her portion of the loan on buying grocery items for resale. In future, she hopes to triple her income.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement and iron, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley, 50, is a villager from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She struggles with her family’s hardship via one hectare of rice cropping and another one hectare of cassava farming. She can earn up to 31,700 KHR per day from the current business, which she has had for ages. 

This is the fourth-cycle loan for Ley and the second loan for her joint borrower. Now, her living condition is better than before. For this cycle, she joins a group of two to get a new loan and she is the leader. Her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower's loan amount is 1,100,000 KHR.

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay the cassava plowing fee and to buy fertilizer. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield  than before.

loans.use: To pay for cassava plowing fee and fertilizer purchasing.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Fe has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Freddy De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Freddy de La Cruz, habita en Juigalpa, Ayudante de albañil en la Municipalidad, su esposa es ama de casa han procreado dos hijos los cuales estudian el mayor  la secundaria y el menor la primaria, él es el unico sustento en la Familia y ha luchado para hacer cada dia su vivienda con mejores condiciones y gracias a Kiva ha ido logrando su objetivo pero aun le falta por concluir, una de las mejoras a continuacion es ponerle ceramica a su vivienda.  solicita Financiamiento para comprar Ceramica, Bondex, Porcelana y pagara mano de obra y asi brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Freddy de La Cruz lives in Juigalpa and is a building labourer in the local municipality. His wife is a housewife and, together, the couple has two children, the eldest of whom is in secondary school while the youngest attends primary. Freddy is the only one supporting the family financially and he fights every day in order to offer his family better living conditions. Thanks to Kiva, Freddy is achieving his goal but there is still a little way to go, and he still wants to make improvements to the house by putting down ceramic tiles. Freddy is applying for this loan in order to buy ceramic, Bondex and porcelain, and to pay labourers. He can then offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, Bondex and porcelain, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Mirlene

texts.es:
Mirlene es de la ciudad de Concepción, está estudiando la carrera de medicina, y comenta que su sueño siempre ha sido poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Ella es una persona que se está dedicando mucho para poder salir adelante y crecer por medio de su esfuerzo y dedicación. Y también por medio de ellos estar cerca de cumplir con las metas que se ha fijado.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad, ya que son muy costosas y quiere poder cubrirlas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
Mirlene is from the city of Concepción and is studying medicine. She says that her dream has always been to help others through her work.

Mirlene is putting in a lot of hard work in order to get ahead and to grow through her effort and dedication. Through this work, she is close to achieving her own goals.

Mirlene is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees, which are very high. Mirlene is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing and fighting for a better life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron, quarry stones, sand, little stones, and other building materials.

loans.name: Jenniffer Ii

texts.en:
Jenniffer Ii, 29 years old, is married to a farmer. She has one child and lives in their parents' house. She has been engaged in a food business since she got married. Her husband is a farmer, but farming is not enough to sustain the needs of her family. That's why she is borrowing money to have additional capital to buy what she needs in her business. 

She dreams that someday she can build their own house so she is already focused on their monthly expenses as family. She hopes also that her business expands so that she can save enough money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase meat balls, fish balls and chicken balls for her business.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Meriam successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Meriam's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marmeta

texts.en:
Marmeta works hard to support her family. Marmeta is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, spices, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta works hard to support her family. Jacinta is married and has a dried-fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Jacinta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Jacinta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional seaweed for her business for her seaweed culturing business.

Nelsie has been in this business for one year; she earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.
