She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweed for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell sand and gravel business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of sand and gravel to sell.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Doeung's Group

texts.en:
A 60-year-old mother of five children, Doeung grows rice on a two-hectare area and cassava on one hectare. She has done this current business for several years now, and it generates about 27,700 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Doeung with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of two to get a new loan and she is the leader. Doeung will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and to buy rice seeds. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and to buy rice seeds.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, age 41 and a mother of three children, is a citizen from Bovel district of Battambang province where she grows rice on three hectares of farmland. She is also a vendor. She has been with this business for several years, earning about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Phally is in her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of her past loans, which have enabled her to provide sufficient food for her children as well as to set aside some money for the future. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to pay for the plowing fee and labor costs and to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and labor costs and to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lis

texts.en:
A young mother of one little kid residing in Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district, Lis is a cassava and maize farmer. She spends her free time earning additional income working for others for a fee. She has been involved in the current business for five years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Lis with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her first loan with success, and had a positive impact of her past loan, as now her living conditions are better than before and she can provide decent meals for her child. 

Now she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fee, buy rice seed, pay labor costs, and to buy fertilizer for her crop. 

She strongly believes that she can gain a good income so that she can keep improving her livelihood in a gradual pace.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee, buy rice seed, pay labor costs, and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is a resident from the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province; she is a widow. She strives for a living via rice cropping and cassava farming as the main sources of income. She has been involved in the current business for five years. 

Srey is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She is seeking a new loan in order to pay for plowing fee, buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for labor costs. 

She strongly believes that she can gain a good income so as she can improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee, buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, 32, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Eliza has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Eliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Ernestina Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Ernestina, Soltera, su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de Nacatamales, y Tamales, con mas de 14 años de experiencia, ella necesita incrementar sus ventas para asi obtener mayor ganancia, por lo que solicita credito para la compra de Maiz, Leña, Hojas de Chaguite, Carne de Pollo y Cerdo, Papas, y otros Ingredients para realizar sus Ricos Nacatamales y Tamales para abastecer a su clientela que cada dia demandan mas este servicio, ella es el unico sustento en su hogar y los gastos basicos dependen de ella asi como los gastos Universitarios de su hija mayor y del menor que esta en primaria, ellos le ayudan en sus tiempos libres con las actividades del negocio.  El mayor objetivo de doña Ernestina es ver a sus hijos preparados y que dependan por si solos.
texts.en:
Doña Ernestina is single; her main source of income is the sale of nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan meat and rice dish) and tamales.  She has more than 14 years of experience.  She needs to increase her sales in order to get better profits, which is why she asks for a loan to buy corn, firewood, banana leaves, chicken, pork, potatoes, and other ingredients for making her delicious nacatamales and tamales.  This will allow her to supply her customers who demand more of these products every day.

Doña Ernestina is the only breadwinner in her family and the basic expenses depend on her, as do the college expenses of her oldest daughter and the youngest daughter who is in primary school.  They help her with business tasks during their free time.  Doña Ernestina's main goal is to see that her children are prepared and can rely on themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making nacatamales (traditional Nicaraguan meat and rice dish) and tamales.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Назиры средне-специальное медицинское образование, долгие годы работает медсестрой в больнице. Также с 1998 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Назиры имеется 1,60 ГА собственного земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также есть 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки минеральных удобрение и ГСМ, что поможет ей успешно подготовиться к весенне-полевым работам. Назира намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на обучение детей в университете.
texts.en:
Nazira is 41 and married with three children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working as a nurse in a hospital for many years. In addition, since 1998 she has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture, a business she began with 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now owns 1.6 hectares of land on which she harvests beans every year, both for her own use and for sale. She also has two milking cows, one horse and 30 sheep. Her total monthly income is 20,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nazira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel, which will help her successfully prepare for spring work in the fields. She is eager to receive a good harvest, which will lead to an improvement in her family's financial situation. She wants to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock and plans to save toward her children's university education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Analo

texts.en: Analo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Analo has been in this business for six years. In the future, Analo would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Chab's Group

texts.en:
Chab is 30 and is a villager from the Bovel district of the Battambang province. She earns a living via rice farming and her pig-raising business. She can supplement her income through working for others for a fee. This is the sixth loan for Chab and the second loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), with a successful repayment of the past loan. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before and she can afford to buy three square meals for her family. 

This cycle, she is requesting a loan amount of 1,800,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting a loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, to buy pigs for raising, and to buy pig‘s feed. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, to buy pigs for raising, and to buy pig‘s feed

loans.name: Kalicha

texts.ru: Калича, 62 года, вдова, мать 5 дочерей. У Каличы- высшее образование, уже много лет она работает в школе учителем математики, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки 30 овец на 120,000 сомов (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Каличы имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 85 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калича обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота и дальнейшей его реализации. Доходы от кредита Калича планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на обучение своих дочерей.
texts.en:
Kalicha is 62 and a widow with five children. She has a higher education and has been working as a math teacher in a school for many years. To earn extra money for her family, she also works in animal husbandry, a business she began 10 years ago with the purchase of 30 sheep for 120,000 KGS. She now has two milking cows and 85 sheep, with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Kalicha has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase lambs for eventual resale. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her livestock head count, and wants to save toward her daughters' education.

loans.use: to purchase lambs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn, vegetable oil, and sugar

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гулнуре 22 года, замужем,есть 1 ребенок. У Гулнуры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Стартовав в 2011 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулнуры имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 лошади. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочной продукции составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, что позволит также увеличить объем продаваемого молока, а соответственно и улучшить благосостояние семьи. Доходы от кредита Гулнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на постройку нового дома.
texts.en:
Gulnura is 22 and married with one child. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 2011. She now has two milking cows and three horses with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS from the sale of milk and dairy products.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulnura has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 KGS to purchase a cow and increase her number of livestock, which will allow her to increase the quantity of milk she sells and, consequently, to improve her family's well-being. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and wants to save toward building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Rodilla

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Rodilla works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rodilla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business. Rodilla has been sustaining her business activities with her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of having more fishing boats.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 62 years old, a widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. Francisca has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, including shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Jonalyne

texts.en: Jonalyne is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for the four children, who are currently in school. Jonalyne runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory, including candies, bread, biscuits, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap and cooking oil. Jonalyne has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jonalyne would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store, including candies, bread, biscuits, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong, 35, is a villager from the Bovel district of the Battambang province. She is married and has three children. To provide security for her family, rice cropping and paid-working jobs are the only sources of income that she has had. She has been involved in her current business for several years and it earns her about 40,000 KHR. This is not the original loan for Hong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to provide for her children's basic needs. 

Now, she has teamed up, in a group of two, to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, to buy seeds, and to pay for labor costs. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, to buy seeds, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang is 35 years old and a married mother blessed with two children. Her main sources of income are from pig-raising and her salaried job, which she has held for 12 years. This is Samnang’s second microloan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She successfully repaid her past loan, which enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now she is leading a group of two to obtain a new loan. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR, and her co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion of the loan to buy pig feed. She strongly hopes that she can have a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en:
Saly, a mother of three dependent children in her early 30s, is a villager from the Bovel district of the Battambang province. She is a local farmer who grows rice and sesame as her main source of income. She has been involved in this current business for 12 years and earns about 43,000 KHR per day. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, rice seeds, and labor costs. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield with a good income in return, so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, rice seeds, and labor costs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
This is Veronica, 54, resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Veronica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 32,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Veronica dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have her own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Sareth (in the photo) is 39 years old. She lives in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons; one works in chicken farming and another one is still young. 

Sareth stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary; he is a policeman. She wants to replace a motorbike for her husband because the old one is breaking very often. 

Sareth hopes the lenders will offer this transportation loan!

loans.use: To replace her husband's motorbike.

loans.name: Sithan

texts.en:
Sithan lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He has three young children: one son and two daughters. His wife stays at home and does housework.

Sithan is a moto kangbei taxi driver (shown in photo). In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Anyway, Sithan wants to put an addition on the house where he lives. It would be larger and easier to live in; hence, he decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: To put an addition on the house where he lives.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 55 years old and married with five children.

Juanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Juanita has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Juanita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jumdaya

texts.en:
Jumdaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Jumdaya has been in this business for 4 years. Jumdaya earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 46 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Merlinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional liqueur, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Merlinda has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Merlinda would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional liqueur, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc
